src: サッカーのイタリア代表は、ドイツ代表と並んで世界で2番目に成績の良いチームで、2006年にはFIFAワールドカップで優勝しています。 人気のスポーツは、サッカー、バスケットボール、バレーボール、水球、フェンシング、ラグビー、サイクリング、アイスホッケー、ローラーホッケー、F1モーターレースなどです。 北部地域ではウィンタースポーツが盛んで、国際試合やオリンピックに出場するイタリア人選手を輩出しています。
mt: Italy's national football team is second only to Germany in the world rankings, and won the 2006 FIFA World Cup. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey, and Formula One motor racing. Winter sports are popular in the northern regions, and Italy has produced many international competitors and Olympic athletes.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: ルクセンブルクは歴史の長い国ですが独立は1839年に遡ります。 現在のベルギー領の一部は過去にルクセンブルク領でしたが、1830年代のベルギー革命後にベルギー領になりました。 ルクセンブルクは、常に中立国としての立場を守ろうと努めていましたが、 第一次世界大戦でも第二次世界大戦でもドイツに占領されました。 1957年にルクセンブルクは現在の欧州連合（EU）の創設メンバーとなりました。
mt: Luxembourg is a long-lived country, but its independence dates back to 1839. Parts of what is now Belgium were once part of Luxembourg, but became part of Belgium after the Belgian Revolution of the 1830s. Luxembourg has always striven to maintain a neutral position, but was occupied by Germany during both World War I and World War II. Luxembourg became a founding member of the current European Union in 1957.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: ヨーロッパ側のトルコ（バルカン半島の東トラキアまたはルメリア）は国土の3%を占めています。 トルコの領土は、長さ1,600 km以上、幅800 km以上でのほぼ長方形です。 湖を含めたトルコの面積は783,562 km2（300,948平方マイル）で、そのうち南西アジアが755,688 km2（291,773平方マイル）、ヨーロッパが23,764 km2（9,174平方マイル）です。 トルコの面積は世界で37番目に大きく、フランス本土とイギリスを合わせた大きさとほぼ同じです。 トルコは三方を海に囲まれた国で、西はエーゲ海、北は黒海、南は地中海にそれぞれ面しています。
mt: 3% of Turkey's land is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia). Turkey's territory is a nearly rectangular shape, over 1,600 km long and over 800 km wide. Including lakes, Turkey's area is 783,562 km2 (300,948 sq mi), of which Southwestern Asia is 755,688 km2 (291,773 sq mi) and Europe is 23,764 km2 (9,174 sq mi). Turkey's area is the 37th largest in the world, and is almost the same size as the combined area of France and the United Kingdom. Turkey is a country surrounded by sea on three sides, facing the Aegean Sea, the Black Sea, and the Mediterranean Sea, respectively.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: バチカン市国の人口は約800人です。世界最小の独立国であり、最も人口が少ない国でもあります。 バチカン市国では、法律や公式通信でイタリア語を使用しています。 バチカン市国で働く人々のほとんどが日常的に使用する言語はイタリア語であり、宗教的な儀式ではラテン語がよく使用されています。 バチカン市国の市民は全員がローマ・カトリックです。
mt: Vatican City has a population of about 800. It is the smallest independent country and the least populous country.  Italian is used in law and official communications in Vatican City.  Most people who work in Vatican City use Italian in their daily lives, and Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.  All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: バチカン市国の人口は約800人です。世界最小の独立国であり、最も人口が少ない国でもあります。 バチカン市国では、法律や公式通信でイタリア語を使用しています。 バチカン市国で働く人々のほとんどが日常的に使用する言語はイタリア語であり、宗教的な儀式ではラテン語がよく使用されています。 バチカン市国の市民は全員がローマ・カトリックです。
mt: Vatican City has a population of about 800. It is the smallest independent country and the least populous country.  Italian is used in law and official communications in Vatican City.  Most people who work in Vatican City use Italian in their daily lives, and Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.  All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: 今日、コンピュータは写真や動画の操作に使用されています。 コンピューターで高度なアニメーションを制作でき、そういったアニメーションがテレビや映画で放映されることが増えています。 多くの場合、音楽は高性能コンピュータで記録され、サウンドの処理やミキシングがされます。
mt: Today, computers are used to manipulate photographs and videos.  Computers can create complex animations, and these animations are increasingly being broadcast on television and in movies.  In many cases, music is recorded on high-performance computers, and sound processing and mixing are performed.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: ハラッパーやモヘンジョダロの都市では、下水道が整備され、ほとんどすべての住居に水洗トイレがありました。 ギリシャのクレタ島やサントリーニ島のミノアの都市の家々では、下水道の遺構が発見されています。 古代のエジプト、ペルシャ、中国にもトイレはありました。ローマ文明の時代には混浴公衆浴場設備の一部として設けられていた例もあります。
mt: In Harappa and Mohenjo-daro, cities, sewage systems were built, and almost all dwellings had flush toilets. In the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini, the remains of sewage systems have been found. Ancient Egypt, Persia, and China also had toilets. In the Roman era, they were part of the facilities in public baths.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: 現代のアイススケート靴の刃（ブレード）は、2枚のエッジとその間に凹形の空洞から成り、2枚のエッジは刃が傾いた状態でも氷をより的確に捉えます。 ブレードの底部がわずかに湾曲しているため、ブレードが片側かもう片側に傾くと、氷と接触しているエッジも湾曲します。 これを利用してスケート選手はターンします。スケート選手はスケートが右に傾けば右を向き、左に傾けば左を向きます。
mt: The blades of modern ice skates are made of two edges and a concave indentation between them, and the edges can catch the ice more accurately even when they are tilted. The bottom of the blades is slightly curved, so when the blades are tilted to one side or the other, the edges that are in contact with the ice are also curved. Skaters use this to turn. Skaters turn to the right when the skates are tilted to the right, and to the left when they are tilted to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: 現代のアイススケート靴の刃（ブレード）は、2枚のエッジとその間に凹形の空洞から成り、2枚のエッジは刃が傾いた状態でも氷をより的確に捉えます。 ブレードの底部がわずかに湾曲しているため、ブレードが片側かもう片側に傾くと、氷と接触しているエッジも湾曲します。 これを利用してスケート選手はターンします。スケート選手はスケートが右に傾けば右を向き、左に傾けば左を向きます。

src: かつてのエネルギー準位に復帰するためには、光から得た余分なエネルギーを除去しなければなりません。 「光子」と呼ばれる光の小粒子の放出によるものです。 科学者たちはこのプロセスを「放射線の刺激放出」と呼びますが、これは明るい光によって原子が刺激を受けて光の粒子を放出するためであり、光は放射線の一種です。 次の写真は、原子が光子を放出している様子です。もちろん、実際には写真よりもはるかに微小です。 光子は原子を構成する物質よりもさらに微小な粒子です！
mt: To return to the original energy level, the excess energy gained from light must be removed. This is done by the emission of photons, which are small particles of light. Scientists call this process "stimulated emission" because the atom is stimulated by light to emit photons, and light is a form of radiation. The following picture shows an atom emitting photons. Of course, in reality, the picture is much smaller than it appears. Photons are even smaller particles than the material that makes up the atom!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: 何百時間か使用を続けると、最終的に電球内のフィラメントが燃え尽きて電球は点灯しなくなります。 そこで必要になるのが電球の交換です。電球を交換する際には注意が必要です。 まず、照明器具のスイッチを切るか、ケーブルを外す必要があります。 これは、電球の一部がソケット内にあるときに、ソケットや電球の金属部に触れると、電球の金属部が接しているソケットに流れる電流によって激しい感電を起こすことがあるためです。
mt: After hundreds of hours of use, the filament inside the bulb eventually burns out and the bulb stops lighting.  At this point, a bulb replacement is necessary.  When replacing a bulb, care must be taken.  First, the light fixture's switch must be cut or the cable must be removed.  This is because, when some parts of the bulb are inside the socket, touching the socket or the metal part of the bulb can cause a strong electric shock to occur by the electric current flowing through the metal part of the bulb to the socket it is connected to.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: 何百時間か使用を続けると、最終的に電球内のフィラメントが燃え尽きて電球は点灯しなくなります。 そこで必要になるのが電球の交換です。電球を交換する際には注意が必要です。 まず、照明器具のスイッチを切るか、ケーブルを外す必要があります。 これは、電球の一部がソケット内にあるときに、ソケットや電球の金属部に触れると、電球の金属部が接しているソケットに流れる電流によって激しい感電を起こすことがあるためです。

src: 核爆弾は、1つの原子核に多くの陽子と中性子を集めるにはエネルギーが必要であるという原理で作用します。 重い荷車を転がして丘を登っていくようなものです。原子核を再び分裂させると、そのエネルギーの一部が放出されます。 原子の中には不安定な原子核を持つものがあり、その原子核は、ほとんど何もしなくても分裂してしまう傾向があります。
mt: A nuclear bomb works by bringing together many protons and neutrons with a single atomic nucleus. It's like pushing a heavy cart up a hill. When the atoms split again, some of the energy is released. Some atoms have unstable atomic nuclei that are prone to splitting even without much effort.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: 何千マイルも離れた場所にいる相手に電話をかけると自動的に衛星を経由した通話になります。 宇宙にある人工衛星は通話を受信して、ほぼ瞬時にそれを反映します。 衛星はロケットで宇宙に送られました。科学者が宇宙で望遠鏡を使う理由は、地球の大気によって人間の視界に入る光や景色の一部が歪むからです。 衛星や望遠鏡を打ち上げて宇宙空間に配備するためには、まず高さ100フィート以上の巨大ロケットが必要です。
mt: When you call someone who is far away, the call goes through a satellite. Satellites in space receive the call and reflect it back almost instantly. Satellites are launched by rockets. Scientists use telescopes in space because some light and scenery that enters the human eye is distorted by the Earth's atmosphere. To deploy satellites or telescopes in space, you first need a giant rocket that is at least 100 feet tall.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: 時間とは、身近にあって私たちのあらゆる活動に影響を与えるものでありながら、理解しにくい概念です。 時間については何千年も前から宗教家、哲学者、科学者が研究を重ねてきました。 私たちは、時間を未来から現在を経て過去に至るまでの一連の出来事として経験します。 時間は、出来事の継続時間（長さ）を比べる方法でもあります。 周期的な出来事の繰り返しを観察することで、時間の経過を自分で目印にすることができます。周期的な出来事とは、何度も定期的に発生することです。
mt: Time is a concept that is close to us and affects all our activities, but is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious leaders, philosophers, and scientists for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events from the future to the present and then to the past. Time can also be used to compare the duration of events. You can use the recurrence of periodic events to keep track of the passage of time. Periodic events are those that happen repeatedly at regular intervals.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: 時間とは、身近にあって私たちのあらゆる活動に影響を与えるものでありながら、理解しにくい概念です。 時間については何千年も前から宗教家、哲学者、科学者が研究を重ねてきました。 私たちは、時間を未来から現在を経て過去に至るまでの一連の出来事として経験します。 時間は、出来事の継続時間（長さ）を比べる方法でもあります。 周期的な出来事の繰り返しを観察することで、時間の経過を自分で目印にすることができます。周期的な出来事とは、何度も定期的に発生することです。

src: 伝統的に、王位継承者は学校卒業後にそのまま軍に入ります。 ただし、チャールズはケンブリッジ大学のトリニティ・カレッジに進学し、人類学と考古学を専攻し、後に歴史学を学び、2:2（2等学位）を取得しました。 チャールズは英国王室で初めて学位を取得した人物です。
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would enter the military after graduation. However, Charles attended Cambridge University's Trinity College, majoring in anthropology and archaeology, and later in history, and received a 2:2 (second class degree).
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: 伝統的に、王位継承者は学校卒業後にそのまま軍に入ります。 ただし、チャールズはケンブリッジ大学のトリニティ・カレッジに進学し、人類学と考古学を専攻し、後に歴史学を学び、2:2（2等学位）を取得しました。 チャールズは英国王室で初めて学位を取得した人物です。

However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: イングランドは、ダネローを再び征服した後、長い平和な時代を経験していました。 しかし、991年にエセルレッドは100年前のグトルム以来の大規模な海賊艦隊に直面しました。 この艦隊を率いたのは、デンマークの支配から自国を取り戻すという野望を抱くノルウェー人のオラフ・トリグヴァッソンでした。 初の軍事的な挫折の後、エセルレッドはオラフと条件の合意に至ったのの、オラフはノルウェーに戻って失敗と成功を繰り返しながら王国を手に入れようとしました。
mt: England had enjoyed a long period of peace after reconquering Danes in 991, but in 991, Ethelred faced a large pirate fleet for the first time in a century. The fleet was led by Olaf Tryggvason, a Norwegian who had ambitions to regain his homeland from Danish rule. After an initial military setback, Ethelred agreed to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try and win the kingdom through success and failure.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: 15世紀頃、エストニア北部はドイツの大きな文化的影響を受けていました。 一部のドイツ人僧侶たちは、神を現地の人々にとって身近なものにしたいと思い、エストニア文字の言語を発明しました。 ドイツ語のアルファベットをベースに、「Õ/õ」の1文字が追加されました。 時が経つにつれ、ドイツ語から借用した多くの言葉が融合されていきました。これが啓蒙の始まりでした。
mt: 15th century, northern Estonia was under the great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to make the god closer to the local people, so they invented the Estonian language. One letter, "Õ/õ" was added to the German alphabet. Over time, many words borrowed from German were merged. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: ヒンディー語を話す人の数を推計する方法はいろいろあります。ヒンディー語は世界で2番目から4番目によく話されている言語であると推定されています。 母語話者の人数は、言語的に非常に近い方言を数に入れるかどうかによって変わってきます。 推定では3億4千万～5億人がこの言語を話し、8億人がこの言語を理解しているとされます。 ヒンディー語とウルドゥー語は、文字は異なりますが語彙は似ています。日常会話の場合、どちらかの言語を話す人同士であれば、たいていは互いに意思疎通ができます。
mt: There are many ways to estimate the number of people who speak Hindi. Hindi is estimated to be the second or fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not you count dialects that are linguistically very similar. Estimates range from 400 million to 500 million people who speak this language, and 800 million people who understand it. Hindi and Urdu have different scripts, but their vocabularies are similar. In everyday conversation, people who speak either language can usually communicate with each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: ヒンディー語を話す人の数を推計する方法はいろいろあります。ヒンディー語は世界で2番目から4番目によく話されている言語であると推定されています。 母語話者の人数は、言語的に非常に近い方言を数に入れるかどうかによって変わってきます。 推定では3億4千万～5億人がこの言語を話し、8億人がこの言語を理解しているとされます。 ヒンディー語とウルドゥー語は、文字は異なりますが語彙は似ています。日常会話の場合、どちらかの言語を話す人同士であれば、たいていは互いに意思疎通ができます。
mt: There are many ways to estimate the number of people who speak Hindi. Hindi is estimated to be the second or fourth most widely spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not you count dialects that are linguistically very similar. Estimates range from 400 million to 500 million people who speak this language, and 800 million people who understand it. Hindi and Urdu have different scripts, but their vocabularies are similar. In everyday conversation, people who speak either language can usually communicate with each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: ハングルは、日常的に使われている唯一の字母です。字母は世宗時代(1418～1450)の1444年に発明されました。 世宗（セジョン）王は朝鮮王朝の第4代王であり、最も評価の高い王の1人です。 当初、彼はハングル文字を「訓民正音」と名付けたましたが、これは「民衆の指導のための正しい音」という意味です。
mt: Hangul is the only alphabet in everyday use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the Joseon Dynasty (1418–1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and one of the most highly regarded kings. At first, he named the alphabet "Hunminjeongeum," which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people."
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: ハングルは、日常的に使われている唯一の字母です。字母は世宗時代(1418～1450)の1444年に発明されました。 世宗（セジョン）王は朝鮮王朝の第4代王であり、最も評価の高い王の1人です。 当初、彼はハングル文字を「訓民正音」と名付けたましたが、これは「民衆の指導のための正しい音」という意味です。
mt: Hangul is the only alphabet in everyday use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the Joseon Dynasty (1418–1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and one of the most highly regarded kings. At first, he named the alphabet "Hunminjeongeum," which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people."
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: サンスクリット語がどのようにして誕生したかについては諸説あります。その1つは、西方からインドにアーリア人が移住してきて、彼らの言語を持ち込んだという説です。 サンスクリット語は古代語であり、ヨーロッパのラテン語に相当します。 世界で最も早く知られている本は、サンスクリット語で書かれていました。ウパニシャッドが編纂された後、サンスクリット語は階級制度のために衰退しました。 サンスクリット語は非常に複雑かつ豊かな言語です。ちょうどラテン語がフランス語やスペイン語などヨーロッパ言語の起源であるように、この言語は多くの現代インド語の起源となっています。
mt: Theories abound as to how Sanskrit came to be. One theory is that the Aryans migrated from the west to India and brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language, comparable to Latin. The oldest known books were written in Sanskrit. After the Upanishads were compiled, Sanskrit declined due to class system. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language. Just as Latin is the origin of French and Spanish, this language is the origin of many modern Indian languages.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: イオの重力はどのようにかかるのでしょうか。イオの地表に立ったとしたら、地球にいるときよりも体重が少なくなるでしょう。 地球で体重200ポンド（90kg）の人はイオでは約36ポンド（16kg）になります。当然、重力は軽くなります。
mt: How does gravity work on Io? If you stood on Io's surface, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kilograms) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kilograms) on Io. Of course, gravity is lighter.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: 月面は岩石と塵でできています。月の外層は地殻と呼ばれています。 地殻の厚さは、手前側が約70 km、奥側が約100 kmです。 海の下は薄く、高地の下は厚くなっています。 地殻が薄いため、近い方には海が多くなることがあります。溶岩が浮上しやすくなっていました。
mt: The moon's surface is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and about 100 km thick on the far side. The crust is thinner under the sea and thicker under the highlands. The crust was rising more easily near the sea.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: 月面は岩石と塵でできています。月の外層は地殻と呼ばれています。 地殻の厚さは、手前側が約70 km、奥側が約100 kmです。 海の下は薄く、高地の下は厚くなっています。 地殻が薄いため、近い方には海が多くなることがあります。溶岩が浮上しやすくなっていました。

src: 多くの人々は、人間が別の星に旅行し、別世界を探索できる日を夢見ています。宇宙に何があるのか知りたがっている人もいれば、別の惑星に宇宙人や他の生命体が住んでいると信じている人もいます。 しかし、仮にそれが起きたとしても、おそらくそう長時間は続かないでしょう。星は非常に拡散的で「隣同士」の星間の距離は何兆マイルもあるのでます。 もしかしたら、あなたのひ孫たちが異星人の惑星に降り立って、古代の祖先に思いを馳せる日が来るかもしれません。
mt: Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to other stars and explore other worlds. Some people want to know what is out there in space, and some people believe that aliens or other life forms live on other planets. However, if that were to happen, it probably wouldn't last very long. Stars are very dispersed, and the distance between "neighbors" of interstellar space is trillions of miles. Maybe your great-grandchildren will land on an alien planet and think of their ancient ancestors.
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: 太陽には、地球のような地殻（つまり、人間が立てる場所）はありません。太陽全体がガスと火とプラズマでできています。 太陽の中心から離れるほど、ガスは希薄になります。 太陽を眺めたときに見える外側の部分を光球といい、これは「光の玉」という意味です。
mt: The sun has no crust (that is, no place for humans to stand). The sun is made entirely of gas and fire and plasma. The gas becomes less dense as you move away from the sun's center. The outer part of the sun that you see when you look at it is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light."
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: 太陽には、地球のような地殻（つまり、人間が立てる場所）はありません。太陽全体がガスと火とプラズマでできています。 太陽の中心から離れるほど、ガスは希薄になります。 太陽を眺めたときに見える外側の部分を光球といい、これは「光の玉」という意味です。
mt: The sun has no crust (that is, no place for humans to stand). The sun is made entirely of gas and fire and plasma. The gas becomes less dense as you move away from the sun's center. The outer part of the sun that you see when you look at it is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light."

The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: 約3,000年後の1610年、イタリアの天文学者ガリレオ・ガリレイが望遠鏡を使って観測し、金星にも月と同じように満ち欠けがあることを発見しました。 金星の位相は、太陽に面した金星（または月）の側面のみが明るくなるために発生します。金星の満ち欠けは、惑星は太陽の周りを回っているというコペルニクスの理論を裏付けるものでした。 そして数年後の1639年にイギリスの天文学者ジェレミア・ホロックスが金星の通過を観測しました。
mt: 3,000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to discover that Venus also has phases, just like the moon. The phases of Venus occur because only the side of Venus facing the sun is bright. Venus's phases supported Copernicus's theory that planets revolve around the sun. And a few years later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed the transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: 約3,000年後の1610年、イタリアの天文学者ガリレオ・ガリレイが望遠鏡を使って観測し、金星にも月と同じように満ち欠けがあることを発見しました。 金星の位相は、太陽に面した金星（または月）の側面のみが明るくなるために発生します。金星の満ち欠けは、惑星は太陽の周りを回っているというコペルニクスの理論を裏付けるものでした。 そして数年後の1639年にイギリスの天文学者ジェレミア・ホロックスが金星の通過を観測しました。

src: アマゾン川は、地球上で2番目に長く、最も大きい川です。水量は2番目に大きい川の8倍を上回ります。 アマゾン川は地球上で最も広い川でもあり、川幅が6マイルに及ぶ場所もあります。 地球上の川から海に注ぐ水の20%は、アマゾン川から流れ出ています。 アマゾン川の本流は長さ6,387 km（3,980マイル）に及びます。この川は、何千という小さな川から水流を集めています。
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and largest river on Earth. Its water volume exceeds that of the second largest river by eight times. The Amazon River is also the widest river on Earth, with some places being 6 miles wide. Twenty percent of the water that flows from rivers into the sea comes from the Amazon River. The main stem of the Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles) long. This river collects water from thousands of small rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: ベネズエラ人の18%が失業者であり、就業者のほとんどは非公式経済で働いています。 ベネズエラで働く人の3分の2がサービス業、4分の1近くが工業、5分の1が農業に従事しています。 ベネズエラ人にとって石油は重要な産業であり、石油産業に従事する人はわずか1%に過ぎないにもかかわらず、同国は純輸出国です。
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two-thirds of Venezuelans work in the service industry, one-quarter in industry, and one-fifth in agriculture. Oil is an important industry for Venezuelans, but those who work in the oil industry make up only 1% of the workforce, despite the country being a net exporter.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: 星が光や熱を発する原因は、水素原子が合体（融合）してより重い元素になるときにエネルギーが生じるためです。 科学者たちは、同じようにエネルギーを生み出せる原子炉の開発に取り組んでいます。 しかし、この問題を解決するのは非常に難しく、実用的な核融合炉ができるまでには何年もかかるでしょう。
mt: Stars shine and glow because of the energy released when hydrogen atoms fuse together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to develop reactors that can do the same. However, solving this problem is very difficult, and it may be many years before a practical nuclear fusion reactor is ready.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: 物質がある状態から別の状態に移行しても元素や化合物は変化しません。 気体としての窒素には液体窒素と同じ性質があります。液体の方が高密度ですが、分子数は同じです。 水もその一例です。水は水素原子2つと酸素原子1つで構成される化合物です。 気体、液体、固体のいずれの状態でも分子構造は変わりません。 物理的な状態が変化しても、化学的な状態は変わりません。
mt: A substance can change from one state to another without changing its elements or compounds. Nitrogen gas has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid is denser, but the number of molecules is the same. Water is also an example. Water is a compound made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. The molecular structure does not change in any of the three states. The physical state changes, but the chemical state does not.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: 独立戦争中に13州はまず連合規約に基づいて弱い中央政府を形成し、連邦議会はその唯一の構成要素でした。 議会には課税する権限がなく、国の執行機関や司法機関がなかったため、議会のすべての行為を州当局に頼っていましたが、州当局はしばしば非協力的でした。 州間の税法や関税を無効にする権限もありませんでした。 条項の改正には、全州から全会一致の同意が必要でしたが、各州は中央政府を軽視していたので、代表者が欠席することもしばしばでした。
mt: 13 states formed a weak central government based on the Articles of Confederation during the Revolutionary War. The Congress was the only component of the government and had no taxing authority, no executive branch, and no judicial branch. It relied on the state governments for all of its actions, but the state governments were often uncooperative. It had no authority to invalidate interstate taxes or tariffs. Amendments required unanimous agreement from all states, but representatives often missed meetings because they did not take the central government seriously.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: 独立戦争中に13州はまず連合規約に基づいて弱い中央政府を形成し、連邦議会はその唯一の構成要素でした。 議会には課税する権限がなく、国の執行機関や司法機関がなかったため、議会のすべての行為を州当局に頼っていましたが、州当局はしばしば非協力的でした。 州間の税法や関税を無効にする権限もありませんでした。 条項の改正には、全州から全会一致の同意が必要でしたが、各州は中央政府を軽視していたので、代表者が欠席することもしばしばでした。
mt: 13 states formed a weak central government based on the Articles of Confederation during the Revolutionary War. The Congress was the only component of the government and had no taxing authority, no executive branch, and no judicial branch. It relied on the state governments for all of its actions, but the state governments were often uncooperative. It had no authority to invalidate interstate taxes or tariffs. Amendments required unanimous agreement from all states, but representatives often missed meetings because they did not take the central government seriously.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: 映画「ナショナル・トレジャー」を見たことがある人は、アメリカ独立宣言書の裏に宝の地図が書かれていると思っているかもしれません。 しかし、そうではありませんでした。裏面に何か書かれていますが宝の地図ではありませんでした。 独立宣言書の裏面に書かれていたのは、「1776年7月4日付の独立宣言書原本」という標題でした。標題は書類の末尾に逆さまに記されています。 誰が書いたのかは不明ですが、この大きな羊皮紙（29.75インチ×24.5インチと測定）はその実用初期に巻かれた状態で保管されてしたことがわかっています。 そのため、単にラベルとして表記が追加されがちです。
mt: If you have seen the movie "National Treasure," you may think that the map to the treasure was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.  However, it was not.  Something was written on the back, but it was not a map to the treasure.  The back of the Declaration of Independence had a title called "Original Declaration of Independence, July 4, 1776."  The title was written backwards at the end of the document.  It is unknown who wrote it, but it was kept in its original rolled state, which is why it is often labeled as a mere label.
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: 独立当初、シンガポール植物園の専門知識を活かして、島は熱帯のガーデンシティに生まれ変わりました。 1981年には、ランの交配種であるヴァンダ・ミス・ジョアキムが国花に選ばれました。
mt: 1981, the orchid hybrid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: 独立当初、シンガポール植物園の専門知識を活かして、島は熱帯のガーデンシティに生まれ変わりました。 1981年には、ランの交配種であるヴァンダ・ミス・ジョアキムが国花に選ばれました。
mt: 1981, the orchid hybrid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: 石造りピラミッドの建設は旧王国末期まで続きましたが、ギザのピラミッドは、その大きさと建設の技術的な卓越性で他を凌いでいました。 新王国の古代エジプト人たちは、当時千年以上前に建てられた前身のモニュメントに驚嘆しました。
mt: Construction of stone pyramids continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, but the Great Pyramid of Giza was the largest and most technologically advanced of its kind. The ancient Egyptians of the New Kingdom were amazed at the monuments built a thousand years earlier.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: 毎年10月頃には、150万頭近くの草食動物が、雨を求めて北の丘からマラ川を渡り、南の平原に向かって移動します。 そして西を通って北に戻り、4月頃の雨季が過ぎた後で再びマラ川を渡ります。 セレンゲティ地域には、セレンゲティ国立公園、タンザニアのンゴロンゴロ保全地域とマスワ動物保護区、ケニアのマサイマラ国立保護区などがあります。
mt: 150,000 or more herbivores migrate north from the Serengeti plains to the Mara River every October, and back again in April, following the rains. The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and the Masai Mara National Reserve in Tanzania, and the Masai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: 毎年10月頃には、150万頭近くの草食動物が、雨を求めて北の丘からマラ川を渡り、南の平原に向かって移動します。 そして西を通って北に戻り、4月頃の雨季が過ぎた後で再びマラ川を渡ります。 セレンゲティ地域には、セレンゲティ国立公園、タンザニアのンゴロンゴロ保全地域とマスワ動物保護区、ケニアのマサイマラ国立保護区などがあります。

src: フランスとの戦いが終わり、ドイツはイギリスへの侵攻の準備を始めました。 ドイツはこの攻撃に「シーリオン作戦」という暗号名を付けました。イギリス軍の重火器や物資のほとんどは、ダンカークから避難したときに失われていたので、軍はかなり弱体でした。 しかし、英国海軍は当時のドイツ海軍（Kriegsmarine）よりもはるかに強く、英仏海峡を越えて送られてきたどんな侵略艦隊も撃破できました。 しかし、提督たちはドイツの航空攻撃で撃沈されることを恐れていたので、イギリス海軍の艦船はほとんど侵略ルートの近くに拠点を置いていませんでした。
mt: After the fighting with France ended, Germany began preparing to invade Britain. Germany called this attack the "Sealion Operation". Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies were lost when they evacuated Dunkirk, so the army was quite weak. However, the British Navy was much stronger than the German Navy (Kriegsmarine) at the time, and could have sunk any invasion fleet that crossed the English Channel. However, the admirals were afraid of being sunk by German air attacks, so British Navy ships were not stationed near the invasion route.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: まずはイタリアの計画について説明しましょう。イタリアは主にドイツと日本の「弟分」でした。 開戦直前に新しい4隻を造船したにもかかわらず、陸海軍とも弱かった。 イタリアの主な標的はアフリカ諸国でした。標的の国々を攻略するには、軍隊が地中海を横断してアフリカに侵攻する必要があり、その橋頭保となる場所が必要でした。 そのためには、エジプトにあるイギリスの基地や艦船を排除しなければなりませんでした。そうした措置を除いて、イタリアの戦艦は何もしてはいけないという決まりでした。 さて、日本はと言えば、イギリスと同じ島国でした。
mt: Let's start with the Italian plan. Italy was mainly the "little brother" of Germany and Japan. Despite building four new ships just before the war, both the army and navy were weak. Italy's main targets were African countries. To conquer the target countries, the army had to cross the Mediterranean and invade Africa, and a bridgehead was needed. To do this, they had to eliminate the British bases and ships in Egypt. Otherwise, the Italian battleships had to do nothing. That was the rule.  As for Japan, it was an island nation like Britain.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."

src: Dデイの上陸作戦とそれに続く戦闘でフランス北部は解放されましたが、南部はまだ解放されていませんでした。 統治者は「ビシー」のフランス人たちでした。彼らは1940年にドイツ軍と和平を結び、侵略者と戦うのではなく、侵略者に協力したフランス人たちです。 1940年8月15日、連合国は南フランスに侵攻し、その侵攻は「ドラグーン作戦」と呼ばれました。 わずか2週間でアメリカ軍と自由フランス軍は南フランスを解放し、ドイツに向かっていました。
mt: The D-Day landings and subsequent fighting had liberated northern France, but southern France was still not liberated. The rulers were the Frenchmen of "Vichy". They had made peace with the German army in 1940 and had not fought the invaders, but had cooperated with the invaders as Frenchmen. On August 15, 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, and the invasion was called the "Dragoon Operation". In just two weeks, the American and Free French armies liberated southern France and were heading towards Germany.
ref: "The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free. It was ruled by the ""Vichy"" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them. On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called ""Operation Dragoon"". In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany."

src: 潜水艦は水中に潜ったまま移動するように設計された船であり、長時間にわたる潜航が可能です。 潜水艦は第一次世界大戦と第二次世界大戦で使用されました。当時の潜水艦は非常に遅く、射程距離も限られていました。 開戦当初は海上航行による移動が多かったものの、レーダーの発達や精度の向上に伴い、潜水艦は水面下に潜ることを余儀なくされました。 ドイツ軍の潜水艦はUボートと呼ばれていました。ドイツ人は潜水艦の航行や操作に非常に得意のです。 潜水艦で成功したドイツは、戦後は何隻も保有するほど信頼されなくなりました。
mt: Submarines are designed to move underwater for long periods of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. At the time, submarines were very slow and had limited range. Initially, most travel was done above water, but as radar became more advanced and more precise, submarines were forced to stay underwater. German submarines were called U-boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating submarines. After the war, Germany lost its trust in submarines and owned many of them.
ref: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time. Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range. In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen. German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines. Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.

src: 1939年9月17日までに、ポーランドの防衛はすでに破られており、唯一の希望はルーマニアの橋頭堡に沿って退却し、再編成することでした。 しかし、これらの計画はほぼ一夜にして過去のものとなりました。ソビエト連邦赤軍の80万人以上の兵士が、リガ講和条約、ソビエト・ポーランド不可侵条約、その他の国際条約（二国間および多国間）に違反してポーランド東部地域を侵攻した後、ベラルーシ戦線とウクライナ戦線を形成したのです。
mt: By September 17, 1939, Poland's defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat along the Romanian bridgehead and reorganize. However, these plans were almost overnight rendered obsolete. The Soviet Union's Red Army of over 800,000 soldiers invaded the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties (both bilateral and multilateral) and formed the Białystok and Kiev offensives.
ref: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead. However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.

src: 1939年9月17日までに、ポーランドの防衛はすでに破られており、唯一の希望はルーマニアの橋頭堡に沿って退却し、再編成することでした。 しかし、これらの計画はほぼ一夜にして過去のものとなりました。ソビエト連邦赤軍の80万人以上の兵士が、リガ講和条約、ソビエト・ポーランド不可侵条約、その他の国際条約（二国間および多国間）に違反してポーランド東部地域を侵攻した後、ベラルーシ戦線とウクライナ戦線を形成したのです。

src: 北アフリカにいるイタリア軍にとって、ほとんど最初から状況は芳しくありませんでした。1940年6月10日のイタリアによる宣戦布告から1週間以内に、イギリスの第11フッサール軍がリビアのカプッツォ要塞を占領しました。 イギリス軍はバルディアの東方で待ち伏せし、イタリア第10軍工兵司令官ラストゥッチ将軍を捕虜にした。 6月28日、リビア総督でムッソリーニの後継者と考えられていたイタロ・バルボ元帥は、トブルークに上陸中に友軍からの銃撃を受けて死亡しました。
mt: Things were not going well for the Italian troops in North Africa from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on Britain on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had captured the Capuzzo fortress in Libya. The British had ambushed the Italians at Bardia, capturing the Italian 10th Army's chief engineer, General Lastucci. On June 28, Italo Balbo, the governor of Libya and thought to be Mussolini's successor, was killed by friendly fire while landing at Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: 北アフリカにいるイタリア軍にとって、ほとんど最初から状況は芳しくありませんでした。1940年6月10日のイタリアによる宣戦布告から1週間以内に、イギリスの第11フッサール軍がリビアのカプッツォ要塞を占領しました。 イギリス軍はバルディアの東方で待ち伏せし、イタリア第10軍工兵司令官ラストゥッチ将軍を捕虜にした。 6月28日、リビア総督でムッソリーニの後継者と考えられていたイタロ・バルボ元帥は、トブルークに上陸中に友軍からの銃撃を受けて死亡しました。
mt: Things were not going well for the Italian troops in North Africa from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on Britain on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had captured the Capuzzo fortress in Libya. The British had ambushed the Italians at Bardia, capturing the Italian 10th Army's chief engineer, General Lastucci. On June 28, Italo Balbo, the governor of Libya and thought to be Mussolini's successor, was killed by friendly fire while landing at Tobruk.
ref: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya. In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci. On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.

src: チベット仏教はブッダの教えに基づく信仰ですが、大乗仏教の慈悲やインドのヨガから多くの技術を取り入れて拡張されています。 原則として、チベット仏教は非常にシンプルです。クンダリーニヨガ、瞑想、そしてすべてを慈しむ愛の道で構成されています。 クンダリーニヨガは、ヨガのポーズ、呼吸、マントラ、ムードラなどを組み合わせてクンダリーニ（自己の魂）の覚醒を目指すものです。 チベット瞑想の中心は神性ヨガです。さまざまな神々を視覚化することで、エネルギーチャネルが浄化され、チャクラが活性化され、悟りの意識が生まれます。
mt: Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of the Buddha, but has been expanded by incorporating many techniques from the compassion of Mahayana Buddhism and Yoga from India. In principle, Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It is composed of Kundalini Yoga, meditation, and the path of love for all. Kundalini Yoga is a combination of yoga poses, breathing, mantras, and mudras to awaken Kundalini (one's soul). The center of Tibetan meditation is divine yoga. By visualizing various gods, the energy channels are purified, the chakras are activated, and the consciousness of enlightenment is born.
ref: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga. In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love. With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations. The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.

src: このプログラムは、現地時間午後8時30分（UTC 15.00）に開始されました。 全国から集まった有名な歌手たちがシュリーシャムの足元にバジャン（聖歌）を捧げました。 夜は、歌手のサンジュ・シャルマから始まりました。ジャイ・シャンカール・チャウドダリが後に続き、ラッカ・シンもチャッパン・ボーグ・バジャンを披露しました。歌手のラジュ・カンデルワルが共演しました。 その後、ラッカ・シンが先頭に立ってバジャンを歌いました。 108枚のチャッパン・ボーグ（ヒンドゥー教では、お菓子、果物、ナッツ、料理など、神に供える56種類の食用品）がババ・シャムに供えられました。 ラッカ・シンがチャッパン・ボグ・バジャンを披露し、歌手のラジュ・カンデルワルが共演しました。
mt: The program began at 8:30 pm local time (15.00 UTC). Famous singers from all over the country sang bajans at the feet of Shree Shri. The night began with Sanju Sharma. Jai Shankar Chaudhary followed, and then Raka Singh performed a Chappan Bog Bajan. Singer Raju Kandelwar also performed. Then Raka Singh led the Bajan. 108 Chappan Bog (56 types of food items, such as sweets, fruits, nuts, and dishes, which are offered to God in Hinduism) were offered to Baba Shri. Raka Singh performed a Chappan Bog Bajan, and singer Raju Kandelwar also performed.
ref: The program started at 8:30 p.m. local time (15.00 UTC). Famous singers across the country presented bhajans, or devotional songs, to Shri Shyam's feet. Singer Sanju Sharma started the evening, followed by Jai Shankar Choudhary. esented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him. Then, Lakkha Singh took the lead in singing the bhajans. 108 plates of Chhappan Bhog (in Hinduism, 56 different edible items, like, sweets, fruits, nuts, dishes etc. which are offered to deity) were served to Baba Shyam. Lakkha Singh presented the chhappan bhog bhajan as well. Singer, Raju Khandelwal was accompanying him.

src: 祝賀会は、世界的に有名なシルク・ドゥ・ソレイユの特別ショーから始まりました。 次いで、イスタンブール国立交響楽団、ヤニサリーバンド、歌手のファティヒ・エルコッチとミュスルム・ギュルセスが登場しました。 続いて旋舞教団がステージに登場しました。 トルコの歌姫セゼン・アクスは、イタリアのテノール歌手アレッサンドロ・サフィーナやギリシャの歌手ハリス・アレクシウと共演しました。 最後にトルコのダンスチーム「ファイヤー・オブ・アナトリア」が「トロイ」を披露しました。
mt: The celebrations began with a special show by the world-famous Cirque du Soleil.  Then the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, the Janissary Band, and singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses appeared.  The Whirling Dervishes then took the stage.  Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Harris Alexiou.  Finally, the Turkish dance team "Fire of Anatolia" performed "Troy".
ref: "The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil. It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses. Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage. Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou. To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show ""Troy""."

src: 華氏90度の暑さの中で待つ間、乗客に水が配られました。 消防隊のスコット・クーンズ隊長は「当日サンタクララでは気温が90度を超える猛暑日でした。 ジェットコースターに閉じ込めらるというのは時間の長短を問わず、控えめに言っても不快で、1人目が降りるまでに1時間以上かかりました。」
mt: Passengers were given water while waiting in the 90-degree heat. Santa Clara Fire Department Captain Scott Koons said, "It was a hot day in Santa Clara, with temperatures in the 90s. Being stuck on a roller coaster is uncomfortable, no matter how long you're stuck, and it took about an hour for the first person to get off."
ref: "Passengers were given water as they waited in 90(F)-degree heat. Fire captain Scott Kouns said, ""It was a hot day in the Santa Clara with temperatures in the 90s. Any length of time trapped on a roller coaster would be uncomfortable, to say the least, and it took at least an hour to get the first person off the ride."""

src: 最新速報によれば、海面測定値は津波の発生を示すものでした。パゴパゴとニウエの近くで明らかな津波活動が何回か記録されていました。 トンガでは大被害や負傷者は報告されていません。しかし、一時的に停電が発生し、トンガ当局は太平洋津波警報センター（PTWC）が発令した津波警報を受信できなかったとのことでした。 ハワイの海岸線沿いか海岸線に近い場所にある14校は、警報が解除されたにもかかわらず、水曜日はずっと閉鎖されたままでした。
mt: The latest reports indicate that the sea level measurements were indicative of a tsunami. There were several clear tsunami events recorded near Pago Pago and Niue. There were no reports of major damage or injuries in Tonga. However, there was a temporary power outage and the Tongan authorities were unable to receive the tsunami warning issued by the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center (PTWC). Fourteen schools along or near the coastline in Hawaii were closed for the rest of the week, even though the warning was lifted.
ref: According to the latest bulletin, sea level readings indicated a tsunami was generated. There was some definite tsunami activity recorded near Pago Pago and Niue. No major damage or injuries have been reported in Tonga, but power was temporarily lost, which reportedly prevented Tongan authorities from receiving the tsunami warning issued by the PTWC. Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted.

src: A1GPニュージーランドチームのコ・ドライバーであるジョニー・リードは本日、48年以上の歴史があるニュージーランドのオークランド・ハーバー・ブリッジを違反なく最速で駆け抜け、歴史に名を刻みました。 リード氏は、ニュージーランドのA1GPカーである「ブラックビューティー」で時速160 km以上で7回も橋を渡る走行に成功しました。 ニュージーランドの警察は、ブラックビューティーの速度が低いため、速度計測器でリード氏の速度を確認するのに苦労したそうで、警察がリード氏の速度を確認できたのは、時速160 kmまで減速したときだけだったそうです。
mt: 48-year-old Auckland Harbour Bridge, New Zealand, was successfully driven through without violating the Johnny Reid, co-driver of the New Zealand A1GP team, the fastest in the history of the bridge. Reid drove the "Black Beauty" New Zealand A1GP car, more than 160 km / h over the bridge seven times. New Zealand police said the Black Beauty speed was low, so the speedometer to measure the speed of Reid was difficult, the police could only confirm the speed of Reid, when the speed was reduced to 160 km / h.
ref: Jonny Reid, co-driver for the A1GP New Zealand team, today made history by driving the fastest over the 48-year-old Auckland Harbour Bridge, New Zealand, legally. Mr Reid managed to drive the New Zealand's A1GP car, Black Beauty at speeds over 160km/h seven times over the bridge. The New Zealand police had trouble using their speed radar guns to see how fast Mr Reid was going because of how low Black Beauty is, and the only time the police managed to clock Mr Reid was when he slowed down to 160km/h.

src: 月曜日の午後10時8分にモンタナ州西部で中規模の地震が発生しました。 米国地質調査所(USGS)とその国家地震情報センターに被害の緊急報告は入っていません。 震源地は、ディロンの北北東約20 km（15マイル）、ビュートの南約65 km（40マイル）の地点でした。
mt: A magnitude 4.0 earthquake occurred in western Montana at 10:08 p.m. Monday.  No reports of damage were received by the U.S. Geological Survey and its National Earthquake Information Center.  The epicenter was about 20 km (15 miles) north-northeast of Dillon and about 65 km (40 miles) south of Butte.
ref: A moderate earthquake shook western Montana at 10:08 p.m. on Monday. No immediate reports of damage have been received by the United States Geological Survey (USGS) and its National Earthquake Information Center. The earthquake was centered about 20 km (15 miles) north-northeast of Dillon, and about 65 km (40 miles) south of Butte.

src: イラクのアブ・グライブ刑務所が暴動の最中に放火されました。 米軍による占領後、囚人の虐待が発覚し、当該刑務所の悪名がとどろきました。
mt: The Abu Ghraib prison in Iraq was set on fire during a riot. After the occupation by the U.S. military, abuse of prisoners was revealed, and the prison's bad reputation was well known.
ref: Iraq's Abu Ghraib prison has been set alight during a riot. The jail became notorious after prisoner abuse was discovered there after US forces took over.

mt: The Abu Ghraib prison in Iraq was set on fire during a riot. After the occupation by the U.S. military, abuse of prisoners was revealed, and the prison's bad reputation was well known.
ref: Iraq's Abu Ghraib prison has been set alight during a riot. The jail became notorious after prisoner abuse was discovered there after US forces took over.

src: バンドはマウイ島の戦争記念スタジアムで90,000人を集客する予定でしたが、その公演をキャンセルし、ファンに謝罪しました。 このバンドの運営会社であるHKマネジメントは、9月20日公演の中止時に当初理由を明かさなかったが、翌日までには物流上の理由を非難しました。
mt: 90,000 people were expected to attend the concert at the War Memorial Stadium on Maui Island, but the band canceled the performance and apologized to fans. The band's management company, HK Management, did not initially reveal the reason for the September 20th concert's cancellation, but criticized the logistics as the reason the next day.
ref: The band canceled the show at Maui's War Memorial Stadium, which was set to be attended by 9,000 people, and apologized to fans. The band's management company, HK Management Inc., gave no initial reason when they canceled on September 20, but blamed logistical reasons by the next day.

src: ビシュケクの街路には法執行官がいなかったため、一晩中略奪が続いたと伝えられています。 ある観察者がビシュケクを「無政府状態」に陥っていると表現したように、ギャングたちが街路を徘徊し、日用品店を略奪しました。 ビシュケクの住民の一部は、南部から来た抗議者たちを無法であると非難しました。
mt: There were no law enforcement officials on the streets of Bishkek, and looting continued throughout the night, according to reports.  One observer described Bishkek as "anarchy" as gangs roamed the streets and looted grocery stores.  Some residents of Bishkek blamed the protesters from the south as lawless.
ref: "Widespread looting reportedly continued overnight, as law enforcement officers were not present on Bishkek's streets. Bishkek was described as sinking into a state of ""anarchy"" by one observer, as gangs of people roamed the streets and plundered stores of consumer goods. Several Bishkek residents blamed protesters from the south for the lawlessness."

src: ビシュケクの街路には法執行官がいなかったため、一晩中略奪が続いたと伝えられています。 ある観察者がビシュケクを「無政府状態」に陥っていると表現したように、ギャングたちが街路を徘徊し、日用品店を略奪しました。 ビシュケクの住民の一部は、南部から来た抗議者たちを無法であると非難しました。
mt: There were no law enforcement officials on the streets of Bishkek, and looting continued throughout the night, according to reports.  One observer described Bishkek as "anarchy" as gangs roamed the streets and looted grocery stores.  Some residents of Bishkek blamed the protesters from the south as lawless.
ref: "Widespread looting reportedly continued overnight, as law enforcement officers were not present on Bishkek's streets. Bishkek was described as sinking into a state of ""anarchy"" by one observer, as gangs of people roamed the streets and plundered stores of consumer goods. Several Bishkek residents blamed protesters from the south for the lawlessness."

src: RingのCEOであるジェイミー・スミノフは以前に、玄関の呼び出し音がガレージにある自分店から聞こえなかったことから事業を始めたと述べました。 彼はWi-Fiで鳴るドアベルを作ったそうです。 シミノフ氏は、2013年にシャークタンクのエピソードに出演した後、番組委員会が資金提供を辞退した後に売上が急激に伸びたと述べています。 2017年後半にシミノフ氏はテレビショッピング「QVC」に出演しました。 Ringはまた、競合するセキュリティ企業であるADTとの訴訟で和解しました。
mt: CEO Jamie Siminoff started the company after he couldn't hear the doorbell from his garage, which was across the street from his house. He made a doorbell that rang over Wi-Fi. After appearing on Shark Tank in 2013, Siminoff says the show's committee declined to provide funding, but sales skyrocketed. In the second half of 2017, Siminoff appeared on QVC. Ring also settled a lawsuit with ADT, a competing security company.
ref: Previously, Ring's CEO, Jamie Siminoff, remarked the company started when his doorbell wasn't audible from his shop in his garage. He built a WiFi door bell, he said. Siminoff said sales boosted after his 2013 appearance in a Shark Tank episode where the show panel declined funding the startup. In late 2017, Siminoff appeared on shopping television channel QVC. Ring also settled a lawsuit with competing security company, the ADT Corporation.

src: このPBSの番組はエミー賞を20回以上も受賞しており、この番組よりも長寿の番組は「セサミストリート」や「ミスター・ロジャースのご近所さんになろう」しかありません。 この番組のエピソードはいずれも具体的な書籍のテーマに焦点を当て、いくつもの物語を通してそのテーマを探求するものでした。 また、それぞれの番組では子どもたちが図書館に行ったときに探すべきお勧めの本に関する情報も提供していました。 WNED Buffalo（リーディングレインボーの放送局）のジョン・グラント氏は、「リーディングレインボーという番組は子供たちに、なぜ本を読むのかを教えてくれました。本を手に取って読むように子供たちに促してくれたのです」と語りました。 ジョン・グラントほか一部の人たちは、資金不足と教育テレビ番組に関する考え方の変化がシリーズ終了の一因であったと考えています。
mt: This PBS program has won 20 or more Emmy Awards, and the only other programs with longer runs are "Sesame Street" and "Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood." Each episode focused on a specific book theme and explored that theme through several stories. It also provided information on recommended books children should look for in the library when they go. John Grant of WNED Buffalo (the Reading Rainbow broadcast station) said, "The Reading Rainbow program taught children why they should read books. It encouraged children to pick up a book and read it." John Grant and others believe that funding shortages and changes in thinking about educational television programs were factors in the series' end.
ref: "The PBS show has more than two-dozen Emmy awards, and its run is shorter only than Sesame Street and Mister Rogers' Neighborhood. Each episode of the show would focus on a theme in a specific book and then explore that theme through multiple stories. Each show would also provide recommendations for books that children should look for when they went to their library. John Grant, from WNED Buffalo (Reading Rainbow's home station) said ""Reading Rainbow taught kids why to read,... the love of reading — [the show] encouraged kids to pick up a book and to read."" It is believed by some, including John Grant, that both the funding crunch and a shift in the philosophy of educational television programming contributed to ending the series."

src: アムステルダム市職員やアンネ・フランク博物館員たちは、木が真菌に感染していて今にも倒れそうだと危険を訴え、公衆衛生上の危険にもつながると述べています。 ここは火曜日に伐採される予定だったが、裁判所による緊急判決によって救われました。
mt: Amsterdam city employees and Anne Frank Museum staff have been warning that the tree is infected with fungus and may topple at any moment, and that it poses a public health hazard. It was scheduled to be cut down on Tuesday, but was saved by an emergency court ruling.
ref: Officials for the city of Amsterdam and the Anne Frank Museum state that the tree is infected with a fungus and poses a public health hazard as they argue that it was in imminent danger of falling over. It had been scheduled to be cut down on Tuesday, but was saved after an emergency court ruling.

src: 英国王立動物虐待防止協会（RSPCA）は、オーストラリアの食肉処理場すべてに監視カメラ（CCTV）の設置を義務付けるように再度要求しています。 RSPCAニューサウスウェールズ州のデビッド・オシャネシー主任検査官は、オーストラリアでは屠殺場の監視と検査を実施して当然だとABCに語りました。 「監視カメラは動物を扱う業者に、動物福祉が最優先であることを確かに強く伝えてくれるでしょう。」
mt: The Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) has again called for the mandatory installation of CCTV cameras in all Australian abattoirs. RSPCA New South Wales chief inspector David O'Shannessy told ABC that in Australia, monitoring and inspecting abattoirs is a given. "CCTV cameras will certainly make it very clear to the industry that animal welfare is the number one priority."
ref: "Animal Liberation and the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (RSPCA) are again calling for the mandatory installation of CCTV cameras in all Australian abattoirs. RSPCA New South Wales chief inspector David O'Shannessy told the ABC that surveillance and inspections of abattoirs should be commonplace in Australia. ""The CCTV would certainly send a strong signal to those people working with animals that their welfare is of the highest priority."""

src: 今日、レッドレイクコミュニティでは、ジェフ・ウェイズと9人の犠牲者のうち3人の葬儀が執り行われている最中に、3月21日に発生した学校での銃撃に関連してもう1人の学生が逮捕されたというニュースが広まりました。 当局は、本日の逮捕を認めたこと以外にほとんど公式な発言をしていません。 しかし、捜査に詳しい情報筋がミネアポリス・スター・トリビューン紙に語ったところによると、犯人はレッドレイク部族会長フロイド・ジュルダンの16歳の息子、ルイ・ジュルダンだったということです。 現時点では、どのような容疑がかけられているのか、当局が少年をのような経緯で逮捕したのかは不明ですが、連邦裁判所で少年に対する手続きが始まっています。
mt: Today, in Red Lake, Minnesota, news spread that another student was arrested in connection with the March 21 school shooting, as three of the nine victims were being buried at the same time.  Authorities have made little official comment other than confirming the arrest today.  However, a source familiar with the investigation told the Minneapolis Star Tribune that the shooter was Floyd Jourdain Jr.'s 16-year-old son, Louis Jourdain.  It is currently unknown what charges were filed against the teenager, or how authorities came to arrest him, but proceedings against the minor are underway in federal court.
ref: News spread in the Red Lake community today as funerals for Jeff Weise and three of the nine victims were held that another student was arrested in connection with the school shootings of March 21. Authorities said little officially beyond confirming today's arrest. However, a source with knowledge of the investigation told the Minneapolis Star-Tribune that it was Louis Jourdain, 16-year old son of Red Lake Tribal Chairman Floyd Jourdain. It is not known at this time what charges will be laid or what led authorities to the boy but juvenile proceedings have begun in federal court.

src: 抗議活動の主催者によると、ベルリン、ケルン、ハンブルク、ハノーバーなどのドイツの都市で約10万人が集まったとのことでした。 ベルリンで警察は抗議参加者を6,500人と推定しました。 抗議行動は、パリ、ブルガリアのソフィア、リトアニアのヴィリニュス、マルタのヴァレッタ、エストニアのタリン、スコットランドのエディンバラおよびグラスゴーでも発生しました。 ロンドンでは、主な著作権者の事務所の外に約200人が集まって抗議行動を繰り広げました。 先月、ポーランドでは同国がACTAに署名した際に大規模な抗議行動がありましたが、その結果としてポーランド政府は現時点で協定を批准しないという決定を下しました。 ラトビアとスロバキアはともにACTAに加盟する予定ですがその手続きが遅れています。
mt: 10,000 people were reported to have gathered in cities such as Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg, Hanover, and others in Germany. Police in Berlin estimated 6,500 protesters. Protests also occurred in Paris, Sofia, Vilnius, Valletta, Tallinn, Edinburgh, and Glasgow. In London, about 200 people gathered outside the main copyright holders' offices to protest. In Poland, large protests occurred when the country signed ACTA last month, resulting in the Polish government deciding not to ratify the agreement at this time. Latvia and Slovakia are both planning to join ACTA, but the process is delayed.
ref: Organisers of the protest said about 100,000 people turned up in German cities such as Berlin, Cologne, Hamburg, and Hanover. In Berlin, police estimated 6,500 protestors. Protests also took place in Paris, Sofia in Bulgaria, Vilnius in Lithuania, Valetta in Malta, Tallinn in Estonia, and Edinburgh and Glasgow in Scotland. In London, about 200 people protested outside some major copyright holders' offices. Last month, there were major protests in Poland when that country signed ACTA, which has led to the Polish government deciding not to ratify the agreement, for now. Latvia and Slovakia have both delayed the process of joining ACTA.

src: 故障したiPodが発熱する問題が約60件も報告されており、合計6件の火災が発生し、4人が軽度の火傷を負いました。 日本の経済産業省は、同機器に関連した事故が27件発生していることを把握していると発表しました。 先週、経済産業省は、Appleが「深刻ではない」とする過熱事故を追加で34件報告したと発表しました。 同省は、Appleの報告延期について「本当に遺憾だ」と語ることで対応した。
mt: 60 reports of overheating iPods have been made, with six fires and four minor burns. The Japanese Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry has been made aware of 27 incidents related to the device. Last week, the ministry announced that Apple had reported an additional 34 incidents of overheating, which it called "not serious." The ministry responded by saying, "We are very disappointed."
ref: "Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns. Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices. Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called ""non-serious."" The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report ""truly regrettable."""

src: Appleのスティーブ・ジョブズ最高経営責任者（CEO）は登壇し、ジーンズのポケットからiPhoneを取り出して、このデバイスを披露しました。 2時間のスピーチの中で彼は「今日、Appleは電話を再発明しようとしている。私たちは今日歴史を作ろうとしている」と述べました。
mt: Steve Jobs, Apple's chief executive officer, took the stage and pulled an iPhone from his jeans pocket to unveil the device. In a two-hour speech, he said, "Today, Apple is reinventing the phone. We're making history today."
ref: "Apple CEO Steve Jobs unveiled the device by walking onto the stage and taking the iPhone out of his jeans pocket. During his 2 hour speech he stated that ""Today Apple is going to reinvent the phone, We are going to make history today""."

src: 昨晩、ブエノスアイレスから50キロ（31マイル）離れたラプラタ市内で、現職上院議員であるクリスティーナ・フェルナンデス・デ・キルヒナー女史が大統領選への出馬を宣言しました。 キルヒネル夫人は、アルゼンチン劇場で大統領選に出馬するという意向を表明しました。2005年にブエノスアイレス州の代表団の一員として上院選への出馬を表明したのもこの劇場でした。
mt: Last night, in the city of La Plata, 50 kilometers (31 miles) from Buenos Aires, incumbent Senator Cristina Fernández de Kirchner declared her candidacy for president. Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president in the Argentine theater. In 2005, she also announced her candidacy for the Senate as part of the Buenos Aires delegation in this theater.
ref: Current senator and Argentine First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her presidential candidacy yesterday evening in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires. Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.

ref: Current senator and Argentine First Lady Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner announced her presidential candidacy yesterday evening in La Plata, a city 50 kilometers (31 miles) away from Buenos Aires. Mrs. Kirchner announced her intention to run for president at the Argentine Theatre, the same location she used to start her 2005 campaign for the Senate as member of the Buenos Aires province delegation.

src: また、ACMAは、インターネット上で動画が配信されていたにもかかわらず、ビッグ・ブラザーのウェブサイトにメディアが保存されていなかったため、ビッグ・ブラザーはオンラインコンテンツ検閲法に違反していなかったことを明らかにしています。 放送事業法ではインターネットのコンテンツについて規制を敷いていますが、コンテンツと見なされるためには、サーバー上に物理的に存在しなければなりません。
mt: In addition, the ACMA has revealed that Big Brother was not in breach of the Online Content Regulation Act because media was not stored on the Big Brother website, despite being broadcast on the internet. The Broadcasting Act regulates internet content, but only if it is physically stored on a server.
ref: The ACMA also found that despite the video being streamed on the Internet, Big Brother had not breached online content censorship laws as the media had not been stored on Big Brother's website. The Broadcasting Services Act provides for the regulation of Internet content, however to be considered Internet content, it must physically reside on a server.

The Broadcasting Services Act provides for the regulation of Internet content, however to be considered Internet content, it must physically reside on a server.

src: オーストラリアの財務大臣であり、ジョン・ハワード首相の後任として自由党党首に就任する可能性が高いピーター・コステロ氏は、オーストラリアの原子力発電産業を支持しています。 コステロ氏は、原子力発電で経済的に採算が取れるようになったら、オーストラリアは原子力発電の利用を追求すべきだと述べました。 「商用になれば手に入れるべきです。つまり、原則として原子力発電には反対しない」とコステロ氏は語りました。
mt: Australian Treasurer and likely successor to Prime Minister John Howard as leader of the Liberal Party, Peter Costello, supports the nuclear power industry. Costello said that if nuclear power becomes economically viable, Australia should pursue nuclear power. "If it's commercially viable, we should get it. In principle, we're not against nuclear power," Costello said.
ref: "Peter Costello, Australian treasurer and the man most likely to succeed Prime Minister John Howard as Liberal party leader has thrown his support behind a nuclear power industry in Australia. Mr Costello said that when nuclear power generation becomes economically viable, Australia should pursue its use. ""If it becomes commercial, we should have it. That is, there's no in-principle objection to nuclear energy"" Mr Costello said."

src: オーストラリアの財務大臣であり、ジョン・ハワード首相の後任として自由党党首に就任する可能性が高いピーター・コステロ氏は、オーストラリアの原子力発電産業を支持しています。 コステロ氏は、原子力発電で経済的に採算が取れるようになったら、オーストラリアは原子力発電の利用を追求すべきだと述べました。 「商用になれば手に入れるべきです。つまり、原則として原子力発電には反対しない」とコステロ氏は語りました。

That is, there's no in-principle objection to nuclear energy"" Mr Costello said."

src: 1日に授与されるメダルは18個のみなので、多くの国が表彰台に上がれませんでした。 具体的には、昨日のスーパーGで女子スタンディングクラスでアンナ・ヨシェムセンが9位に終わったオランダや、同じイベントでカチャ・サーリネンが10位に終わったフィンランドなどです。 オーストラリアのミッチェル・ゴーリーはスーパーG男子スタンディングで11位に終わりました。チェコのオルドリッチ・イェリネクは、男子シングルスーパーGで16位に終わりました。 メキシコのアーリー・ベラスケスは、男子シッティングスーパーGで15位に終わりました。ニュージーランドのアダム・ホールは、男子スタンディング・スーパーGで9位に入賞しました。 ポーランドの視覚障害者スキーヤー、マキエイ・クレツェルとガイドのアンナ・オガルジンスカはスーパーＧで13位に入賞した。韓国のパク・ジョンソークは、男子シッティング・スーパーＧで２４位に終わった。
mt: 18 medals were awarded per day, so many countries did not make the podium. Specifically, Anna Jochemsen of the Netherlands finished 9th in the women's standing Super G on Sunday, and Kacha Sarinen of Finland finished 10th in the same event. Mitchell Gourley of Australia finished 11th in the men's standing Super G. Oldrich Jelinek of the Czech Republic finished 16th in the men's sitting Super G. Arley Velasquez of Mexico finished 15th in the men's sitting Super G. Adam Hall of New Zealand finished 9th in the men's standing Super G. Polish visually impaired skier Maciej Krezel and guide Anna Ogalarzinska finished 13th in the Super G. Pak Jongsook of South Korea finished 24th in the men's sitting Super G.
ref: With only eighteen medals available a day, a number of countries have failed to make the medal podium. They include the Netherlands, with Anna Jochemsen finishing ninth in the women's standing class in the Super-G yesterday, and Finland with Katja Saarinen finishing tenth in the same event. Australia's Mitchell Gourley finished eleventh in the men's standing Super-G. Czech competitor Oldrich Jelinek finished sixteenth in the men's sitting Super-G. Arly Velasquez of Mexico finished fifteenth in the men's sitting Super-G. New Zealand's Adam Hall finished ninth in the men's standing Super-G. Poland's men's visually impaired skier Maciej Krezel and guide Anna Ogarzynska finished thirteenth in the Super-G. South Korea's Jong Seork Park finished twenty-fourth in the men's sitting Super-G.

src: この裁判はバーミンガム刑事法院で行われ、8月3日に結審しました。 現場で逮捕された司会者は暴行を否認し、最大30人から瓶を投げつけられたため、身を守るために棒を使ったと主張しています。 ブレイクはまた、正義の道を踏み外した罪で有罪判決を受けました。 裁判官は、ブレイクの刑務所送りは「ほとんど避けられない」と言いました。
mt: The trial was held at Birmingham Crown Court and concluded on August 3. The presenter arrested at the scene denied the assault and claimed he used a stick to protect himself from being hit by bottles from up to 30 people. Blake was also found guilty of a public order offence. The judge said Blake's prison sentence was "almost inevitable".
ref: "The trial took place at Birmingham Crown Court and concluded on August 3. The presenter, who was arrested at the scene, denied the attack and claimed he used the pole to protect himself from bottles being thrown at him by up to thirty people. Blake was also convicted of attempting to pervert the course of justice. The judge told Blake it was ""almost inevitable"" he was going to be sent to jail."

ref: "The trial took place at Birmingham Crown Court and concluded on August 3. The presenter, who was arrested at the scene, denied the attack and claimed he used the pole to protect himself from bottles being thrown at him by up to thirty people. Blake was also convicted of attempting to pervert the course of justice. The judge told Blake it was ""almost inevitable"" he was going to be sent to jail."

src: バリでの議題には、世界に残っている森林を保存し、開発途上国が低汚染で成長するために役立つ技術を共有することが含まれています。 また、国連では、地球温暖化の影響を被っている国々がその影響に対処できるように支援するための基金について最終決定したいと考えています。 この資金は、洪水に強い住宅、より適切な水の管理、さらに作物の多様化に使われる可能性があります。
mt: Topics at the Bali meeting include saving the world's remaining forests and sharing technologies that help developing countries grow in a low-polluting way. The United Nations also hopes to finalize a fund to help countries affected by climate change cope with the effects. The fund could be used for flood-resistant housing, better water management, and diversifying crops.
ref: Other subjects on the agenda in Bali include saving the world's remaining forests, and sharing technologies to help developing nations grow in less-polluting ways. The U.N. also hopes to finalize a fund to help countries affected by global warming to cope with the impacts. The money could go toward flood-proof houses, better water management, and crop diversification.
