ref: Cinque Terre, which means Five Lands, comprises the five small coastal villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso located in the Italian region of Liguria. They are listed on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea. Part of its charm is the lack of visible corporate development. Paths, trains and boats connect the villages, and cars cannot reach them from the outside.

src: 冬場の最も一般的な事故原因は、滑りやすい道路、舗道（歩道）、そして特に段差です。 少なくとも、それなりの靴底の靴が必要です。通常、夏用の靴で氷上や雪上を歩くと滑ってしまい、冬用のブーツでも十分とは限りません。 柄は5 mm（1/5インチ）以上の深さが必要であり、寒冷地では十分に柔らかい素材が必要です。 滑り止めが付いたブーツのほかに、取り外しできる滑り止めもあります。これはほとんどの靴やブーツに適しており、踵または踵と靴底に取り付けられます。 踵が低めで幅広のものが良いでしょう。道路や小道には、路面が滑らないようによく砂や砂利、塩（塩化カルシウム）が散布されています。
mt: The most common cause of winter accidents is slippery roads, sidewalks (pavements), and especially steps. At least some kind of soles are needed. Walking on ice or snow with summer shoes usually causes slipping, and winter boots may not be sufficient. The tread should be at least 5 mm (1/5 inch) deep, and in cold regions a soft material is necessary. In addition to anti-slip boots, removable anti-slip is also available. This is suitable for most shoes and boots and is attached to the heel or heel and sole. Low and wide heels are good. Roads and sidewalks are often sprinkled with sand, gravel, or salt (calcium chloride) to prevent slipping.
ref: The most common cause for accidents in winter is slippery roads, pavements (sidewalks) and especially steps. At a minimum, you need footwear with suitable soles. Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow, even some winter boots are deficient. The pattern should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inch) or more, and the material soft enough in cold temperatures. Some boots have studs and there is studded add-on equipment for slippery conditions, suitable for most shoes and boots, for the heels or heels and sole. Heels should be low and wide. Sand, gravel or salt (calcium chloride) is often scattered on roads or paths to improve traction.

src: クック諸島は、南太平洋の中央に位置するポリネシアに属し、ニュージーランドと自由連合を結んだ島国です。 クック諸島は、220万平方キロメートルの海に広がる15の島々からなる群島です。 ハワイと同じタイムゾーンなので、島は「南半球のハワイ」と考えられることがあります。 小さいながらもここを訪れると、年配の旅行客の中には、大きな観光ホテルなどが開発されていなかった州制施行前のハワイを思い出す人もいます。 クック諸島は15の島からなり、島に都市はあません。主な島はラロトンガ島とアイトゥタキ島です。
mt: The Cook Islands are a group of islands in the South Pacific Ocean, south of Tonga and north of New Zealand, whose population is ethnically Polynesian. The Cook Islands are a self-governing country in free association with New Zealand. The Cook Islands have a land area of 240 square kilometres (92.6 sq mi) and a population of about 20,000. The Cook Islands' 15 islands have a combined land area of 240 square kilometres (92.6 sq mi). The Cook Islands share the same time zone as Hawaii, so they are sometimes thought of as the "Hawaii of the Southern Hemisphere". Smaller than the state of American Samoa, the Cook Islands are also geographically closer to that territory than to New Zealand. The Cook Islands have no major urban areas; the largest village is Avarua on the island of Rarotonga, with a population of about 8,000.
ref: "The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean. It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean. With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as ""Hawaii down under"". Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development. The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki."

src: 事前に予約が必要です。シレーナに宿泊するには許可証が必要なのです。 シレナはキャンプに加えて、寮宿泊や温かい食事を提供している唯一の森林管理施設です。ラ・レオナ、サン・ペドリロ、ロス・パトスはキャンプ場のみで、食事サービスはありません。 プエルトヒメネスの森林管理移設から直接公園利用許可証を入手できますが、クレジットカードは利用できません。 公園管理局（MINAE）では、到着予定日の1か月前から公園許可証発行の申請を受け付けます。 カフェネット・エル・ソルでは、30ドルで予約を受け付けており、1日券なら10ドルです。詳細についてはコルコバドのページをご覧ください。
mt: Reservations are required. A permit is required to stay at Sirena. Sirena is the only forest management facility that provides lodging and warm meals in addition to camping. La Leon, San Pedro, and Los Patos are camping only and do not provide meals. You can get your park permit directly from the forest management relocation in Puerto Jimenez. Credit cards are not accepted. The MINAE will accept applications for park permits one month before your arrival date. Cafe Net El Sol is taking reservations for 30 dollars a day and 10 dollars for a day pass. Please see the Corcovado page for details.
ref: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service. It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival. CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.

src: スキーによるバックパック旅行：このアクティビティは、バックカントリースキー、スキー旅行、スキーハイキングとも呼ばれます。 アルペンスタイルのクロスカントリースキーや登山に関連するものですが通常は含まれず、後者は急峻な地形を上り下りにより頑丈なスキーとブーツが必要です。 スキールートはハイキングルートのようなものと考えてください。 条件が良ければ、徒歩よりも多少は長い距離を進めますが、整備されたコースで重いバックパックを背負わないクロスカントリースキーのようなスピードで走行できるのはごく稀です。
mt: Backcountry skiing: This activity is also known as backcountry ski touring, ski travel, or ski hiking. It is related to alpine-style cross-country skiing or mountaineering but does not usually include the latter, which requires steeper terrain and more durable skis and boots. Think of ski routes as hiking routes. If conditions allow, you can travel a bit farther than on foot, but you can't ski as fast as cross-country skiing with a heavy backpack on a groomed course.
ref: Backpacking by ski: This activity is also called backcountry ski, ski touring or ski hiking. It is related to but usually not involving alpine style ski touring or mountaineering, the latter ones done in steep terrain and requiring much stiffer skis and boots. Think of the skiing route as of a similar hiking route. In good conditions you will be able to cover somewhat greater distances than walking – but only very seldom you will get the speeds of cross country skiing without a heavy backpack in groomed tracks.

src: 再入国ショックは（新婚旅行の時期が少ない）カルチャーショックよりも早く訪れ、長引き、より症状が悪化することがあります。 新しい文化に易々と馴染めた旅行者も、現地固有の文化に馴染むのには苦労することがあります。 海外で暮らしてから帰国すると、新しい文化に順応した分だけ母国文化の習慣のを失っているものです。 初めての海外旅行なら、おそらく周囲の人たちは辛抱強く、理解しようとする気持ちで対応してくれるでしょう。旅行者に慣れが必要だと知っているからです。 旅行者は帰国に際しても忍耐と理解を要することを人々は予想していないかもしれません。
ref: Re-entry shock comes on sooner than culture shock (there's less of a honeymoon phase), lasts longer, and can be more severe. Travellers who had an easy time adjusting to the new culture sometimes have a particularly hard time readjusting to their native culture. When returning home after living abroad, you've adapted to the new culture and lost some of your habits from your home culture. When you went abroad at first, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travellers in a new country need to adapt. People may not anticipate that patience and understanding are also necessary for travellers returning home.

src: ムース（別名ヘラジカ）は、本来は攻撃的な性質ではありませんが、脅威を感知すると、自己防衛のために戦います。 ヘラジカを潜在的に危険だと思わない人は、近づきすぎて自らを危険にさらす可能性があります。
mt: Mice (also known as deer mice) are not naturally aggressive, but they will fight when they sense a threat. People who don't think mice are dangerous may get too close and put themselves in danger.
ref: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat. When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.

src: ムース（別名ヘラジカ）は、本来は攻撃的な性質ではありませんが、脅威を感知すると、自己防衛のために戦います。 ヘラジカを潜在的に危険だと思わない人は、近づきすぎて自らを危険にさらす可能性があります。
mt: Mice (also known as deer mice) are not naturally aggressive, but they will fight when they sense a threat. People who don't think mice are dangerous may get too close and put themselves in danger.
ref: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat. When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.

src: 高温条件の日中に、旅行者は、水（やその他の景色）の幻覚を生み出す蜃気楼を体験することがあります。 旅行者が蜃気楼を追いかけて貴重な体力や残りの水を浪費した場合、これらが危険につながる可能性があります。 どんなに暑い砂漠でも、夜間に極寒になることがあります。暖かい服を着ないと低体温症になる恐れがあります。
mt: Travelers may experience mirages of water (or other scenery) in hot conditions during the day. If travelers chase mirages and waste precious energy and remaining water, these may be dangerous. Even in the hottest deserts, it can get very cold at night. Without warm clothing, hypothermia is a risk.
ref: In the heat of the day, travelers can experience mirages that give the illusion of water (or other things). These can be dangerous if the traveler pursue the mirage, wasting precious energy and remaining water. Even the hottest of deserts can become extremely cold at night. Hypothermia is a real risk without warm clothing.

src: ドミニカ共和国（スペイン語：República Dominicana）は、カリブ海に浮かぶ国で、ヒスパニオラ島をハイチと分け合って島の東半分を占めています。 白い砂浜と山岳風景のほかに、この国にはアメリカ大陸で最古のヨーロッパ風都市があり、現在ではサントドミンゴの一部となっています。 この島に最初に住み着いたのは、タイノー族とカリブ族でした。カリブ族は、紀元前1万年頃に島に到着したアラワカン語を話す民族でした。 タイノ族の人口はヨーロッパの探検隊が到着してから数年のうちに著しく減少しましたが、その原因はスペインの征服者たちが持ち込んだ伝染病でした。 バルトロメ・デ・ラス・カサス（Tratado de las Indias）によれば、1492年から1498年の間にスペインの征服者たちが約10万人のタイノ人を殺害したそうです。
mt: The Dominican Republic is a country in the Caribbean, occupying the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti. In addition to its white sand beaches and mountainous landscape, this country also has the oldest European-style city on the American continent, which is now part of Santo Domingo. The first inhabitants of this island were the Taíno and the Carib. The Carib were an Arawakan-speaking people who arrived in the island around 4000 BC. The population of the Taíno decreased significantly in the years following the arrival of European explorers, but the cause was the infectious diseases brought by the Spanish conquerors. According to Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias), the Spanish conquerors killed about 100,000 Taíno between 1492 and 1498.
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: スキーやスノーボードを含むダウンヒル・スノースポーツは、スキーやスノーボードを足に装着して雪に覆われた地形を滑り降りる人気のスポーツです。 スキーは旅の主なアクティビティであり、「スキー狂」と呼ばれる多くの愛好家たちが、特定の場所でのスキーを中心とした休暇を計画しています。 スキーの概念は非常に古く、洞窟に描かれたスキーヤーの絵は紀元前5000年にまでさかのぼります。 滑降スキーのスポーツとしての歴史は少なくとも17世紀にまでさかのぼり、1861年にはオーストラリアでノルウェー人が最初のレクリエーション用スキークラブを開設しました。
mt: Downhill snow sports include skiing and snowboarding, which are popular sports in which people slide down snow-covered terrain while wearing skis or snowboards attached to their feet. Skiing is a major activity during travel, and many enthusiasts known as "ski bums" plan vacations centered around skiing in specific locations. The concept of skiing is very old, with cave paintings of skiers dating back to 5000 BC. The history of skiing as a sport dates back at least to the 17th century, and in 1861, a Norwegian opened the first recreational ski club in Australia.
ref: "Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. Skiing is a major travelling activity with many enthusiasts, occasionally known as ""ski bums,"" planning entire vacations around skiing at a particular location. The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! Downhill skiing as a sport goes back to at least the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club was opened by Norwegians in Australia."

src: 東アフリカ諸島は、アフリカ大陸東岸沖のインド洋にあります。 マダガスカルは群を抜いて最大の島であり、野生生物の生息地としては独自の大陸です。 小さい島々の大半は独立国か、またはフランスに関係する国々であり、有名な高級ビーチリゾートもあります。 また、アラブ人はこの地にイスラム教をもたらし、それはコモロとマヨットで広く受け入れられました。 15世紀にポルトガルの探検家ヴァスコ・ダ・ガマがヨーロッパから喜望峰を経由してインドに到達する航路を発見し、そこからヨーロッパの影響力と植民地主義が始まりました。
mt: The East African islands are in the Indian Ocean off the east coast of the African continent. Madagascar is the largest island, and is a separate continent as a wildlife habitat. Most of the smaller islands are independent countries or countries related to France, and there are famous high-end beach resorts. Islam was brought to this land by Arabs, and is widely accepted in the Comoros and Mayotte. In the 15th century, Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovered the route from Europe to India via the Cape of Good Hope, and from there European influence and colonialism began.
ref: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife. Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts. The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.

src: イースターの夜には、日の出を見るために、見通しの良い場所で夜を過ごすという伝統的な習慣があります。 この伝統については、もちろんキリスト教における神学的な説明がありますが、西暦紀元前に見られた春と豊穣の儀式にちなむ可能性があります。 より伝統的な教会では、イースターの週末の土曜日の夜に復活徹夜祭を催すことが多く、真夜中になると同時に信徒たちがキリストの復活を祝うための祝賀会を始める習慣があります。
mt: On Easter night, it is traditional to spend the night in a place with a good view of the sunrise. This tradition has, of course, a theological explanation in Christianity, but it may also be a remnant of spring and fertility rituals seen before the Common Era. More traditional churches often hold a vigil on the Saturday night of Easter weekend, and the celebration of Christ's resurrection begins at midnight.
ref: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise. There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual. More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

src: エクアドルでは、キューバ人が国際空港や辺境の入国ポイントを経由してエクアドルに入国する前に、招待状を受け取ることを義務付けています。 この書簡はエクアドル外務省によって合法化され、一定の要件を満たさなければなりません。 これらの要件は、両国間に組織的な移民の流れが生まれるように設計されています。 米国のグリーンカードを保有するキューバ市民は、エクアドル領事館を訪れて免除を受ける必要があります。 旅行日からパスポートの有効期限まで6か月以上なければなりません。滞在期間を証明するには、復路または第三国行きの航空券が必要です。
mt: In Ecuador, Cubans are required to receive an invitation before entering Ecuador through international airports or border entry points. This letter is legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and must meet certain requirements. These requirements are designed to create a flow of organized immigration between the two countries. Cuban citizens with a green card from the United States must visit the Ecuadorian consulate to receive an exemption. The passport must be valid for at least six months from the date of travel. A return or third country ticket is required to prove the stay.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points. This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: 外国では、特に人件費が安い低所得国では、眼鏡が安価で手に入ることがあります。 特に保険が適用される場合は、自宅で眼科検査を受け、出先で提出できるように処方箋を持参することを検討してください。 このような地域で販売されている高級ブランドのフレームには、2つの問題が伴うことがあります。1つは偽物、もう1つは本物ですが自国で同じ輸入品を買うよりも高額なものです。
mt: In other countries, especially low-income countries where labor costs are low, glasses can be cheap and easily obtained. In particular, if insurance applies, consider taking an ophthalmic examination at home and submitting a prescription at a remote location. There are two problems with high-end frames sold in such regions. One is a fake, and the other is a genuine one, but it is more expensive than buying the same imported product in your own country.
ref: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower. Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere. High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.

src: フォークランドの公式通貨はフォークランド諸島ポンド（FKP）で1ポンドが1英ポンド（GBP）と等価に固定されています。 両替は、スタンレーにある島内唯一の銀行（FIC Westの向かい）でできます。 英国ポンドは一般的に島内のどこでも利用でき、スタンレーのクレジットカードや米ドルもよく利用できます。 離島では、英国と米国の通貨を使えますが、おそらくクレジットカードは使えません。可能な支払い方法を前もって所有者に確認しておきましょう。 島を出てからフォークランドの通貨を両替することまず不可能なので、島を出る前に両替するようにしましょう。
mt: The official currency of the Falkland Islands is the Falkland Islands Pound (FKP), which is fixed at parity with the British Pound (GBP).  Exchange can be done at the only bank on the island (across from FIC West).  The British Pound is generally accepted throughout the island, as are credit cards and US Dollars in Stanley.  Credit cards are accepted on the outlying islands, but you should check with the owner beforehand.  It is impossible to exchange Falkland Islands Pounds for British Pounds after leaving the island, so be sure to exchange your money before leaving.
ref: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store. British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted. On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method. It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.

src: ほとんどの寺院では、11月末から5月中旬にかけて毎年例祭があり、年間行事予定は寺院ごとに異なります。 寺院の例祭のほとんどは、寺院ごとの記念日、主宰神の誕生日、その他の祝い事、または寺院に関連する他の主要行事の一環として催されます。 ケララ州の寺院で開かれるお祭りは、着飾った象たちの行進や寺院のオーケストラによる演奏など、とても見応えがあります。
mt: Most temples hold festivals from the end of November to the middle of May every year, and the annual schedule varies by temple. Most temple festivals are held as part of the temple's memorial day, the birth day of the temple's presiding deity, other celebrations, or as part of other major temple events. Temple festivals in Kerala are very impressive, with decorated elephants in parades and temple orchestras playing.
ref: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar. Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple. Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.

src: ファーストクラスやビジネスクラスに乗るには、当然ながら待遇の分だけ高額を支払うことになります（出張であれば勤め先の会社に交渉してみてください）。 しかし、決して安くはありません。通常のエコノミークラスで支払う料金に比べて、ビジネスクラスは4倍、ファーストクラスは11倍というのが大まかな目安です。 一般的に言えば、AからBへの直行便のビジネスクラスやファーストクラスの座席の割引を探しても意味がありません。 航空会社は、目的地まで速く快適に移動できるという特権のために最高額を支払ってもかまわないと思っている特定の乗客の中心的グループが存在することを心得ているため、そうした料金を請求しているのです。
mt: Of course, you have to pay more for first class or business class than for economy class (ask your company to negotiate if you are traveling on business). However, it is not cheap. The price of business class is about four times that of economy class, and the price of first class is about eleven times that of economy class. In general, it is not worth looking for discounts on business class or first class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know that there is a group of passengers who are willing to pay the highest price for the privilege of getting to their destination quickly and comfortably, and that is why they charge such prices.
ref: The obvious way of flying in first or business class is to fork out a thick wad of money for the privilege (or, better yet, get your company to do it for you). However, this does not come cheap: as rough rules of thumb, you can expect to pay up to four times the normal economy fare for business, and eleven times for first class! Generally speaking, there is no point in even looking for discounts for business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know well that there is a certain core group of flyers who are willing to pay top dollar for the privilege of getting somewhere fast and in comfort, and charge accordingly.

src: エミレーツ航空、エティハド航空、カタール航空、トルコ航空といった航空会社は、アフリカ行き路線の大幅な拡大を図っており、他のヨーロッパ航空会社よりもお得な料金でアフリカの主要都市への乗り継ぎ便を運航しています。 トルコ航空は2014年現在、アフリカ30カ国39都市に就航しています。 さらに移動時間が長くなる場合は、アフリカまでの総運賃の見積もりが世界一周運賃と比較してどのくらいかを確認してください。 アフリカ以外の場所を訪れる場合、ビザの追加申請、出国税、地上交通費などの追加費用も忘れてはなりません。
mt: Emirates, Etihad, Qatar and Turkish Airlines are expanding their African routes, offering cheaper fares than other European airlines to major African cities. Turkish Airlines currently flies to 39 cities in 30 African countries. If your travel time is longer, compare the total cost of your African trip to the cost of a round-the-world trip. If you are visiting outside of Africa, don't forget to add visa fees, departure taxes, and ground transportation costs.
ref: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways & Turkish Airlines have greatly expanded their services to Africa, and offer connections to many major African cities at competitive rates than other European airlines. Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries as of 2014. If you have additional travel time, check to see how your total fare quote to Africa compares with a round-the-world fare. Don't forget to add in the extra costs of additional visas, departure taxes, ground transportation, etc. for all those places outside of Africa.

src: スーパーで食品を買うのは、通常、食料を最も安く手に入れる方法です。しかし、調理の機会がなければ、選択肢は調理済み食品に限られてしまいます。 スーパーマーケットでは、調理済み食品の種類が増えてきています。店によっては、温められように電子レンジを用意するなどのサービスをしています。 国や店舗によっては、館内に1つ以上の飲食店（多くの場合、手ごろな価格のカジュアルなレストラン）が併設されています。
mt: Buying food at a supermarket is usually the cheapest way to get food. However, if you don't have the opportunity to cook, your options are limited to prepared foods. The types of prepared foods available at supermarkets have increased. Some stores have services such as providing microwaves to heat food. In some countries or stores, there is at least one restaurant (usually a casual restaurant at a reasonable price) located inside the store.
ref: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food. Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food. In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.

src: ベルギーやスイスで話されているフランス語は、フランスで話されているフランス語とは少し違いますが、互いに理解し合える程度に似ています。 特に、フランス語圏のベルギーやスイスの番号体系は、フランスで話されているフランス語とは異なる若干の特殊性を示し、一部の単語の発音も微妙に異なっています。 とはいえ、フランス語を話すベルギー人やスイス人は全員が学校で標準フランス語を習ったはずなので、標準フランス語の番号方式を使ったとしても理解してくれるはずです。
mt: The French spoken in Belgium and Switzerland is slightly different from the French spoken in France, but they can understand each other to some degree. In particular, the number systems in the French-speaking parts of Belgium and Switzerland are slightly different from the French spoken in France, and some words are pronounced slightly differently. However, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss people are supposed to have learned standard French in school, so they should be able to understand the number system used in standard French.
ref: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. In particular, the numbering system in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland has some slight peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of some words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

src: 死別運賃をまだ提供している航空会社は数社のみですが、この運賃で葬儀直前の旅費がわずかに割り引きになります。 該当する航空会社は、エア・カナダ、デルタ航空、ルフトハンザ、ウェストジェットなどです。 いずれの場合も、航空会社に直接電話で予約する必要があります。
mt: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which offer a slight discount on travel costs around the time of a funeral. These airlines include Air Canada, Delta, Lufthansa, and WestJet. In all cases, reservations must be made directly with the airline.
ref: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, which slightly discount the cost of last-minute funeral travel. Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

src: 母国を離れている間に目的地への行き方を調べるには、スマートフォンでGPSナビゲーションアプリを活用するのが最も簡単で便利な方法です。 GPS用の新しい地図を購入したり、スタンドアロン型GPS端末を購入したり、レンタカー会社で借りたりするよりも安上がりです。 スマホや携帯電話のデータ接続ができなかったり、県外になってしまうと、性能が制限されたり、使えなくなってしまうことがあります。
mt: When traveling abroad, the easiest and most convenient way to find your way to your destination is to use a GPS navigation app on your smartphone. It is cheaper than buying a new map for GPS or buying a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you are unable to connect to the Internet or are out of the county, your device may be limited in performance or unusable.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: 1835年にチャールズ・ダーウィンがそうしたように、ガラパゴスの遺跡や野生生物を見るには船が最適です。 ガラパゴス海域には60隻以上のクルーズ船が就航しており、大きさは8人乗りから100人乗りまでさまざまです。 ほとんどの人は事前に席を予約をします（最盛期には船が満席になることが多いからです）。 予約をする際には、代理店がガラパゴスを専門に扱い、多種多様な船に精通していることを確認してください。 そうすることで、お客様の具体的な興味や制約に合わせて、最も適した船を選ぶことができます。
mt: 1835, like Charles Darwin, the best way to see the Galapagos' ruins and wildlife is by boat. There are over 60 cruise ships in the Galapagos waters, ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book in advance (many ships are fully booked during peak season). When booking, make sure the agent specializes in Galapagos and is well versed in many different ships. This way, you can choose the most suitable ship to match your specific interests and constraints.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835. Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships. This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: カジノでは通常、ゲストに時間とお金を最大限に費やしてもらえるように工夫をこらしています。通常、窓や時計はなく、出口も見つけにくい場合があります。 カジノでは通常、特別な飲食やエンターテイメントを用意しています。ゲストが気分良く施設内に留まるようにするためです。 会場によっては、アルコール飲料を提供しています。しかし、酔うと判断力が鈍るので、優れたギャンブラーは誰でもしらふでいることの大切さを知っています。
mt: Casinos are usually designed to keep guests spending as much time and money as possible. Windows and clocks are often absent, and exits can be hard to find. Casinos often provide special dining and entertainment to keep guests on the premises. Some venues offer alcoholic beverages, but even the best gamblers know the importance of staying sober, as judgment can be impaired by alcohol.
ref: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find. They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise. Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.

src: カジノでは通常、ゲストに時間とお金を最大限に費やしてもらえるように工夫をこらしています。通常、窓や時計はなく、出口も見つけにくい場合があります。 カジノでは通常、特別な飲食やエンターテイメントを用意しています。ゲストが気分良く施設内に留まるようにするためです。 会場によっては、アルコール飲料を提供しています。しかし、酔うと判断力が鈍るので、優れたギャンブラーは誰でもしらふでいることの大切さを知っています。

src: すべての名詞は、「あなた」を指す単語Sieと同様に、文の途中であっても常に大文字で始まります。 これは、一部の動詞と目的語を区別するうえで重要な方法です。 動詞や形容詞が実体化された形式で使われているかどうかを調べる必要があるため、書き手にとってはやや複雑になりますが、読み手にとって楽になるのは間違いありません。
mt: All nouns begin with the word Sie, which is similar to the word "you" in English, and are capitalized, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important method for distinguishing between verbs and objects. It is necessary to check whether the verb or adjective is in the form of a real entity, which is a little complicated for the writer, but it is fun for the reader.
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

This is an important method for distinguishing between verbs and objects. ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

src: 世界の多くの地域では、手を振ることは「こんにちは」を示す友好的なジェスチャーです。 しかし、マレーシアでは、少なくとも農村部のマレー人の間では、人差し指を体に向かって曲げたジェスチャーに似た「こっちに来て」という意味であり、特定の欧米諸国で使われているもので、その目的のためだけに使われるべきものです。 同様に、スペインを旅行するイギリス人旅行者は、手を振って別れを告げる際に、手のひらを（相手ではなく）自分に向けて手を動かすのを見て「戻って来い」という身振りと勘違いしてしまうことがあります。
mt: In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture that means "hello." However, in rural Malaysia, among the Malay people, the gesture of curling the index finger toward the body is a "come here" gesture, and is used only for its intended purpose in certain European countries. Similarly, British tourists visiting Spain may misinterpret the gesture of waving goodbye by moving the palm of the hand (toward the person, not themselves) as a "come back" gesture.
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: 氷河は安定した状態ではなく、山を流れ落ちていきます。そのため、ひび割れやクレバスが発生し、雪の橋で見えなくなることがあります。 氷の洞窟の壁面や屋根が崩れ落ち、隙間が閉じてしまうこともあります。 氷河の端では、巨大な塊が崩れ落ちてきて、端から遠くに飛び出したり、転がったりすることがあります。
mt: Glaciers are not stable and flow downhill. This can cause crevasses and snow bridges to form, which can be invisible. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and close off gaps. At the edges of glaciers, large chunks can break off and fly or roll away from the edge.
ref: The glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause cracks, crevasses, which may be obscured by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: 氷河は安定した状態ではなく、山を流れ落ちていきます。そのため、ひび割れやクレバスが発生し、雪の橋で見えなくなることがあります。 氷の洞窟の壁面や屋根が崩れ落ち、隙間が閉じてしまうこともあります。 氷河の端では、巨大な塊が崩れ落ちてきて、端から遠くに飛び出したり、転がったりすることがあります。

The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: ゴマはコンゴ民主共和国の観光都市でルワンダに近い極東にあります。 2002年にゴマはニラゴンゴ火山の溶岩によって破壊され、ほとんどの街路、特に町の中心部が埋まってしまいました。 ゴマはかなり安全ですが、ゴマ以外の場所を訪れる場合は、北キブ州で続く戦闘の状況を調査して理解する必要があります。 この都市はニラゴンゴ火山への登山の拠点であり、アフリカで最も安くマウンテンゴリラを追跡できる場所の1つでもあります。 ゴマでの移動にはボダボダ（バイクタクシー）を利用することができます。通常の（現地）料金は、短い距離では500コンゴフランほどです。
mt: Goma is a tourist city in eastern Congo near Rwanda. In 2002, Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano, burying most of the streets, especially the city center. Goma is relatively safe, but if you are going to other places, you should check the situation of the ongoing fighting in North Kivu province. This city is a base for climbing the Nyiragongo volcano and is one of the cheapest places in Africa to track mountain gorillas. You can use bodaboda (motorcycle taxi) for travel in Goma. The usual (local) fare is about 500 Congolese francs for short distances.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda. In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre. While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: グランドキャニオンのふもとにキャンプする場合は、バックカントリー許可証が必要です。 峡谷保護のために許可証の交付は限定されており、申し込みの受け付けは開始月の4か月前の月の1日からです。 例えば、開始日が5月のバックカントリー許可証は1月1日から入手可能です。 最も人気のある場所（ファントムランチに隣接するブライトエンジェルキャンプ場など）は、通常、予約受付開始の初日に満員になります。 予約なしの先着順でご利用いただける申請の許可証には数に限りがあります。
mt: If you plan to camp at the bottom of the Grand Canyon, you will need a backcountry permit.  Permits are limited for protection of the canyon, and applications are accepted starting on the first day of the month four months prior to the month of your start date.  For example, a May backcountry permit will be available starting on January 1st.  The most popular sites (such as the Bright Angel Campsite adjacent to Phantom Ranch) will usually fill up on the first day of reservations being accepted.  There are limited numbers of first-come, first-served permits available without a reservation.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: グランドキャニオンのふもとにキャンプする場合は、バックカントリー許可証が必要です。 峡谷保護のために許可証の交付は限定されており、申し込みの受け付けは開始月の4か月前の月の1日からです。 例えば、開始日が5月のバックカントリー許可証は1月1日から入手可能です。 最も人気のある場所（ファントムランチに隣接するブライトエンジェルキャンプ場など）は、通常、予約受付開始の初日に満員になります。 予約なしの先着順でご利用いただける申請の許可証には数に限りがあります。
mt: If you plan to camp at the bottom of the Grand Canyon, you will need a backcountry permit.  Permits are limited for protection of the canyon, and applications are accepted starting on the first day of the month four months prior to the month of your start date.  For example, a May backcountry permit will be available starting on January 1st.  The most popular sites (such as the Bright Angel Campsite adjacent to Phantom Ranch) will usually fill up on the first day of reservations being accepted.  There are limited numbers of first-come, first-served permits available without a reservation.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: 第二次世界大戦前の19世紀から20世紀初頭にかけて利用された蒸気鉄道や外洋定期船の黄金時代の遺産を受け継いでいるホテルもあります。 これらのホテルには、当時の富裕層や著名人が滞在し、高級な食事やナイトライフを楽しむことが多かったとされます。 昔ながらの建具が備え付けられ、最新のアメニティはなく、そしてある種の熟成した優雅な佇まいであることも、こうしたホテルの個性の一部です。 通常は個人が所有していますが、来訪した国家元首やその他の要人を受け入れることもあります。 資金的に余裕のある旅行者は、これらのホテルに宿泊しながら世界一周空の旅を利用するのもいいかもしれません。
mt: 19th century and early 20th century steam trains and transoceanic liners are the legacy of the golden age of these hotels. These hotels were frequented by the wealthy and famous of the time, who enjoyed fine dining and nightlife. The fixtures are old-fashioned, and the amenities are not the latest, and there is a certain air of maturity. They are usually owned by individuals, but they can also accommodate heads of state and other dignitaries. Wealthy travelers may also want to use these hotels to circumnavigate the world by air.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries. These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife. The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character. While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: ヨーロッパにつながる光海底ケーブルとブロードバンド衛星のおかげで、グリーンランドでは人口の93%がインターネットに接続しています。 ホテルや宿泊先（ゲストハウスや個人宅に滞在している場合）には無線LANやインターネットに接続されたPCが設置されている可能性が高く、どの集落にもインターネットカフェや公共の無線LANが設置されている場所があります。 前述したように、「エスキモー」という言葉は米国ではまだ受け入れられていますが、米国以外の北極圏（特にカナダ）の人々には軽蔑語と見なされています。 グリーンランドの先住民が使う言葉を耳にすることがあるかもしれませんが、外国人が使うのは避けた方がいいでしょう。 グリーンランドの先住民は、カナダではイヌイット、グリーンランドではグリーンランド人のカラアレク（複数形カラアリット）を自称しています。 グリーンランドでは犯罪や外国人に対する嫌悪はほとんどありません。町には「荒れた地域」すらありません。 寒冷気象は、準備不足の人が直面しうる唯一の本当の危険です。 寒い季節にグリーンランドを訪れる場合、（北上するほど寒くなることを考えると）十分に暖かい衣類を持っていくことが不可欠です。 日の長い夏が続くと、十分な睡眠がとれず、健康上の問題につながる可能性があります。 夏季には、北欧の蚊にも注意しましょう。蚊は病気を媒介することはありませんが、刺されると腫れることがあります。
mt: 93% of the population in Greenland is connected to the Internet thanks to undersea cables connecting to Europe and broadband satellite. Most hotels and guesthouses have wireless internet and computers, and there are internet cafes and public wireless internet in most settlements. As mentioned above, the word "Eskimo" is still used in the United States, but is considered derogatory in the rest of the Arctic (especially in Canada). You may hear the local people use the word "Inuit" (plural "Inuit"), which is the name they use for themselves in Canada, and "Kalaallit" (plural "Kalaallit") in Greenland. There is little crime or xenophobia in Greenland. There are no "bad neighborhoods". The only real danger you will face is the cold weather, which can be dangerous to those who are not prepared. If you are visiting Greenland in the winter, you must have warm enough clothing (considering how much colder it gets the further north you go). The long days of summer can cause sleep deprivation, which can lead to health problems. In the summer, be aware of the mosquitoes of the north. They do not carry disease, but they can cause swelling if they bite you.
ref: "Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access. Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. As mentioned above, though the word ""Eskimo"" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada. While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland. Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no ""rough areas."" Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues. During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating."

src: ウニオン庭園。この空間は17世紀に建てられた修道院のアトリウムであり、唯一現存する建物はテンプロ・デ・サンディエゴがです。 今では中央広場として機能し、昼夜を問わず常にさまざまな活動に利用されています。 庭園の周りにはレストランが何件もあり、午後や夕方には中央の見晴台で無料のコンサートが開かれることもあります。 キスの小路（Callejon del Beso）。わずか69センチで区切られた2つのバルコニーには、古くから愛の伝説があった場所です。 数ペニー払えば、子供たちが語を聞かせてくれるでしょう。
mt: Union Garden. This space was built in the 17th century as a convent atrium, and the only surviving building is the Templo de San Diego. It now functions as a central plaza and is used for various activities day and night. There are several restaurants around the garden, and free concerts are held on the central lookout in the afternoon and evening.  Kiss Alley (Callejon del Beso). Two balconies separated by just 69 centimeters have a long-standing love legend. For a few pennies, children will tell you the story.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: ハイキングとは、野外で自然環境を楽しむ徒歩旅行ですが、通常はハイキングコースを歩くことになります。 日帰りハイキングの距離は、1マイル未満の短い距離から1日で回れる程度の長距離までです。 歩きやすい道を日帰りでハイキングする場合、ほとんど準備は必要ありません。体調の良い人なら誰でも楽しむことができます。 小さい子供がいる家族連れは、より入念な準備が必要かもしれませんが、赤ちゃんや未就学児の子供がいても、屋外で1日を楽しむことは簡単にできます。
mt: Hiking is a walk in the outdoors for the enjoyment of nature.  Typically, hiking is done on hiking trails.  The distance of a day hike is usually less than one mile and can be walked in a day.  If you are hiking on a well-maintained trail, you do not need to prepare much.  Anyone in good health can enjoy hiking.  Families with small children may need to prepare more, but it is easy to enjoy the outdoors with babies and preschool children.
ref: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails. Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day. For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them. Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.

src: ノルウェーで典型的なのは、急峻なフィヨルドと渓谷が突然ほぼ平坦な高原に変わる地形です。 これらの台地はよく「ヴィッデ」と呼ばれますが、これは木々がなく開けた広い空間、無限の広がりを意味しています。 ローガランドやアグデルでは、通常は「ヘイ」と呼ばれ、ヒースで覆われることの多い森林のない湿地帯を意味しています。
mt: In Norway, the typical landscape is one of steep fjords and valleys suddenly giving way to almost flat plateaus. These are often called "vidda" which means open, treeless spaces, with an infinite expanse. In Rogaland and Agder, they are usually called "heia" and mean wetlands covered in heather, with no forests.
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: ノルウェーで典型的なのは、急峻なフィヨルドと渓谷が突然ほぼ平坦な高原に変わる地形です。 これらの台地はよく「ヴィッデ」と呼ばれますが、これは木々がなく開けた広い空間、無限の広がりを意味しています。 ローガランドやアグデルでは、通常は「ヘイ」と呼ばれ、ヒースで覆われることの多い森林のない湿地帯を意味しています。

In Rogaland and Agder, they are usually called "heia" and mean wetlands covered in heather, with no forests.
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: 避暑地の観光シーズンは、一般的にインドの夏季にピークを迎えます。 しかし、多くのヒルステーションには十分な積雪があり、スキーやスノーボードなどのアクティビティを楽しめるので、冬にはまた違った美しさと魅力があります。
mt: The tourist season in hill stations is generally at its peak during the Indian summer. However, many hill stations have sufficient snowfall, and skiing or snowboarding activities can be enjoyed, so there is a different beauty and charm in the winter.
ref: The tourist season for the hill stations generally peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm during winter, with many hill stations receiving healthy amounts of snow and offering activities such as skiing and snowboarding.

src: 避暑地の観光シーズンは、一般的にインドの夏季にピークを迎えます。 しかし、多くのヒルステーションには十分な積雪があり、スキーやスノーボードなどのアクティビティを楽しめるので、冬にはまた違った美しさと魅力があります。
mt: The tourist season in hill stations is generally at its peak during the Indian summer. However, many hill stations have sufficient snowfall, and skiing or snowboarding activities can be enjoyed, so there is a different beauty and charm in the winter.
ref: The tourist season for the hill stations generally peaks during the Indian summer. However, they have a different kind of beauty and charm during winter, with many hill stations receiving healthy amounts of snow and offering activities such as skiing and snowboarding.

src: 一度マリーナに行けば、すべてが明らかになるのでご安心ください。他のボートヒッチハイカーと出会い、情報を共有できるでしょう。 基本的には、手伝いを申し出たり、お知らせを掲示したり、波止場を歩き回ったり、ヨットを清掃している人に近づいたり、居酒屋で船員と触れ合ったりといったことをするでしょう。 できるだけ大勢に話しかけるようにしてください。やがて、顔見知りが増え、募集している船について手がかりをくれるでしょう。
mt: Once you get to the marina, everything will become clear. You will meet other hitchhiking boaters and share information. Basically, you will approach people who are helping, posting notices, walking the docks, cleaning yachts, or socializing with sailors in bars. Try to talk to as many people as possible. Soon, you will recognize faces and they will give you leads on boats you are looking for.
ref: Be assured that once you hit the marinas everything will be pretty obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.

Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.

src: 香港島は、その名のとおり香港の領土であり、観光の目玉として多くの観光客が訪れる場所です。 香港の地平線を描いて立ち並ぶビル群は、ビクトリア・ハーバーの水の存在によって、きらびやかな棒グラフに例えられています。 香港の最高の景色を見るには、島から出て九龍のウォーターフロントに向かいましょう。 香港島の都市開発は、その大半が北岸に沿った干拓地に集中しています。 ここはイギリスの植民地支配者が自分たちの領土とした場所なので、植民地時代の証拠を探そうとする方は、ここから始めるのが良いでしょう。
mt: Hong Kong Island is part of Hong Kong's territory, and is a popular tourist destination. The skyscrapers that line the horizon are compared to a colorful bar graph, thanks to the presence of Victoria Harbour's water. To see the best view of Hong Kong, head out from the island to the waterfront of Kowloon. Most of Hong Kong's urban development is concentrated on the reclaimed land along the northern shore. Since this was the territory of the British colonial rulers, those looking for evidence of the colonial era should start here.
ref: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus. The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour. To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite. The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore. This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.

src: 鐙（あぶみ）とは、鞍の両側に吊り下げて乗り手の足を支える部分のことです。 これで乗り手はかなり安定しますが、乗り手の足が引っかかることがあるため、安全面での懸念が生じることがあります。 馬から放り出される瞬間に鐙に足が引っかかっていると、逃げようとする馬に引きずられてしまう恐れがあります。この危険を最小限に抑えるために、いくつもの安全対策を講じることができます。 まず、ほとんどの乗り手は、踵と滑らかでかなり狭目の靴底が付いた乗馬靴を履いています。 次に、一部の鞍、特にイギリス製の鞍には安全バーが付いており、乗り手が落馬しそうになって後方に引っ張られると、あぶみの革が鞍から落ちるようになっています。
mt: The stirrup is the part of the saddle that hangs on either side and supports the rider's feet. This makes the rider very stable, but there is a concern that the rider's feet can get caught in the stirrup, which can be dangerous. If the rider's feet get caught in the stirrup when the horse is thrown, the rider can be dragged by the horse as it tries to escape. There are several safety measures that can be taken to minimize this risk. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, narrow sole. Second, some saddles, especially British saddles, have safety bars that come off when the rider is about to fall backward and the stirrup leather falls off the saddle.
ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

src: おもてなし交流ネットワークとは、旅行者が訪れる都市で地元の人と旅行者をつなぐ組織のことです。 このようなネットワークに参加するには、通常、オンライン申込書に記入するだけですが、ネットワークによっては追加の認証や検証が必要になります。 利用可能な宿泊先の一覧は、印刷物やオンラインで提供され、他の旅行者による評価や意見が掲載されることもあります。 カウチサーフィンは、コンピュータプログラマーのケイシー・フェントンがアイスランド行きの格安航空券を見つけたけれども宿泊先が見つらなかった経験から2004年1月に立ち上げたコミュニティです。 地元の大学生にメールで問い合わせたところ、圧倒的な数の無料宿泊の誘いを受けました。
mt: Hospitality exchange networks are organizations that connect locals and travelers in cities that tourists visit. To join such a network, you usually just fill out an online application, but some networks require additional verification or validation. A list of available accommodations is provided either in print or online, and may include ratings and reviews from other travelers. Couchsurfing was started in January 2004 by Casey Fenton, a computer programmer, after he found a cheap flight to Iceland but couldn't find a place to stay. He sent an email to some local university students, and was overwhelmed with offers of free accommodations.
ref: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit. Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification. A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers. Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay. He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.

src: ホステルは主として若者を対象とした宿であり、典型的な宿泊客は20代ですが、年配の旅行者も多く見られます。 子供連れはめったに見られませんが、ホステルによっては個室での宿泊を許可しているところもあります。
mt: Hostels are primarily aimed at young people, and the typical guest is in their twenties, but older travelers are also common. Children are rarely seen, but some hostels allow single room stays.
ref: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too. Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.

src: ホステルは主として若者を対象とした宿であり、典型的な宿泊客は20代ですが、年配の旅行者も多く見られます。 子供連れはめったに見られませんが、ホステルによっては個室での宿泊を許可しているところもあります。
mt: Hostels are primarily aimed at young people, and the typical guest is in their twenties, but older travelers are also common. Children are rarely seen, but some hostels allow single room stays.
ref: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too. Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.

src: ブーメラン投げは、多くの観光客が身につけたがる人気の技です。 手元に戻ってくるブーメランの投げ方を身につけたい場合は、戻ってくるのに適したブーメランを用意しておきましょう。 オーストラリアで手に入るブーメランのほとんどは、実際は戻って来ません。初心者の方は、風の強い場所では投げない方が良いでしょう。
mt: The boomerang throw is a popular technique that many tourists want to learn. To learn how to throw a boomerang that comes back, prepare a boomerang that is designed to come back. Most boomerangs sold in Australia do not actually come back. Beginners should not throw boomerangs in windy places.
ref: Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists want to acquire. If you want to learn throwing a boomerang that comes back to your hand, make sure you have a suitable boomerang for returning. Most boomerangs available in Australia are in fact non-returning. It is best for beginners to not try throwing in windy

src: 1万7千もの島々の料理から選べるインドネシア料理は、この国全域に見られる実にさまざまな地域料理の総称です。 しかし、それ以上の修飾語も付けないで使用すると、ジャワ島中央部から東部にかけての料理を指す言葉となります。 現在では列島全体に広く普及しているジャワ料理は、シンプルな味付けが特長で、主な調味料はピーナッツ、唐辛子、砂糖（特にジャワのココナッツシュガー）やさまざまな香辛料です。
mt: 1,700 islands of Indonesian cuisine can be found from the cuisine of the entire archipelago. However, if used without further modification, it refers to the cuisine of the central and eastern parts of Java Island. Currently, the Javanese cuisine has spread throughout the archipelago, and its main ingredients are peanuts, chili peppers, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar), and various spices.
ref: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation. But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java. Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.

src: 医療専門用語に馴染みのない方のために付け加えると、感染性と伝染性という言葉は、異なる意味を持っています。 感染症とは、ウイルス、細菌、真菌、その他の寄生虫などの病原体が体内に侵入して増殖し、症状が現れる病気です。 伝染病とは、感染者の近くにいることで感染しやすい病気のことです。 多くの政府は、入出国者に様々な病気の予防接種を義務づけています。 これらの要件は、旅行者がどの国を訪問したことがあるか、または訪問しようとしているかによって異なる場合があります。
mt: For those unfamiliar with medical terminology, the words infectious and contagious have different meanings. An infectious disease is one in which a virus, bacteria, fungus, or other parasite invades the body and proliferates, causing symptoms. A contagious disease is one that is easily transmitted to those nearby an infected person. Many governments require travelers to be vaccinated against various diseases. These requirements may vary depending on which countries a traveler has visited or is planning to visit.
ref: For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have distinct meanings. An infectious disease is one that is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus or other parasites. A contagious disease is a disease which is easily transmitted by being in the vicinity of an infected person. Many governments require visitors entering, or residents leaving, their countries to be vaccinated for a range of diseases. These requirements may often depend on what countries a traveller has visited or intends to visit.

src: パーソナルVPN（仮想私設網）プロバイダーは、政治的検閲と商業的IPジオフィルタリングの両方を回避するうえで優れた方法です。 これらのプロキシは、いくつもの点でウェブプロキシよりも優れています。Httpのみならず、すべてのインターネットトラフィックを再ルーティングしてくれるからです。 通常、これらはより高い帯域幅とより優れたサービス品質を提供します。そしてスパイを防止するために暗号化されます。
mt: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way to avoid political censorship and commercial IP geo-filtering. These proxies are better in many ways than web proxies. They reroute all your internet traffic, not just HTTP. They usually provide better bandwidth and better service quality. And they are encrypted to prevent spying.
ref: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. They are superior to web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all Internet traffic, not only http. They normally offer higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and thus harder to spy on.

src: パーソナルVPN（仮想私設網）プロバイダーは、政治的検閲と商業的IPジオフィルタリングの両方を回避するうえで優れた方法です。 これらのプロキシは、いくつもの点でウェブプロキシよりも優れています。Httpのみならず、すべてのインターネットトラフィックを再ルーティングしてくれるからです。 通常、これらはより高い帯域幅とより優れたサービス品質を提供します。そしてスパイを防止するために暗号化されます。

They reroute all your internet traffic, not just HTTP. They usually provide better bandwidth and better service quality. And they are encrypted to prevent spying.
ref: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. They are superior to web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all Internet traffic, not only http. They normally offer higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and thus harder to spy on.

src: 通話はインターネットを経由してつながるので、居住地や旅行先の電話会社を利用する必要はありません。 居住地の自治体で番号を発行してもらう必要もありません。アラスカ州チキンの荒野で衛星からインターネットに接続して番号を選択すりれば、日当たりの良いアリゾナ州にいることになります。 多くの場合、PSTN通話を受けるためのグローバル番号を別途購入する必要があります。番号の入手場所は電話をかけてくる相手によって変わります。
mt: Calls are connected through the Internet, so you do not need to use the phone company of your residence or travel destination. You do not need to obtain a number from your local government. You can connect to the Internet from a satellite in the Alaskan wilderness and select a number in the sunny state of Arizona. In many cases, you need to purchase a global number to receive PSTN calls. The place to obtain a number depends on who is calling you.
ref: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you do not need to use a phone company located where you live or where you travel. There is also no requirement that you obtain a local number from the community in which you live; you can obtain a satellite Internet connection in the wilds of Chicken, Alaska and select a number which claims you're in sunny Arizona. Often, you have to buy a global number separately that allows PSTN phones to call you. Where the number is from makes a difference for people calling you.

ref: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you do not need to use a phone company located where you live or where you travel. src: イタリア語の発音は比較的簡単で、ほとんどの単語は文字通りに発音されます。 発音は次に来る母音に基づいて変化するため、注意するべき主な文字はcとgになります。 また、caroは「親愛なる」という意味であるのに対し、carroは「戦車」を意味するため、rとrrの発音の区別に注意が必要です。
mt: Italian pronunciation is relatively easy, as most words are pronounced as they are spelled.  Pronunciation changes based on the next vowel, so the main letters to watch out for are c and g.  Also, caro means "dear" while carro means "tank", so be careful to distinguish between r and rr.
ref: Pronunciation is relatively easy in Italian since most words are pronounced exactly how they are written The main letters to watch out for are c and g, since their pronunciation varies based on the following vowel. Also, make sure to pronounce r and rr differently: caro means dear, whereas carro means chariot.

src: エーゲ海に面したイズミルは、人口は約370万人を擁するトルコで3番目の大都市です。イスタンブールに次ぐ第2の港があり、交通の要所でもあります。 かつてはスミルナの古代都市でしたが、今では巨大な湾を中心に山に囲まれた、近代的に開発された賑やかな商業中心地となっています。 広い大通りやガラス張りの建物、近代的なショッピングセンターには、伝統的な赤瓦屋根の建物や18世紀の市場、古いモスクや教会、シナゴーグなどが点在しており、伝統的なトルコというよりも地中海ヨーロッパの雰囲気が漂っています。
mt: Izmir is the third largest city in Turkey, with a population of about 3.7 million, and is the second largest port after Istanbul. It was once the ancient city of Smyrna, but is now a modern, bustling commercial center surrounded by a large bay and mountains. Wide boulevards and glass buildings are interspersed with traditional red-tiled buildings, an 18th century market, old mosques, churches, and synagogues, giving it a Mediterranean European rather than traditional Turkish feel.
ref: İzmir is the third largest city in Turkey with a population of around 3.7 million, the second biggest port after Istanbul, and a very good transport hub. Once the ancient city of Smyrna, it is now a modern, developed, and busy commercial center, set around a huge bay and surrounded by mountains. The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey.

src: エーゲ海に面したイズミルは、人口は約370万人を擁するトルコで3番目の大都市です。イスタンブールに次ぐ第2の港があり、交通の要所でもあります。 かつてはスミルナの古代都市でしたが、今では巨大な湾を中心に山に囲まれた、近代的に開発された賑やかな商業中心地となっています。 広い大通りやガラス張りの建物、近代的なショッピングセンターには、伝統的な赤瓦屋根の建物や18世紀の市場、古いモスクや教会、シナゴーグなどが点在しており、伝統的なトルコというよりも地中海ヨーロッパの雰囲気が漂っています。
mt: Izmir is the third largest city in Turkey, with a population of about 3.7 million, and is the second largest port after Istanbul. It was once the ancient city of Smyrna, but is now a modern, bustling commercial center surrounded by a large bay and mountains. Wide boulevards and glass buildings are interspersed with traditional red-tiled buildings, an 18th century market, old mosques, churches, and synagogues, giving it a Mediterranean European rather than traditional Turkish feel.
ref: İzmir is the third largest city in Turkey with a population of around 3.7 million, the second biggest port after Istanbul, and a very good transport hub. Once the ancient city of Smyrna, it is now a modern, developed, and busy commercial center, set around a huge bay and surrounded by mountains. The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey.

src: お花見と呼ばれる桜の花の鑑賞は、8世紀から日本の文化の一部となっています。 そのコンセプトは、梅の花を好む中国から来ています。 日本で最初に開かれた花見は、天皇が自らと朝廷周辺に住まう貴族のためだけに主催したものでした。
mt: The concept of hanami, or viewing the blossoms of the cherry tree, has been part of Japanese culture since the eighth century. The concept came from China, where the plum blossom is favored. The first hanami was held by the emperor for himself and the nobles who lived around the imperial court.
ref: Cherry blossom viewing, known as hanami, has been a part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The concept came from China where plum blossoms were the flower of choice. In Japan, the first cherry blossom parties were hosted by the emperor only for himself and other members of the aristocracy around the Imperial Court.

src: お花見と呼ばれる桜の花の鑑賞は、8世紀から日本の文化の一部となっています。 そのコンセプトは、梅の花を好む中国から来ています。 日本で最初に開かれた花見は、天皇が自らと朝廷周辺に住まう貴族のためだけに主催したものでした。
mt: The concept of hanami, or viewing the blossoms of the cherry tree, has been part of Japanese culture since the eighth century. The concept came from China, where the plum blossom is favored. The first hanami was held by the emperor for himself and the nobles who lived around the imperial court.
ref: Cherry blossom viewing, known as hanami, has been a part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The concept came from China where plum blossoms were the flower of choice. In Japan, the first cherry blossom parties were hosted by the emperor only for himself and other members of the aristocracy around the Imperial Court.

src: エルサレムはイスラエルの首都でありかつ最大都市ですが、他国のほとんどや国連から正式に首都として認められていないのが現状です。 ユダヤの丘陵地帯にある古代都市には、何千年にもわたる魅力的な歴史があります。 ユダヤ教、キリスト教、イスラム教という三大一神教の聖地が集まったこの都市は、国の精神的、宗教的、文化的な中心地としての役割を果たしています。 都市の宗教的意義、そして特に旧市街地にある多くの遺跡や史跡により、エルサレムはイスラエルの主要な観光地の1つとなっています。 エルサレムには、数多くの歴史的、考古学的、文化的遺跡があり、活気に溢れた賑やかな商店街、カフェ、レストランがあります。
mt: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, but is not recognized as such by most other countries and the United Nations. The ancient city on the Judean hill country has a long and fascinating history spanning thousands of years. The city is the spiritual, religious, and cultural center of the country, and plays a central role in the three major monotheistic religions: Judaism, Christianity, and Islam. Jerusalem's religious significance, and especially the many historical and archaeological sites in the Old City, make it one of Israel's main tourist attractions. Jerusalem has many historical, archaeological, and cultural sites, as well as lively and bustling shopping streets, cafes, and restaurants.
ref: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital. The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years. The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center. Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel. Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.

src: クルーガー国立公園（KNP）は、南アフリカの北東部に位置し、東はモザンビーク、北はジンバブエとの国境に沿って走り、南の国境はクロコダイル川になっています。 公園の面積は19,500 km2にわたり、14の生態圏に分かれており、各圏に異なる野生生物が生息しています。 ここは南アフリカの主な観光地の1つであり、南アフリカ国立公園（SAN Parks）の目玉とされています。 南アフリカにあるすべての国立公園と同様に、この公園には毎日保護費と入園料がかかります。 ワイルドカードを購入するとお得な場合があります。南アフリカの主な公園または南アフリカのすべての国立公園に入場できます。
mt: The Kruger National Park (KNP) is located in the north-eastern part of South Africa, and runs along the border with Mozambique to the east and Zimbabwe to the north, with the border to the south being the Crocodile River. The park covers an area of 19,500 km2 and is divided into 14 ecological zones, each with different wildlife. This is one of South Africa's main tourist attractions and is a flagship of SAN Parks. As with all national parks in South Africa, there is a daily conservation fee and entrance fee. A Wild Card can be purchased for a discount and allows entry to South Africa's main parks or all national parks in South Africa.
ref: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River. The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife. It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks). As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park. It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.

src: マチュピチュの北端にそびえ立つこの険しい山は、遺跡を撮影した多くの写真の背景に映りこんでいます。 下から見ると少し手ごわい感じがしますが、体力のある人ならば45分程度で登れるはずです。 道の大部分には石段が敷かれ、急勾配の区間では鋼鉄製ケーブルが手すりとして設置されています。 とはいえ、息切れすることも予想され、特に急勾配では、濡れているとすぐに危険度が増すので注意しましょう。 頂上近くに小さな洞窟があり、そこを通過しなければなりませんが、極めて天井が低くて狭い洞窟です。
mt: This steep mountain looms over the northern end of Machu Picchu, and is the background in many photographs of the site.  It looks a little intimidating from below, but it should be possible for people in good shape to climb it in about 45 minutes.  Most of the trail is paved with stone steps, and steel cables are installed as handrails in the steeper sections.  However, it is expected that you will run out of breath, and be especially careful in the steeper sections when wet, as the danger level increases.  There is a small cave near the top, which you must pass through, but it is very low and narrow.
ref: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins. It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes. Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail. That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly. There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.

src: マヨルカ島の料理は、地中海の他の地域と同様に、パン、野菜、肉（特に豚肉）を主な食材とし、オリーブオイルを多用します。 特に夏場には、オリーブオイルを塗ったパンにトマトとチーズ、チューナなどの調味料を加えた「パンボリ」というシンプルな料理が人気です。
mt: The cuisine of the island of Majorca is similar to that of other regions of the Mediterranean, with bread, vegetables, and meat (particularly pork) as the main ingredients, and olive oil used in abundance. In particular, during the summer, a simple dish called "pan bori" is popular, consisting of bread smeared with olive oil, to which tomatoes and cheese, and seasonings such as tuna are added.
ref: Majorcan cuisine, like that of similar zones in the Mediterranean, is based on bread, vegetables and meat (specially pork), and uses olive oil throughout. A simple popular dinner, especially during the summer, is the Pa amb Oli: Bread with olive oil, tomato, and any available condiments such as cheese, tunafish, etc.

src: ハンギ料理は、地面に掘った穴を熱して食材を調理するものです。 掘った穴に火から取り出した焼け石を入れて加熱するか、または地熱で地面が自然と熱くなっている場所に穴を掘ることもあります。 ハンギを使って伝統的な蒸し焼き料理を作ることもよくあります。 ロトルアには地熱ハンギを提供している場所がいくつもあり、クライストチャーチやウェリントンなどでは違ったハンギを試すことができます。
mt: Hāngī is a traditional Māori method of cooking food in an earth oven. The food is cooked by placing it in a pit and heating it with stones taken from a fire, or by digging a pit in a place where the ground is naturally heated by geothermal activity. Traditional hāngī cooking is often done in a hāngī, a large pit oven. There are several places in Rotorua that offer geothermal hāngī, and you can try different hāngīs in Christchurch and Wellington.
ref: A Hangi Meal is cooked in a hot pit in the ground. The pit is either heated with hot stones from a fire, or in some places geothermal heat makes areas of ground naturally hot. The hangi is often used to cook a traditional roast style dinner. Several places in Rotorua offer geothermal hangi, while other hangi can be sampled in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.

src: 修道院を訪れる際には、女性は膝を覆うスカートを履き、肩も覆われていることが義務付けられています。 ほとんどの修道院では、準備なしで来た女性のために覆いを用意していますが、自前で特に明るい色のものを持参すると、入口で僧侶や尼僧から微笑んでもらえるでしょう。 同じように、男性は膝を覆うズボンを履くことが義務付けられています。 これも入口にある受付で借してもらえますが、利用者ごとに洗濯しているわけではないことを考えると、履くのに抵抗がある人もいるかもしれません。男性用のワンサイズです。
mt: When visiting a monastery, women are required to wear a skirt that covers the knees, and shoulders must be covered. Most monasteries have coverings prepared for women who come without them, but bringing your own, especially in bright colors, will get you a smile from the monks or nuns at the entrance. Similarly, men are required to wear pants that cover the knees. These can be borrowed at the reception desk, but considering that they are not washed for each user, some people may be resistant to wearing them. One size fits all.
ref: While visiting the monasteries, women are required to wear skirts covering the knees and have their shoulders covered, too. Most of the monasteries do provide wraps for women who come unprepared, but if you bring your own, especially one with bright colors, you'll get a smile from the monk or nun at the entrance. Along the same line, men are required to wear trousers covering the knees. This too can be borrowed from the stock at the entrance but that clothing isn't washed after every user so you may not feel comfortable wearing these skirts. One size fits all for men!

src: 冬に北極や南極を訪れると、太陽が地平線から昇らない「極夜」を体験することができます。 この現象によってほぼ24時間空が暗くなるので、オーロラを見るには良い機会となります。 この地域は人口がまばらで、光害問題もほとんどないので、星空を楽しむことができます。
mt: When you visit the Arctic or Antarctic in winter, you can experience "polar night," when the sun does not rise above the horizon. This phenomenon makes the sky dark for almost 24 hours, so it is a good opportunity to see the aurora. The region is sparsely populated and has few light pollution problems, so you can enjoy the night sky.
ref: If you visit the Arctic or Antarctic areas in the winter you will experience the polar night, which means that the sun doesn't rise above the horizon. This offers a good opportunity to see the Aurora borealis, as the sky will be dark more or less around the clock. As the areas are sparsely populated, and light pollution therefore often not a problem, you will also be able to enjoy the stars.

src: 携帯電話の電波が届かない辺境では、衛星電話が唯一の選択肢になることがあります。 衛星電話は、基本的には携帯電話の代わりにはなりません。というのも、電話をかけるには衛星をはっきりと見通せる屋外にいなければならないからです。 このサービスは、娯楽船をはじめとする船舶や、遠隔地でデータや音声を必要とする探検隊に頻繁に利用されています。 このサービスへの接続方法については、居住地の電話会社が詳しい情報を提供してくれるはずです。
mt: In remote areas where cell phone signals are not available, satellite phones are the only option. Satellite phones are not a replacement for cell phones, as they require a clear view of the sky to make a call. This service is frequently used by cruise ships and exploration teams that need data or voice communication in remote areas. Your local phone company should be able to provide you with more information on how to connect to this service.
ref: In remote locations, without cell phone coverage, a satellite phone may be your only option. A satellite phone is not generally a replacement for a mobile phone, as you have to be outdoors with clear line of sight to the satellite to make a phone call. The service is frequently used by shipping, including pleasure craft, as well as expeditions who have remote data and voice needs. Your local telephone service provider should be able to give more information about connecting to this service.

The service is frequently used by shipping, including pleasure craft, as well as expeditions who have remote data and voice needs. Your local telephone service provider should be able to give more information about connecting to this service.

src: モルドバの首都はチインウです。現地語はルーマニア語ですが、ロシア語が広く使われています。 モルドバは多民族国家であり、民族紛争に悩まされてきました。 この紛争により、1994年にモルドバ東部のトランスニストリア共和国が誕生し、共和国には独自政府と通貨がありますが、どの国連加盟国にも認められていません。 政治交渉が失敗したにもかかわらず、モルドバのこの2つの地域の間には経済的なつながりが再び確立されています。 モルドバの主な宗教は正統派キリスト教です。
mt: The capital of Moldova is Chisinau. The local language is Romanian, but Russian is widely spoken. Moldova is a multiethnic state and has been plagued by ethnic conflict. This conflict led to the creation of the Transnistria Republic in eastern Moldova in 1994, which has its own government and currency, but is not recognized by any United Nations member state. Despite failed political negotiations, economic ties between the two regions of Moldova have been reestablished. The main religion of Moldova is Orthodox Christianity.
ref: The capital of Moldova is Chişinău. The local language is Romanian, but Russian is widely used. Moldova is a multi-ethnic republic that has suffered from ethnic conflict. In 1994, this conflict led to the creation of the self-proclaimed Transnistria Republic in eastern Moldova, which has its own government and currency but is not recognised by any UN member country. Economic links have been re-established between these two parts of Moldova despite the failure in political negotiations. The major religion in Moldova is Orthodox Christian.

src: モンテビデオは赤道の南にあるので、北半球が冬になると夏になり、北半球が夏になると冬になるのです。 モンテビデオは亜熱帯にあり、夏季には30℃を上回る気温が一般的です。 気温が氷点下になることはめったにありませんが、風と湿度の関係で温度計が示す気温よりも寒く感じることがあります。 「雨季」や「乾季」は特になく、年間を通して雨量はほぼ一定です。
mt: Montevideo is south of the equator, so when the northern hemisphere is in winter, Montevideo is in summer, and when the northern hemisphere is in summer, Montevideo is in winter. Montevideo is in the tropics, and temperatures over 30 °C are common in the summer. Temperatures below freezing are rare, but the temperature can feel colder than the thermometer indicates due to wind and humidity. There is no rainy season or dry season, and rainfall is fairly constant throughout the year.
ref: "Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa. Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common. The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says. There are no particular ""rainy"" and ""dry"" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year."
