src: 不快な壁画や落書きはグラフィティと呼ばれます。 現代の問題からはほど遠いものの、ほとんどの人はスプレー塗料を使って公共物や他人の私有財産にいたずらをする若者を連想するのでしょう。 しかし、現在では、著名なグラフィティアーティスト、グラフィティイベント、そして専用の「合法的」な壁面が存在します。この文脈におけるグラフィティペインティングの多くは、判読不能な記号類ではなく美術品に類似する扱いとなります。
mt: Unpleasant graffiti or tagging is called graffiti. Although it is far from modern problems, most people would associate it with young people who spray paint public property or other people's private property as a prank. However, nowadays, there are famous graffiti artists, graffiti events, and dedicated "legal" walls. Most of the graffiti painting in this context is treated as similar to works of art rather than illegible symbols.
ref: "Unwanted murals or scribble is known as graffiti. While it's far from a modern phenomenon, most people probably associate it with youth vandalizing public and private property using spray paint. However, nowadays there are established graffiti artists, graffiti events and ""legal"" walls. Graffiti paintings in this context often resemble artworks rather than illegible tags."

src: フェスティバルによっては、音楽祭の参加者の大多数が会場内でキャンプをすることが決まっており、ほとんどの参加者はそれがここでの重要な体験の一部であると考えています。 実地に体験したければ、早めに到着して演奏が聞こえやすいキャンプ場を確保しなければなりません。 メインステージの音楽が終わっても、フェスティバルには夜遅くまで演奏を流し続けるセクションがあるかもしれないことを覚えておいてください。 フェスティバルによっては、幼いお子供連れ家族向けに特別なキャンプ場を設けているところもあります。
mt: For some festivals, the majority of participants camp within the festival grounds, and most participants consider this to be an important part of their experience. If you want to experience it for real, you'll need to arrive early to secure a campsite close to the main stage. Remember that some festivals continue to play music well into the night, even after the main stage has finished. Some festivals also have special camping areas for families with young children.
ref: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience. If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music. Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night. Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.

src: プエブロ集落の多くがどれほど離れた場所にあるかを考えれば、アルバカーキやサンタフェに向かわない限り、ナイトライフを十分に楽しむことはできないでしょう。 しかし、上記のカジノのほぼすべてが飲み物を提供しており、そのいくつか（主にアルバカーキとサンタフェのすぐ近くにある大規模なカジノ）は有名ブランドのエンターテイメントを提供しています。 注意：この辺りにある居酒屋は、州外から来た旅行客がたむろするのに必ずしも良い場所ではありません。 1つには、ニューメキシコ州北部で飲酒運転が大きな問題となっており、田舎町のバーの付近に飲酒運転者が集中していることが挙げられます。
mt: Most of the Pueblos are too far away to enjoy a night life without going to Albuquerque or Santa Fe. However, all of the above casinos offer drinks, and some of the larger casinos near Albuquerque and Santa Fe offer well-known entertainment. Note: The bars in this area are not necessarily good places for tourists from out of state to congregate. One reason is that drunk driving is a big problem in the northern part of New Mexico, and drunk drivers tend to congregate around the bars in small towns.
ref: Given how remote many of the pueblos are, you won't be able to find a significant amount of nightlife without traveling to Albuquerque or Santa Fe. However, nearly all of the casinos listed above serve drinks, and several of them bring in name-brand entertainment (primarily the large ones immediately surrounding Albuquerque and Santa Fe). Beware: small-town bars here are not always good places for the out-of-state visitor to hang out. For one thing, northern New Mexico has significant problems with drunk driving, and the concentration of intoxicated drivers is high close to small-town bars.

src: 主な地ビールは「ナンバーワン」という名称で、手の込んだビールではないものの、爽やかで飲み心地がスッキリとしたビールです。もう1つの地ビールは「マンタ」という名称です。 フランスワインも手に入りやすいのですが、せっかくの旅ですからニュージーランドやオーストラリアのワインを試してみましょう。 現地の水道水は全く問題なく飲めますが、怖いと思ったらボトル入りの水が簡単に手に入ります。 オーストラリア人にとって「フラットホワイト（ミルクの入り）」コーヒーという概念は外国のものです。ショートブラックは「エスプレッソ」であり、カプチーノは（泡ではなく）クリームがたっぷりと盛られ、紅茶はミルクなしで提供されます。 暖かいチョコレートはベルギーの基準を満たす飲み物です。果汁飲料は値が張りますがたいへん美味です。
mt: The main local beer is called "Number One" and is not a complex beer, but is refreshing and easy to drink. Another local beer is called "Manta". French wine is readily available, but since you are on holiday, try some New Zealand or Australian wine. The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but if you are worried, bottled water is readily available. To an Australian, the concept of "flat white" (milk in) coffee is foreign. Espresso is "short black", capuccino is served with plenty of cream, and tea is served without milk. Hot chocolate is a drink to the Belgian standard. Fruit juice is expensive, but is very tasty.
ref: "The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called ""Manta"". There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better. The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful. For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk. The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent."

src: グアラニー族は、現在のパラグアイ東部に生息する最も重要な先住民族で、半遊牧民の狩猟民族として生活し、自給自足の農業も営んでいました。 チャコ地方には、狩猟、採集、漁業によって生き延びた他の先住民族であるグアイクル族やパヤグア族などの集団が住んでいました。 16世紀にスペインの征服者と先住民族との出会いによって（かつて「西インド諸島の巨州」と呼ばれた）パラグアイが誕生しました。 スペイン人たちの植民地時代が始まり、それが3世紀続きことになった。 1537年にアスンシオンが創設されて以来、パラグアイは土着の特性と独自性を多く残してきました。
mt: The Guaraní are the most important indigenous people living in the eastern part of present-day Paraguay, who lived as semi-nomadic hunting and gathering people and also practiced subsistence agriculture. Other indigenous groups living in the Chaco region included the Guaycuru and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering, and fishing. The birth of Paraguay as a "West Indies of the South" came with the meeting of the conquistadors and the indigenous people in the 16th century. The colonial era began in 1537 with the founding of Asunción, and Paraguay has retained many of its indigenous characteristics and uniqueness ever since.
ref: "The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture. The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing. In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called ""The Giant Province of the Indies"", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups. The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries. Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity."

src: パリジャンは、自己中心的で横柄で失礼な人が多いと言われています。 これは不正確な固定観念にすぎませんが、パリうまくやっていくための最善の方法は、「育ちの良い」人らいく振る舞って最善の行動をとることです。そうすれば、快適に過ごせるようになるでしょう。 一見とっつきにくいパリジャンですが、こちらが基本的な礼儀作法を示せばすぐに変わるでしょう。
mt: Parisians are known to be self-centered, arrogant and rude. This is an inaccurate stereotype, but the best way to get along in Paris is to be "well-mannered" and take the best actions. This way you can enjoy yourself. Although Parisians may seem difficult at first, they will change immediately if you show them basic etiquette.
ref: "Parisians have a reputation for being egocentric, rude and arrogant. While this is often only an inaccurate stereotype, the best way to get along in Paris still is to be on your best behavior, acting like someone who is ""bien élevé"" (well brought up). It will make getting about considerably easier. Parisians' abrupt exteriors will rapidly evaporate if you display some basic courtesies."

It will make getting about considerably easier. Parisians' abrupt exteriors will rapidly evaporate if you display some basic courtesies."

src: メトロレールには、ケープタウンとその周辺を結ぶ通勤電車があり、メトロプラス（通称ファーストクラス）とメトロ（通称サードクラス）の2つに分かれています。 メトロプラスは、混雑が少なくて快適ですがやや割高で、それでもヨーロッパにおける通常のメトロ乗車券よりは安価です。 どの列車にもメトロプラスとメトロの両方の客車があり、メトロプラスの客車は常にケープタウンに一番近い列車の最後尾にあります。
mt: The Metrorail is a commuter train that connects Cape Town and its surrounding areas. It is divided into two classes: Metrorail Plus (commonly known as First Class) and Metrorail (commonly known as Third Class). Metrorail Plus is less crowded and more comfortable, but is slightly more expensive than the usual European metro fare. Both Metrorail Plus and Metrorail trains have cars for both classes, and the Metrorail Plus cars are always at the end of the train closest to Cape Town.
ref: MetroRail has two classes on commuter trains in and around Cape Town: MetroPlus (also called First Class) and Metro (called Third Class). MetroPlus is more comfortable and less crowded but slightly more expensive, though still cheaper than normal metro tickets in Europe. Every train has both MetroPlus and Metro coaches; the MetroPlus coaches are always on the end of the train nearest Cape Town.

src: 旅行客は、自分の居住地では馴染みのない病害動物に遭遇することがあります。 害虫は食物を台無しにしたり、皮膚を刺したり、最悪の場合はアレルギー反応の原因になったり、毒を撒き散らしたり、感染症を媒介することがあります。 感染症自体や、力ずくで人を殺傷する危険動物は、通常は有害生物には該当しません。
mt: Travelers may encounter unfamiliar pests in their home regions. Pests can contaminate food, sting the skin, cause allergic reactions, scatter poison, or transmit disease. Diseases themselves or dangerous animals that kill or injure people are not usually considered pests.
ref: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions. Pests can spoil food, cause irritation, or in a worse case cause allergic reactions, spread venom, or transmit infections. Infectious diseases themselves, or dangerous animals that can injure or kill people by force, do not usually qualify as pests.

src: 街角のどこの店にも、公衆電話や一般電話で使えるプリペイド式のテレホンカードがずらりと並んでいます。 ほとんどのカードでどこにでも通話できますが、特定国の何か国かにかける場合に通話料が割引になるカードもあります。 これらのサービスにアクセスするには、多くの場合、ほとんどの電話から無料で通話できるフリーダイヤルの番号にかけます。
mt: Prepaid telephone cards are ubiquitous on street corners. Most cards allow you to call anywhere, but some cards offer discounts for calling certain countries. To access these services, you usually dial a free directory assistance number from most phones.
ref: Every corner store is filled with a confusing array of pre-paid phone cards that can be used from pay phones or ordinary telephones. While most cards are good for calling anywhere, some specialise in providing favourable call rates to specific groups of countries. Access to these services is often through a toll-free telephone number that can be called from most phones without charge.

src: プリトヴィッツェ湖群国立公園は、アルプスと地中海の植生が混在する広大な森（主にブナ、トウヒ、モミ）に大小16の湖が点在し、絶景で溢れる世界遺産です。 微気候のため、土壌や標高の範囲が極めて広いので、植物群落の種類が非常に豊富です。 また、この地域には多種多様な動物や鳥類が生息しています。 ヨーロッパのヒグマ、オオカミ、ワシ、フクロウ、オオヤマネコ、ヤマネコ、カペルカイリーなどの希少種が見られ、より多くの普通種がともに生息しています。
mt: The Prutivtze Lakes National Park is a vast forest (mainly beech, fir, and pine) with 16 lakes scattered throughout, where the Alpine and Mediterranean vegetation coexist. Due to the microclimate, the soil and altitude range are very wide, so the plant species are very rich. In addition, many animals and birds live in this area. Rare species such as the European brown bear, wolf, eagle, owl, lynx, and capercaillie can be seen, and many ordinary species live together.
ref: The Plitvice Lakes national park is heavily forested, mainly with beech, spruce, and fir trees, and features a mixture of Alpine and Mediterranean vegetation. It has a notably wide variety of plant communities, due to its range of microclimates, differing soils and varying levels of altitude. The area is also home to an extremely wide variety of animal and bird species. Rare fauna such as the European brown bear, wolf, eagle, owl, lynx, wild cat and capercaillie can be found there, along with many more common species

src: マスコミ関係の企業は、この目的について「海賊版を防するため」と主張して日常的に嘘をついています。 実際には、リージョンコードは違法コピーにはまったく効果がありません。ディスクをビットごとにコピーすれば、原本を再生できる機器であれば問題なく再生されます。 実際の目的は、これらの企業に市場の統制権を与えることであり、すべては金儲けのためです。
mt: Media-related companies claim this is to prevent piracy, but in reality region codes have no effect on illegal copies.  If a disc is copied bit-for-bit, it can be played on any device that can play the original.  The real purpose is to give these companies control over the market, and it's all about the money.
ref: "The media companies routinely lie about the purpose of this, claiming that it is to ""prevent piracy"". In fact, region codes have absolutely no effect on illegal copying; a bit-for-bit copy of a disk will play just fine on any device where the original will. The actual purpose is to give those companies more control over their markets; it's all about money spinning."

src: 帰国時の入国審査は省略されたり、たいてい形式的にすまされますが、税関検査は面倒なものになる可能性があります。 持ち込み可のものと不可のを確認し、法律で定められた限度を超えるものは申告しましょう。
mt: Customs inspections can be time-consuming, so check what you can and cannot bring back, and declare anything over the legal limit.
ref: While immigration check is usually absent or a formality when you arrive in your homeland, customs control can be a hassle. Make sure you know what you can and cannot bring in and declare anything over the legal limits.

src: 帰国時の入国審査は省略されたり、たいてい形式的にすまされますが、税関検査は面倒なものになる可能性があります。 持ち込み可のものと不可のを確認し、法律で定められた限度を超えるものは申告しましょう。
mt: Customs inspections can be time-consuming, so check what you can and cannot bring back, and declare anything over the legal limit.
ref: While immigration check is usually absent or a formality when you arrive in your homeland, customs control can be a hassle. Make sure you know what you can and cannot bring in and declare anything over the legal limits.

src: コチャモ渓谷 - 南米のヨセミテと呼ばれるチリの最高峰の登山地で、花崗岩の大きな壁や岩場の数々があります。 頂上から眺めると、息をのむような景色が広がります。世界各地の登山家たちが、無限の可能性を秘めた壁に囲まれ、新しいルートを確立し続けています。
mt: The Cochamó Valley - the Yosemite of South America, known for its granite walls and boulders, is a hiker's paradise. From the top, you can see the breathtaking view. Mountain climbers from all over the world are surrounded by walls of infinite possibilities, establishing new routes and continuing to do so.
ref: Cochamó Valley - Chile's premier climbing destination, known as the Yosemite of South America, with a variety of granite big walls and crags. Summits include breath-taking views from peaks. Climbers from all parts of the world are continually establishing new routes amongst its endless potential of walls.

src: 南半球には大洋横断ルートがないので、完全に世界一周をしたい場合、運航便や目的地の選択肢が限られてきます。 南半球の3つの海洋すべてを横断する便を就航している航空会社はありません（スカイチームはいずれの海洋を横断する便も就航していません）。 しかし、スターアライアンスは、サンティアゴ・デ・チリからタヒチまでの南太平洋東部を除く全域を対象地域とし、サンティアゴ・デ・チリからタヒチまでの便はLATAMワンワールドが就航しています。 南太平洋や南米の西海岸を通り越したい場合、この便が唯一の選択肢というわけではありません（下記参照）。
mt: There are no airlines that fly across all three oceans of the Southern Hemisphere, and there are no airlines that fly across the Southern Hemisphere without stopping. However, Star Alliance has the entire Southern Pacific Ocean except for the east as its target area, and LATAM One World flies from Santiago de Chile to Tahiti. This is not the only option if you want to fly through the Southern Pacific or the west coast of South America (see below).
ref: If you want to fly around the world completely in the Southern Hemisphere, the choice of flights and destinations is limited due to the lack of transoceanic routes. No airline alliance covers all three ocean crossings in the Southern Hemisphere (and SkyTeam covers none of the crossings). However, Star Alliance covers everything except the eastern South Pacific from Santiago de Chile to Tahiti, which is a LATAM Oneworld flight. This flight is not the only option if you want to skip the South Pacific and the west coast of South America. (see below)

src: 国際的には、200近くの旅ラン運営組織があります。そのほとんどが独立系です。 Global Running Toursの後継となるGo Running Toursは、4大陸にわたり何十社もの旅ラン業者をネットワークで結んでいます。 バルセロナの「Running Tours Barcelona」やコペンハーゲンの「Running Copenhagen」をルーツに、プラハを拠点とする「Running Tours Prague」などがすぐに参加しました。
mt: Internationally, there are about 200 running tour operators. Most are independent. Go Running Tours, the successor to Global Running Tours, has networked with dozens of tour operators across four continents. Running Tours Barcelona in Barcelona, Running Copenhagen in Copenhagen, and Running Tours Prague, based in Prague, were among the first to join.
ref: Internationally, there are nearly 200 running tour organizations. Most of them operate independently. The Global Running Tours successor, Go Running Tours networks dozens of sightrunning providers on four continents. With roots in Barcelona's Running Tours Barcelona and Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, it was quickly joined by Running Tours Prague based in Prague and others.

src: 国際的には、200近くの旅ラン運営組織があります。そのほとんどが独立系です。 Global Running Toursの後継となるGo Running Toursは、4大陸にわたり何十社もの旅ラン業者をネットワークで結んでいます。 バルセロナの「Running Tours Barcelona」やコペンハーゲンの「Running Copenhagen」をルーツに、プラハを拠点とする「Running Tours Prague」などがすぐに参加しました。

src: サファリはおそらくアフリカで最高の観光名所であり、多くの観光客にとって観光の目玉です。 サファリとは、アフリカの野生動物、特にサバンナにいる野生動物の観察を目的とした陸路での旅行を指します。 象やキリンなど、一部の動物は車に近寄ってくる傾向があるので、標準的な機器を利用すればはっきりと観察できます。 ライオン、チーター、ヒョウは意外に憶病なので、よく見えるように双眼鏡を使うことになります。 ウォーキングサファリ（別名は「ブッシュウォーク」、「ハイキングサファリ」、「徒歩見学」）は、数時間から数日間かけてサファリゾーンを歩いて回る企画です。
mt: The safari is probably the best tourist attraction in Africa and a must-see for many tourists. Safari means a land-based tour to observe wild animals, especially those in the savanna. Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach cars, so you can observe them clearly with standard equipment. Lions, cheetahs, and hyenas are surprisingly shy, so you will need binoculars to see them well. Walking safari (also known as "bush walk," "hiking safari," or "foot tour") is a plan to walk around the safari zone for several hours to several days.
ref: "Safaris are perhaps the greatest tourism draw in Africa and the highlight for many visitors. The term safari in popular use refers to overland travel to view the stunning African wildlife, particularly on savanna. Some animals, such as elephants and giraffes, tend to approach closely to cars and standard equipment will allow good viewing. Lions, cheetahs and leopards are sometimes shy and you will see them better with binoculars. A walking safari (also called a ""bush walk"", ""hiking safari"", or going ""footing"") consists of hiking, either for a few hours or several days."

src: 人数の多い団体ならばツアーがお得になるので、1人旅や友人と2人で旅行する代わりに、寄り集まって4～6人の団体で参加すれば、1人当たりの料金がお得になります。 しかし、この場合は警戒心を解いてはいけません。多くの場合、観光客はごちゃ混ぜに乗車させられるからです。 実際には、人を騙してもっと料金を払わなければならないと思い込ませる方法のようです。
mt: 1 person or 2 people traveling together can save money by joining a group tour. However, you should be careful. In many cases, tourists are mixed in with the group. It seems that they are tricked into thinking they have to pay more money.
ref: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate. However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars. It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.

src: 人数の多い団体ならばツアーがお得になるので、1人旅や友人と2人で旅行する代わりに、寄り集まって4～6人の団体で参加すれば、1人当たりの料金がお得になります。 しかし、この場合は警戒心を解いてはいけません。多くの場合、観光客はごちゃ混ぜに乗車させられるからです。 実際には、人を騙してもっと料金を払わなければならないと思い込ませる方法のようです。

However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars. It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.

src: サンフランシスコの経済は、同都市が世界的な観光地であることと切り離せませんが、その経済は多様化しています。 最大の雇用セクターは、専門サービス、政府、金融、貿易、観光です。 音楽、映画、文学、大衆文化に頻繁に登場することで、サンフランシスコとそのランドマークは世界中に知られるようになりました。 サンフランシスコは、多数のホテル、レストラン、一流の式場・展示会場など、大規模な観光インフラを開発してきました。 サンフランシスコはその他のアジア料理でも全米で指折りの都市であり、韓国料理、タイ料理、インド料理、日本料理など各国の店が揃っています。
mt: The economy of San Francisco is not separable from the fact that the city is a world-famous tourist destination. The largest employment sectors are specialized services, government, finance, trade, and tourism. San Francisco and its landmarks have become known worldwide through frequent appearances in music, film, literature, and popular culture. San Francisco has developed large-scale tourist infrastructure, including many hotels, restaurants, and large convention and exhibition halls. San Francisco is also a leading city in Asian cuisine in the United States, with Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese restaurants.
ref: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified. The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism. Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world. San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities. San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.

src: サンフランシスコの経済は、同都市が世界的な観光地であることと切り離せませんが、その経済は多様化しています。 最大の雇用セクターは、専門サービス、政府、金融、貿易、観光です。 音楽、映画、文学、大衆文化に頻繁に登場することで、サンフランシスコとそのランドマークは世界中に知られるようになりました。 サンフランシスコは、多数のホテル、レストラン、一流の式場・展示会場など、大規模な観光インフラを開発してきました。 サンフランシスコはその他のアジア料理でも全米で指折りの都市であり、韓国料理、タイ料理、インド料理、日本料理など各国の店が揃っています。

src: 事前に予約しておけば、旅行者にとって目的地に着いたら寝場所があるという安心感につながります。 旅行代理店の多くは、特定のホテルと契約していますが、キャンプ場など他の宿泊施設も旅行代理店を通して予約できることがあります。 通常、旅行代理店は朝食、空港とホテルを結ぶ交通手段の手配、あるいは航空券とホテルを組み合わせたパッケージを提供しています。 また、申し出を考える時間や渡航先に持っていく他の書類（ビザなど）を調達する時間が必要な場合には、予約を保留することもできます。 しかし、変更願いや要望は、ホテルに直接ではなく、まず旅行代理店に連絡してください。
mt: Making a reservation ahead of time can give travelers a sense of security that they will have a place to stay when they arrive at their destination. Many travel agencies have contracts with specific hotels, but other lodging facilities such as campgrounds can also be booked through travel agencies. Most travel agencies offer breakfast, transportation between the airport and the hotel, or packages that combine airfare and hotel. If you need time to consider your offer or to obtain other documents (visas, for example) that you will need to take with you on your trip, you can also put your reservation on hold. However, if you want to change or request something, please contact the travel agency first, not the hotel directly.
ref: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination. Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent. Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages. They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa). Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.

src: 事前に予約しておけば、旅行者にとって目的地に着いたら寝場所があるという安心感につながります。 旅行代理店の多くは、特定のホテルと契約していますが、キャンプ場など他の宿泊施設も旅行代理店を通して予約できることがあります。 通常、旅行代理店は朝食、空港とホテルを結ぶ交通手段の手配、あるいは航空券とホテルを組み合わせたパッケージを提供しています。 また、申し出を考える時間や渡航先に持っていく他の書類（ビザなど）を調達する時間が必要な場合には、予約を保留することもできます。 しかし、変更願いや要望は、ホテルに直接ではなく、まず旅行代理店に連絡してください。
mt: Making a reservation ahead of time can give travelers a sense of security that they will have a place to stay when they arrive at their destination. Many travel agencies have contracts with specific hotels, but other lodging facilities such as campgrounds can also be booked through travel agencies. Most travel agencies offer breakfast, transportation between the airport and the hotel, or packages that combine airfare and hotel. If you need time to consider your offer or to obtain other documents (visas, for example) that you will need to take with you on your trip, you can also put your reservation on hold. However, if you want to change or request something, please contact the travel agency first, not the hotel directly.
ref: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination. Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent. Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages. They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa). Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.

src: リアルタイムテキスト翻訳アプリ - テキストのセグメント全体をある言語から別の言語に自動的に翻訳できるアプリケーションです。 このカテゴリのアプリケーションの中には、ユーザーがスマートフォンを対象物に向けると、現実世界の看板やその他の対象物に書かれた外国語テキストを翻訳できるものもあります。 翻訳エンジンは劇的に向上しており、今では多くの場合、かなり適切な翻訳を提供するように（そして、わけのわからない文になることは非常に少なく）なりましたが、それでもまだまったくの誤訳もあるので少し注意が必要です。 このカテゴリーで最も有名なアプリの1つがGoogle翻訳であり、翻訳したい言語データをダウンロードした後でオフライン翻訳が可能です。
mt: Real-time text translation app - An app that automatically translates the entire segment of text from one language to another. Some apps in this category allow users to point their smartphone at real-world signs or other objects with foreign-language text, and translate the text. Translation engines have improved dramatically, and now often provide quite reasonable translations (and rarely result in gibberish), but still there are still some completely wrong translations, so a little caution is needed. One of the most famous apps in this category is Google Translate, which allows offline translation after downloading language data.
ref: Real-time text translator apps – applications that are capable of automatically translating whole segments of text from one language into another. Some of the applications in this category can even translate texts in foreign languages on signs or other objects in the real world when the user points the smartphone towards those objects. The translation engines have improved dramatically, and now often give more or less correct translations (and more seldom gibberish), but some care is due, as they still may have gotten it all wrong. One of the most prominent apps in this category is Google Translate, which allows offline translation after downloading the desired language data.

src: 雪崩は異常現象ではありません。急斜面で支えられる積雪量には限度があり、余った量は雪崩として崩れ落ちます。 問題は、雪に粘着性があるので、落ちてくるには何らかのきっかけが必要で、落ちてくる雪の一部が残りの雪が落ちるきっかけになりうるということです。 そもそもの引き金となる事象は、太陽の熱による雪解け、降雪量の増加、その他の自然現象などであったり、人為的な要因である場合もよくあります。
mt: Avalanches are not abnormal phenomena. There is a limit to the amount of snow that can be supported on a steep slope, and the excess snow falls as an avalanche. The problem is that snow has adhesiveness, so some kind of trigger is needed for it to fall, and some of the falling snow can become the trigger for the rest of the snow to fall. The initial trigger can be natural phenomena such as snowmelt from the sun, increased snowfall, or other natural phenomena, or it can be a man-made cause.
ref: Avalanches are not an abnormality; steep slopes can hold only so much slow, and the excess volumes will come down as avalanches. The problem is that snow is sticky, so it needs some triggering to come down, and some snow coming down can be the triggering event for the rest. Sometimes the original trigging event is the sun warming the snow, sometimes some more snowfall, sometimes other natural events, often a human.

src: カレーは、ハーブやスパイスをベースに、肉や野菜を煮込む料理です。 カレーは水分量に応じて「ドライ」か「ウェット」のどちらかに分類されます。 北インドやパキスタンの内陸部では、カレーにヨーグルトをよく使い、南インドや亜大陸の沿岸部ではココナッツミルクをよく使います。
mt: Curry is a dish in which meat and vegetables are stewed in a base of herbs and spices. Curry is classified as "dry" or "wet" depending on its water content. In the interior of northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is often used in curry, while in southern India and the subcontinent's coastal regions, coconut milk is often used.
ref: "A curry is a dish based on herbs and spices, together with either meat or vegetables. A curry can be either ""dry"" or ""wet"" depending on the amount of liquid. In inland regions of Northern India and Pakistan, yogurt is commonly used in curries; in Southern India and some other coastal regions of the subcontinent, coconut milk is commonly used."

src: マクマード南極点道路（またはハイウェイ）は、ロス海のマクマード基地から極点まで1600 kmにわたって続く道です。 クレバスが圧雪で埋まり、旗で印をつけてあります。燃料や物資を積んだソリを積み込んだ専用トラクターでしか移動できません。 これらはあまり小回りがきかないので、自然歩道を通って高原に出ようとすると南極大陸の山々をぐるりと回らなければなりません。
mt: The McMurdo-South Pole Road (or Highway) is a 1,600-kilometer (990-mile) road that runs from the McMurdo Station on the Ross Sea to the South Pole. Crevasse crossings are marked with flags. Only specialized tractors that can carry fuel and supplies can move along the road. These vehicles are not very maneuverable, so if you want to walk the natural trail to the high plateau, you must circumnavigate the mountains of the Antarctic continent.
ref: The South Pole Traverse (or Highway) is a 1600 km trail from McMurdo Station on the Ross Sea to the Pole. It's compacted snow with crevasses filled in and marked by flags. It can only be traveled by specialized tractors, hauling sleds with fuel and supplies. These aren't very nimble so the trail has to take a long swerve around the Transantarctic Mountains to come onto the plateau.

src: 車でアフリカ南部に入るというのは、この地域の美しいものを観光できるだけでなく、通常の観光ルートから外れた場所にも行けるすごい方法です。 慎重に計画を立てれば普通の車でも可能ですが、四駆で行くことをお勧めします。多くの場所はホイールベースの長い四駆でなければたどり着けません。 アフリカ南部は安定していますが、隣国すべてが安定しているわけではないので注意しましょう。 ビザの要件や申請にかかる費用は国ごとに異なり、また出身国にも左右されます。 また、国ごとに法律で車内に備えるべき緊急用品を定めています。
mt: Driving into southern Africa is a great way to see the beautiful things that are off the beaten track. It is possible with a normal car if you plan carefully, but a 4x4 is recommended. Many places are only accessible with a long wheelbase 4x4. Southern Africa is stable, but not all neighbouring countries are stable, so be careful. Visa requirements and fees vary by country and are also affected by your country of origin. Each country also has laws about what emergency supplies you must have in your car.
ref: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes. This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4. Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are. Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from. Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.

src: 他人のために持ち歩く - 特に国境を越えるときは、絶対に手荷物から目を離してはいけません。 気付かないうちに自分が麻薬の運び屋として利用されている可能性があり、そうなったら大きなトラブルに巻き込まれることになるでしょう。 麻薬探知犬は緊急出動を要請される可能性が常にあるので、列に並んで待機するのも仕事です。 国によっては、初犯であっても、10年以上の懲役刑や死刑など、非常に厳しい罰則を設けています。 手荷物から目を放すと置き引きに狙われるだけでなく、爆弾の脅威を警戒している当局からも目をつけられる場合があります。
mt: 1. Carry for others - especially when crossing borders, you should never take your eyes off your hand luggage. You may be unknowingly used as a drug mule, and if so, you will be caught up in a big trouble. Drug-sniffing dogs are often called upon, so waiting in line is also part of the job. Depending on the country, even first-time offenders can face up to 10 years in prison or death. Not only can you be targeted by pickpockets, but you can also be targeted by authorities who are on the lookout for bombs.
ref: Carrying for others - Never let your bags out of your sight, especially when you are crossing international borders. You could find yourself being used as a drug carrier without your knowledge, which will land you in a great deal of trouble. This includes waiting in line, as drug-sniffing dogs could be used at any time without notice. Some countries have exceedingly draconian punishments even for first time offenses; these can include prison sentences of over 10 years or death. Unattended bags are a target for theft and can also attract attention from authorities wary of bomb threats.

src: 朝はリッチなコーヒー、夜はリラックスできるカモミールティーのアロマをお家いっぱいに広げましょう。 遠くに出歩かなくても、自分へのご褒美としていつもよりも時間をかけて特別な飲み物を淹れるなどして休暇を楽しめます。 もっと冒険したいと思ったら、この機会にスムージーを絞るかブレンドしてみてはいかがでしょうか。 日常生活に戻ったときに、朝食に簡単に作れる飲み物が見つかるかもしれません。 飲酒文化が多様化している都市に住んでいる場合は、あまり行ったことのない近所の居酒屋やパブに行ってみましょう。
mt: In the morning, rich coffee, in the evening, relaxing camomile tea, spread the aroma of the house. You can enjoy vacation by spending more time than usual to make special drinks for yourself without going out far. If you want to be more adventurous, try squeezing or blending smoothies this opportunity. You may find a drink that can be easily made for breakfast when you return to daily life. If you live in a city where the drinking culture is diversified, try going to a nearby pub or bar that you have not been to before.
ref: Fill your home with a rich coffee in the morning and some relaxing chamomile tea at night. When you're on a staycation, you have the time to treat yourself and take a few extra minutes to brew up something special. If you're feeling more adventurous, take the opportunity to juice or blend up some smoothies: maybe you'll discover a simple beverage that you can make for breakfast when you're back to your daily routine. If you live in a city with a varied drinking culture, go to bars or pubs in neighborhoods you don't frequent.

src: ハルダルシクの村からは、近くのエストゥロイ島が見え、村には珍しい八角形の教会があります。 教会の墓地では、興味深い大理石製の鳩の彫刻が一部の墓に飾られています。 興味をそそられる村を30分ほど散策するのは価値があります。
mt: From the village of Haldarsvik, the nearby island of Esturoy is visible, and the village has a rare octagonal church.  The church graveyard has interesting carved doves on some of the gravestones.  A walk around the village for 30 minutes is worthwhile.
ref: The village of Haldarsvík offer views of the nearby island Eysturoy and has an unusual octagonal church. In the churchyard, there are interesting marble sculptures of doves over some tombs. It's worth half an hour to stroll about the intriguing village.

src: 観光やビジネスで短期滞在するのであればビザがいらない場合もありますが、留学生として渡航する場合は、一般的にカジュアルな観光客として渡航するよりも長期滞在が必要となります。 一般的に、どこであれ外国に長期滞在しようとする場合は、事前にビザを取得する必要があります。 学生ビザは一般的に通常の観光ビザやビジネスビザとは要件や申手続きが異なります。 ほとんどの国では、留学を希望する教育機関からの入学許可書と、少なくとも初年度の課程に必要な資金があることを証明する書類が必要となります。 留学先の入国管理局のほか、教育機関にも詳細な要件を確認しておきましょう。
mt: If you are visiting for a short time for tourism or business, you may not need a visa, but if you are coming as a student, you will likely need to stay longer than a casual tourist and will generally need to obtain a visa before you go.  Student visas are generally different from tourist or business visas in terms of requirements and application procedures.  In most countries, you will need a letter of acceptance from the educational institution you hope to attend and proof that you have enough money to cover the first year of your course.  Check with the immigration office in your destination country and with the educational institution for details.
ref: While you may not need a visa for short visits to certain countries as a tourist or for business, going there as an international student generally requires a longer stay than going there just as a casual tourist. In general, staying in any foreign country for an extended period of time will require you to obtain a visa in advance. Student visas generally have different requirements and application procedures from normal tourist or business visas. For most countries, you will need an offer letter from the institution you wish to study at, and also evidence of funds to support yourself for at least the first year of your course. Check with the institution, as well as the immigration department for the country you wish to study in for detailed requirements.

src: 観光やビジネスで短期滞在するのであればビザがいらない場合もありますが、留学生として渡航する場合は、一般的にカジュアルな観光客として渡航するよりも長期滞在が必要となります。 一般的に、どこであれ外国に長期滞在しようとする場合は、事前にビザを取得する必要があります。 学生ビザは一般的に通常の観光ビザやビジネスビザとは要件や申手続きが異なります。 ほとんどの国では、留学を希望する教育機関からの入学許可書と、少なくとも初年度の課程に必要な資金があることを証明する書類が必要となります。 留学先の入国管理局のほか、教育機関にも詳細な要件を確認しておきましょう。
mt: If you are visiting for a short time for tourism or business, you may not need a visa, but if you are coming as a student, you will likely need to stay longer than a casual tourist and will generally need to obtain a visa before you go.  Student visas are generally different from tourist or business visas in terms of requirements and application procedures.  In most countries, you will need a letter of acceptance from the educational institution you hope to attend and proof that you have enough money to cover the first year of your course.  Check with the immigration office in your destination country and with the educational institution for details.
ref: While you may not need a visa for short visits to certain countries as a tourist or for business, going there as an international student generally requires a longer stay than going there just as a casual tourist. In general, staying in any foreign country for an extended period of time will require you to obtain a visa in advance. Student visas generally have different requirements and application procedures from normal tourist or business visas. For most countries, you will need an offer letter from the institution you wish to study at, and also evidence of funds to support yourself for at least the first year of your course. Check with the institution, as well as the immigration department for the country you wish to study in for detailed requirements.

src: 特に夏場に熱帯雨林の中をハイキングしようと思ったら、蚊に注意する必要があります。 亜熱帯雨林を車で走行するにしても、乗り降りのためにドアを開けている数秒だけで蚊が車内に入ってくるのに十分な時間です。
mt: Especially in the summer, if you plan to hike in the rainforest, you should be aware of mosquitoes. Even if you are driving through the rainforest, the mosquitoes can enter the car in the few seconds it takes to open the door to get in and out.
ref: In summer, especially, you'll need to watch out for mosquitoes if you decide to hike through the rainforest. Even if you're driving through the subtropical rainforest, a few seconds with the doors open while you get inside the vehicle is enough time for mosquitoes to get in the vehicle with you.

src: 特に夏場に熱帯雨林の中をハイキングしようと思ったら、蚊に注意する必要があります。 亜熱帯雨林を車で走行するにしても、乗り降りのためにドアを開けている数秒だけで蚊が車内に入ってくるのに十分な時間です。
mt: Especially in the summer, if you plan to hike in the rainforest, you should be aware of mosquitoes. Even if you are driving through the rainforest, the mosquitoes can enter the car in the few seconds it takes to open the door to get in and out.
ref: In summer, especially, you'll need to watch out for mosquitoes if you decide to hike through the rainforest. Even if you're driving through the subtropical rainforest, a few seconds with the doors open while you get inside the vehicle is enough time for mosquitoes to get in the vehicle with you.

src: スンダルバンスは世界最大の沿岸マングローブ地帯であり、海岸からバングラデシュとインドの内陸地域まで80 km（50マイル）にわたって広がっています。 スンダルバン山脈はユネスコの世界遺産に登録されています。インド領内にある森の一部はスンダルバンス国立公園と呼ばれています。 この森林はただマングローブが生えているだけの沼地ではありません。森林には、かつてヒンドゥスターン平野を覆っていた広大なジャングルが残っている最後の場所も含まれています。 スンダルバンスの面積は3,850 km²で、その約3分の1は水域/湿地帯で覆われています。 1966年からスンダルバンスは野生動物保護区となり、現在では推定で400頭のロイヤルベンガルトラと約30,000頭のアクシスジカが生息しています。
mt: Sundarbans is the largest mangrove forest in the world, stretching 80 km (50 miles) inland from the coast to the interior regions of Bangladesh and India. The Sundarban Mountains are a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Some of the forest in Indian territory is called the Sundarbans National Park. This forest is not just a swamp covered with mangroves. It also includes the last remaining vast jungle that once covered the Hindustan Plain. The Sundarbans covers an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered by water and wetlands. The Sundarbans has been a wildlife sanctuary since 1966, and is estimated to have 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer.
ref: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast. The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park. The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain. The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas. Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.

src: 世界には5,000以上の言語があり、そのうち5,000万人以上の話者がいる言語は20を超えます。 また、書き言葉の方が話し言葉よりも理解しやすいことが多いでしょう。特に住所の場合がそうであり、住所は相手に聞き取りやすく発音するのが難しいものです。 多くの国では国民全体が英語に堪能であり、さらに多くの場合、特に若者たちには限られた知識しか期待できません。 マンチェスター、ボストン、ジャマイカ人、またシドニーの出身者たちがトロントのレストランで揃ってテーブルを囲み、食事をする様子を想像してみてください。 彼らは、それぞれの訛りや方言で故郷の話をしています。
mt: There are over 5,000 languages in the world, and over 20 have more than 5 million speakers.  In addition, written language is often easier to understand than spoken language, especially when it comes to addresses.  In many countries, the entire population is fluent in English, and in many cases, only limited knowledge is expected of the younger generation.  Imagine a table full of people from Manchester, Boston, Jamaica, and Sydney, sitting down to eat at a restaurant in Toronto, each speaking in their own accent or dialect about their hometowns.
ref: The world has over 5,000 different languages, including more than twenty with 50 million or more speakers. Written words are often easier to understand than spoken words, also. This is especially true of addresses, which are often difficult to pronounce intelligibly. Many entire nations are completely fluent in English, and in even more you can expect a limited knowledge - especially among younger people. Imagine, if you will, a Mancunian, Bostonian, Jamaican and Sydneysider sitting around a table having dinner at a restaurant in Toronto. They're regaling each other with stories from their hometowns, told in their distinct accents and local argot.

src: バスは一日中地区間バスステーション(川を渡って)を出発しますが、ほとんどのバス、特に東に向かうバスとジャカール/ブムタンに向かうものは、午前6時30分から午前7時30分の間に出発します。 区間バスは満員になることが多いので、数日前までに乗車券を購入しておくことをお勧めします。 ほとんどの地区には日本製のコースターバスが運行し、いずれも快適で頑丈な小型バスです。 パロ（150ニュルタム）やプナカ（200ニュルタム）など、近くの場所への移動には、タクシーを利用するのが便利です。
mt: Buses depart from the area bus station (across the river) all day, but most buses, especially those going east and those going to Jakar/Bumthang, depart between 6:30 and 7:30 am.  Intercity buses are often full, so it is recommended to purchase tickets a few days in advance.  Most areas have Japanese-made coaster buses running, all of which are comfortable and sturdy small buses.  Taxis are convenient for moving to nearby places such as Paro (150 Nu. Tam) or Punakha (200 Nu. Tam).
ref: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30. As the inter-district buses are often full, it is advisable to purchase a ticket a few days in advance. Most districts are served by small Japanese Coaster Buses, which are comfortable and sturdy. Shared taxis are a quick and comfortable means to travel to nearby places, such as Paro (Nu 150) and Punakha (Nu 200).

src: 「ティンブクトゥ」という地名は、簡単には行けない場所であることと相まって、エキゾチックで遠い土地の隠喩として使われるようになりました。 現在のティンブクトゥは、その評判から観光地となっており、空港もありますが貧しい町です。 砂漠の砂による脅威から保護するため、1990年には危険な世界遺産のリストに追加されました。 ヘンリー・ルイス・ゲイツ制作のPBS特別番組Wonders of the African World（アフリカ世界の不思議）で主な立ち寄り先の1つでした。 この都市は、アフリカの都市というよりもアラビア色が強く、国内の他の都市とは対照的な雰囲気です。
mt: "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for a faraway, exotic place, because of its reputation as a place that is hard to get to. The current Timbuktu is a poor town, despite its tourist status, and its airport, and was added to the list of dangerous World Heritage Sites in 1990 to protect it from the threat of desert sand. It was one of the main stops in the PBS special Wonders of the African World by Henry Louis Gates. The city has a strong Arab influence, and a different atmosphere from other cities in the country.
ref: "Combined with its relative inaccessibility, ""Timbuktu"" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands. Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport. In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands. It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World. The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African."

src: パラリンピックの開催期間は2021年8月24日から9月5日までの予定です。日本全国の各地で催される競技もあります。 東京は、1964年の開催以来、夏季オリンピックを2回開催したアジアで唯一の都市となります。 延期が発表される前に2020年の航空券や宿泊施設を予約していた方は、面倒な状況に陥る可能性があります。 キャンセルポリシーはさまざまですが、3月下旬の時点で、ほとんどのコロナウイルス関連のキャンセルポリシーは、オリンピックが予定されていた2020年7月まで延長されません。 イベントチケットは2,500円～13万円の価格帯で、通常のチケットは約7,000円になると予想されています。
mt: 2021 Summer Paralympics will be held from August 24 to September 5. There will be competitions in various places throughout Japan. Tokyo will be the only city in Asia to have hosted the Summer Olympics twice since 1964. If you had booked tickets or accommodations for the 2020 Olympics before the postponement was announced, you may find yourself in a difficult situation. Most coronavirus-related cancellation policies will not be extended until July 2020, which was the original date of the Olympics. Tickets are expected to cost between 2,500 and 130,000 yen, while regular tickets are expected to cost around 7,000 yen.
ref: The Paralympics will take place from 24 August to 5 September 2021. Some events will be held in other locations throughout Japan. Tokyo will be the only Asian city to have hosted two summer Olympics, having hosted the games in 1964. If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation. Cancellation policies vary, but as of late March most coronavirus-based cancellation policies don't extend to July 2020, when the Olympics had been scheduled. It's expected that most event tickets will cost between ¥2,500 and ¥130,000, with typical tickets costing around ¥7,000.

src: 竜巻とは、非常に低圧の空気が回転している柱で、周囲の空気を内側に吸い込み、上に向かって上昇していきます。 竜巻は強風（通常は時速100～200マイル）を発生し、重量物を空中に舞い上がらせることがあり、舞い上がった物体は竜巻の移動に合わせて運ばれます。 竜巻は嵐雲から降下する漏斗状の渦として形成され始め、地面に触れると「竜巻」になります。
mt: A tornado is a column of very low pressure air that is rotating and sucking in the surrounding air, rising up into the sky. Tornadoes can cause strong winds (usually 100-200 mph), and can lift heavy objects into the air, which are then carried along with the tornado. Tornadoes are formed as funnel-shaped vortices that descend from thunderclouds, and become "tornadoes" when they touch the ground.
ref: "A tornado is a spinning column of very low-pressure air, which sucks the surrounding air inward and upward. They generate high winds (often 100-200 miles/hour) and can lift heavy objects into the air, carrying them as the tornado moves. They begin as funnels descending from storm clouds, and become ""tornadoes"" when they touch the ground."

src: 訪れようとする国が旅行勧告の対象となった場合、旅行健康保険や旅行キャンセル保険に影響する可能性があります。 自国以外の政府からの助言を参考にしてもかいまいませんが、そのような助言はその国の国民向けのものです。 例として、中東に暮らすアメリカ人は、ヨーロッパ人やアラブ人とは異なる状況に直面する可能性があります。 勧告は、ある国における安全保障状況の要約にすぎません。 提示された見解は、他の場所で入手可能なより詳細な情報に比べて、大雑把で単純化されすぎた上っ面だけのものが多い。
mt: If a country you are visiting is the subject of a travel advisory, it may affect your travel insurance or travel cancellation insurance. You can consult the advice of your government, but such advice is intended for the citizens of that country. For example, an American living in the Middle East may face a different situation than a European or Arab. The advisories are only a summary of the security situation in a given country. The advice given is often too superficial and simplified compared to more detailed information available in other places.
ref: If the country you will be visiting becomes subject to a travel advisory, your travel health insurance or your trip cancellation insurance may be affected. You may also wish to consult the advice of governments other than your own, but their advice is designed for their citizens. As one example, American citizens in the Middle East might face different situations from Europeans or Arabs. Advisories are merely a brief summary of the political situation in one country. The views presented are often cursory, general and oversimplified compared to the more detailed information available elsewhere.

The views presented are often cursory, general and oversimplified compared to the more detailed information available elsewhere.

src: 旅行代理店は19世紀から存在しています。自然、文化、言語、低所得国など、これまでに経験したことのない旅をお望みの旅行客は、旅行代理店を利用するのが良いでしょう。 ほとんどの代理店は、大半の定期予約を喜んで引き受けてくれますが、多くの代理店は、特定の種類の旅行、予算の範囲や目的地に特化しています。 自分好みの旅行を予約しやすい代理店を利用する方が良いでしょう。 ウェブサイトや店頭で、代理店がどのような旅行を宣伝しているかを見てみましょう。
mt: Travel agencies have existed since the 19th century. If you want to travel to a place you have never been before, a travel agency is a good option. Most agencies will happily take most of your regular bookings, but many agencies specialize in certain types of travel, within a budget range or to a specific destination. It is better to use an agency that specializes in the type of travel you want. Look at the websites or storefronts to see what kind of travel the agency advertises.
ref: Travel agencies have been around since the 19th century. A travel agent is usually a good option for a journey which extends beyond a traveller's previous experience of nature, culture, language or low-income countries. Although most agencies are willing to take on most regular bookings, many agents specialise in particular types of travel, budget ranges or destinations. It can be better to use an agent who frequently books similar trips to yours. Take a look at what trips the agent is promoting, whether on a website or in a shop window.

src: 旅行前にも旅行中にも、考慮しなければならないことがたくさんあります。 旅行先では、「自国」とは違うことを予想しましょう。マナー、法律、食べ物、交通、宿泊施設、基準、言語など、あなたの居住地とはある程度異なります。 現地の慣習に失望したり、嫌悪感を抱かないように、このことを常に心に留めておくべきことです。
mt: There are many things to consider before and during your trip. Expect things to be different at your destination. Manners, laws, food, transportation, accommodations, standards, and language are all different from your home. Don't be disappointed or disgusted by local customs, always keep this in mind.
ref: "There are many things you have to take into consideration before and when you travel somewhere. When you travel, expect things not to be like they are ""back home"". Manners, laws, food, traffic, lodging, standards, language and so on will to some extent differ from where you live. This is something you always need to keep in mind, to avoid disappointment or perhaps even distaste over local ways to do things."

src: 旅行前にも旅行中にも、考慮しなければならないことがたくさんあります。 旅行先では、「自国」とは違うことを予想しましょう。マナー、法律、食べ物、交通、宿泊施設、基準、言語など、あなたの居住地とはある程度異なります。 現地の慣習に失望したり、嫌悪感を抱かないように、このことを常に心に留めておくべきことです。

Manners, laws, food, transportation, accommodations, standards, and language are all different from your home. Don't be disappointed or disgusted by local customs, always keep this in mind.
ref: "There are many things you have to take into consideration before and when you travel somewhere. When you travel, expect things not to be like they are ""back home"". Manners, laws, food, traffic, lodging, standards, language and so on will to some extent differ from where you live. This is something you always need to keep in mind, to avoid disappointment or perhaps even distaste over local ways to do things."

src: 初めて途上国を旅行する場合、または世界各国の初めての地域を旅行する場合、潜在的なカルチャーショックを過小評価してはいけません。 落ち着きのある有能な旅行者の多くは、途上国の旅行で経験する目新しさに圧倒され、文化的な差異を埋めるためにすばやく微調整を重ねていきます。 特に、最初の数日間は、慣れるために、欧風の高級なホテルや食事、サービスにお金をかけることを検討してみてはいかがでしょうか。 現地の動物相がわからない地域では、地面にマットレスやパッドを敷いて寝ないようにしましょう。 キャンプ生活をする場合は、蛇やサソリなどから身を守るために、キャンプ用の簡易ベッドやハンモックを用意しましょう。
mt: When traveling to developing countries for the first time, or traveling to the first region of the world, do not underestimate the potential culture shock. Many of the most composed and capable travelers are overwhelmed by the novelty of developing countries and quickly make adjustments to bridge cultural differences. In particular, consider spending the first few days in a more expensive European-style hotel and eating at restaurants to get used to the place. In areas where you are unfamiliar with the local wildlife, do not sleep on the ground without a mattress or pad. If camping, make sure to protect yourself from snakes and scorpions with a camping cot or hammock.
ref: If traveling in a developing country for the first time – or in a new part of the world – don't underestimate the potential culture shock. Many a stable, capable traveler has been overcome by the newness of developing world travel, where many little cultural adjustments can add up quickly. Especially in your initial days, consider splurging on Western-style and -quality hotels, food, and services to help acclimatize. Do not sleep on a mattress or pad on the ground in areas where you do not know the local fauna. If you are going to camp out, bring a camp cot or hammock to keep you away from snakes, scorpions and such.

src: 保険契約書と保険会社の連絡先の写しを持ち歩きましょう。 問い合わせ、承認、請求に際しては、保険会社のメールアドレスと国際電話番号を示す必要があります。 複写を荷物の中に入れておくか、オンラインで保管（自分宛てのメールにファイルを添付するか、「クラウド」に保存）しておきましょう。 ノートパソコンやタブレットを携行して旅行する場合は、（インターネットなしでアクセス可能な）メモリやディスクに保存しておいてください。 旅仲間や無事の帰宅を願って協力してくれる親戚、友人にも保険契約書と連絡先の写しを渡しておきましょう。
mt: 1. Keep a copy of your insurance contract and the contact details of your insurance company with you. You will need to show the email address and international phone number of your insurance company when you are inquiring, approving, or requesting. Keep a copy of your insurance contract in your luggage or store it online (attach a file to your email or save it in the "cloud"). If you are traveling with a laptop or tablet, store it on a memory or disk that can be accessed without the Internet. Give a copy of your insurance contract and contact details to relatives and friends who will be helpful and wish you a safe return.
ref: "Make and carry copies of your policy and your insurer's contact details with you. They need to show the insurer's e-mail address and international phone numbers for advice/authorizations and making claims. Have another copy in your luggage and online (e-mail to yourself with attachment, or stored in the ""cloud""). If traveling with a laptop or tablet, store a copy in its memory or disc (accessible without the internet). Also give policy/contact copies to traveling companions and relatives or friends back home willing to help."

src: 長年にわたって、各種のフィルム形式が使用されてきました。標準的な35 mmフィルム（36×24 mmネガ）が最も一般的です。 使い果たしても補充しやすく、現在のデジタル一眼レフカメラとほぼ同等の解像度が得られます。 中判フィルムカメラの中には、6×6 cm、より正確には56×56 mmのネガを使用しているものもあります。 これで35 mmネガの約4倍の解像度（864に対して3136 mm2）が得られます。
mt: 35 mm film (36×24 mm negative) has been the most common format for many years. It is easy to replenish when used up, and it can achieve a resolution comparable to that of current digital single-lens reflex cameras. Some medium-format cameras use 6×6 cm (56×56 mm) negatives, which gives a resolution four times that of 35 mm negatives (864 vs. 3136 mm2).
ref: There are many different film formats that have been used over the years. Standard 35 mm film (36 by 24 mm negative) is much the commonest. It can usually be replenished fairly easily if you run out, and gives resolution roughly comparable to a current DSLR. Some medium-format film cameras use a 6 by 6 cm format, more precisely a 56 by 56 mm negative. This gives resolution almost four times that of a 35 mm negative (3136 mm2 versus 864).

src: 旅行ライターになるための最も簡単な方法は、有名な旅行ブログのウェブサイトで腕を磨くことです。 ウェブ上での書式設定や編集に慣れてきたら、後ほど自分のウェブサイトを作成できるかもしれません。
mt: The easiest way to become a travel writer is to hone your skills on well-known travel blog websites. Once you get used to formatting and editing on the web, you may be able to create your own website later.
ref: The easiest way to get started in the business of travel writing is to hone your skills on an established travel blog website. After you become comfortable with formatting and editing on the web, then later, you might create your own website.

src: 旅行ライターになるための最も簡単な方法は、有名な旅行ブログのウェブサイトで腕を磨くことです。 ウェブ上での書式設定や編集に慣れてきたら、後ほど自分のウェブサイトを作成できるかもしれません。
mt: The easiest way to become a travel writer is to hone your skills on well-known travel blog websites. Once you get used to formatting and editing on the web, you may be able to create your own website later.
ref: The easiest way to get started in the business of travel writing is to hone your skills on an established travel blog website. After you become comfortable with formatting and editing on the web, then later, you might create your own website.

src: 自宅では、その土地の細菌に常にさらされているため、すでに免疫ができている可能性が非常に高いのです。 しかし、細菌学的な動物相を経験していない他の地域では、問題に直面する可能性がはるかに高いのです。 また、気候が温暖であるほど、細菌は成長が速く、かつ体外でより長く生存します。 かくして、デリー腹、ファラオの呪い、モンテズマの復讐などなどの異名で呼ばれる下痢に旅行者は苦しむ。 寒冷気候で呼吸器系の問題が起きやすいように、高温気候で腸の問題が起きるのはかなり一般的で、ほとんどの場合、明らかに迷惑を被りますが、本当に危険ではありません。
mt: At home, you are constantly exposed to the bacteria of that land, so you are likely to already be immune. However, in other regions where you have not experienced the bacterial fauna, you are much more likely to face problems. Also, the warmer the climate, the faster the bacteria grow and survive longer outside the body. Thus, travelers suffer from Delhi belly, the curse of the pharaohs, and Montezuma's revenge, among other names for diarrhea. While respiratory problems are more common in cold climates, gastrointestinal problems are more common in hot climates, and while they are clearly an annoyance, they are not really dangerous.
ref: At home, due to this constant exposure to the local germs, odds are very high that you're already immune to them. But in other parts of the world, where the bacteriological fauna are new to you, you're far more likely to run into problems. Also, in warmer climates bacteria both grow more quickly and survive longer outside the body. Thus the scourges of Delhi Belly, the Pharaoh's Curse, Montezuma's Revenge, and their many friends. As with respiratory problems in colder climates, intestinal problems in hot climates are fairly common and in most cases are distinctly annoying but not really dangerous.

While respiratory problems are more common in cold climates, gastrointestinal problems are more common in hot climates, and while they are clearly an annoyance, they are not really dangerous.
ref: At home, due to this constant exposure to the local germs, odds are very high that you're already immune to them. src: ヨーロッパは比較的小さな大陸ですが、独立国が多数あります。通常の状況では、複数の国を旅行しようとすると、ビザの申請や入国審査がに何度も必要になります。 しかし、シェンゲン圏は、この点では一国のように機能します。 この圏内に留まっている限り、通常は出国審査を何度も受けることなく国境を越えることができます。 同じように、シェンゲンビザさえ取得すれば、シェンゲン加盟国のビザを個別に申請する必要がなくなり、時間、費用、事務処理の手間が相当に省けます。
mt: Europe is a small continent with many independent countries. Normally, when traveling to multiple countries, you will need to apply for visas and go through border inspections multiple times. However, the Schengen Area functions as if it were one country. As long as you stay within the area, you can usually cross borders without going through border inspections multiple times. Similarly, if you have a Schengen visa, you do not need to apply for visas for individual Schengen countries, saving you time, money, and paperwork.
ref: Europe is a continent that is relatively small but with many independent countries. Under normal circumstances, travelling through multiple countries would mean having to go through visa applications and passport control multiple times. The Schengen zone, however, works somewhat like one country in this respect. As long as you stay in this zone, you can generally cross borders without going through passport control checkpoints again. Similarly, by having a Schengen visa, you do not need to apply for visas to each of the Schengen member countries separately, hence saving time, money and paperwork.

src: ツタンカーメンの墓（KV62）。KV62は、ハワード・カーター氏が1922年に若い王の埋葬品をほぼ無傷の状態で発見した墓として知られています。 しかし、他の王家の墓のほとんどに比べ、ツタンカーメンの墓は、はるかに小さく、限られた装飾しかないことから、訪れる価値はほとんどありません。 棺から取り出す際にミイラが負った損傷の証拠を見たいと思っていた人は誰もが、頭部と肩しか見えないので、がっかりするでしょう。 この墓の素晴らしい宝物は、もはやその中にはなく、カイロのエジプト博物館に移されています。 時間的に余裕のない観光客は、他の場所で過ごした方が良いでしょう。
mt: The tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 is known for the almost intact burial goods found by Howard Carter in 1922. However, compared to most other royal tombs, the tomb of Tutankhamun is much smaller and has limited decoration, so it is not worth visiting. Anyone who wanted to see the evidence of damage to the mummy when it was removed from the coffin will be disappointed, as only the head and shoulders are visible. The wonderful treasures of this tomb are no longer in the tomb, but have been moved to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo. Tourists who are short on time should spend their time elsewhere.
ref: Tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 may be the most famous of the tombs in the Valley, the scene of Howard Carter's 1922 discovery of the almost intact royal burial of the young king. Compared to most of the other royal tombs, however, the tomb of Tutankhamun is barely worth visiting, being much smaller and with limited decoration. Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage to the mummy done during attempts to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible. The fabulous riches of the tomb are no longer in it, but have been removed to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo. Visitors with limited time would be best to spend their time elsewhere.

src: ボーエン島は、カヤック、ハイキング、買い物、食事などを楽しめる日帰り旅行や週末のお出かけに人気のスポットです。 この本格的なコミュニティはバンクーバー沖のハウ・サウンドに位置し、バンクーバーの商業地区にあるグランビル島から定期的に運航している水上タクシーで簡単に訪れることができます。 アウトドアを楽しむなら、シー・トゥ・スカイ回廊のトレッキングは欠かせません。 ウィスラー（バンクーバーから車で1時間半）は物価高ですが、2010年に冬季オリンピックが開催されたことで有名です。 冬には北米で最高のスキーを楽しみ、夏には本格的なマウンテンバイクに乗ってみましょう。
mt: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend getaway spot for kayaking, hiking, shopping, and dining. This full-service community is located in Howe Sound off Vancouver and can be easily reached by a water taxi that runs regularly from Granville Island in Vancouver's commercial district. If you enjoy the outdoors, the Sea to Sky corridor is a must for hiking. Whistler (one hour and a half by car from Vancouver) is pricey but famous for hosting the 2010 Winter Olympics. In the winter, enjoy the best skiing in North America, and in the summer, try out a full-service mountain bike.
ref: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more. This authentic community is located in Howe Sound just off Vancouver, and is easily accessed via scheduled water taxis departing Granville Island in downtown Vancouver. For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a trek up the Sea to Sky corridor is essential. Whistler (1.5 hour drive from Vancouver) is expensive but well-known because of the 2010 Winter Olympics. In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking.

src: ボーエン島は、カヤック、ハイキング、買い物、食事などを楽しめる日帰り旅行や週末のお出かけに人気のスポットです。 この本格的なコミュニティはバンクーバー沖のハウ・サウンドに位置し、バンクーバーの商業地区にあるグランビル島から定期的に運航している水上タクシーで簡単に訪れることができます。 アウトドアを楽しむなら、シー・トゥ・スカイ回廊のトレッキングは欠かせません。 ウィスラー（バンクーバーから車で1時間半）は物価高ですが、2010年に冬季オリンピックが開催されたことで有名です。 冬には北米で最高のスキーを楽しみ、夏には本格的なマウンテンバイクに乗ってみましょう。
mt: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend getaway spot for kayaking, hiking, shopping, and dining. This full-service community is located in Howe Sound off Vancouver and can be easily reached by a water taxi that runs regularly from Granville Island in Vancouver's commercial district. If you enjoy the outdoors, the Sea to Sky corridor is a must for hiking. Whistler (one hour and a half by car from Vancouver) is pricey but famous for hosting the 2010 Winter Olympics. In the winter, enjoy the best skiing in North America, and in the summer, try out a full-service mountain bike.
ref: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more. This authentic community is located in Howe Sound just off Vancouver, and is easily accessed via scheduled water taxis departing Granville Island in downtown Vancouver. For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a trek up the Sea to Sky corridor is essential. Whistler (1.5 hour drive from Vancouver) is expensive but well-known because of the 2010 Winter Olympics. In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking.

src: ビクトリアフォールズは、ジンバブエの西部にある町で、ザンビアのリビングストンとの国境を越えたボツワナに近くにあります。 その町は滝のすぐ隣にあるため、滝が主な観光名所ですが、冒険を求める人も観光を楽しむ人もこの人気の観光地に長期滞在することができます。 雨季（11月～3月）は水量が増え、滝はよりドラマチックになります。 橋を渡ったり、滝の近くの曲がりくねった小道を歩いたりすると間違いなく濡れます。 一方で、水量が非常に多いため、実際の滝をはっきりと見ることはできないでしょう。それだけ多くの水が流れているためです。
mt: Victoria Falls is a town in western Zimbabwe, near the border with Botswana and Zambia. The town is near the falls, which are a major tourist attraction. The rainy season (November to March) increases the water flow, making the falls more dramatic. Crossing the bridge or walking the winding path near the falls will definitely get you wet. However, the amount of water is so great that you will not be able to see the actual falls. There is just so much water flowing.
ref: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana. The town lies immediately next to the falls, and they are the major attraction, but this popular tourist destination offers both adventure seekers and sightseers plenty of opportunities for a longer stay. In the rainy season (November to March), the water volume will be higher and the Falls will be more dramatic. You are guaranteed to get wet if you cross the bridge or walk along the trails winding near the Falls. On the other hand, it is precisely because the volume of water is so high that your viewing of the actual Falls will be obscured—by all the water!

src: ビクトリアフォールズは、ジンバブエの西部にある町で、ザンビアのリビングストンとの国境を越えたボツワナに近くにあります。 その町は滝のすぐ隣にあるため、滝が主な観光名所ですが、冒険を求める人も観光を楽しむ人もこの人気の観光地に長期滞在することができます。 雨季（11月～3月）は水量が増え、滝はよりドラマチックになります。 橋を渡ったり、滝の近くの曲がりくねった小道を歩いたりすると間違いなく濡れます。 一方で、水量が非常に多いため、実際の滝をはっきりと見ることはできないでしょう。それだけ多くの水が流れているためです。

src: 通常の写真撮影に関する規則がビデオ撮影にも適用されますが、それ以上のことが求められる場合もあります。 写真撮影が許可されない場合にビデオで記録しようと考えてはいけません。 ドローンを使用する場合は、何を撮影していいのか、どのような許可や追加ライセンスが必要なのか、事前によく確認しておきましょう。 空港の付近や群衆の頭上にドローンを飛ばすことは、たとえ違法ではないとしても、ほぼ間違いなく良からぬ考えでしょう。
mt: The same rules that apply to still photography also apply to video recording, but there may be additional considerations. Do not attempt to record video where still photography is prohibited.  If you are using a drone, be sure to check beforehand what you can record, what permissions or additional licenses are required, and whether it is appropriate to fly a drone over an airport or over a crowd, even if it is not illegal.
ref: Rules regarding regular photography also apply to video recording, possibly even more so. If just taking a photo of something isn't allowed, then you shouldn't even think of recording a video of it. If using a drone, check well in advance as to what you are allowed to film and what permits or additional licensing are required. Flying a drone near an airport or over a crowd is almost always a bad idea, even if it's not illegal in your area.

src: 通常の写真撮影に関する規則がビデオ撮影にも適用されますが、それ以上のことが求められる場合もあります。 写真撮影が許可されない場合にビデオで記録しようと考えてはいけません。 ドローンを使用する場合は、何を撮影していいのか、どのような許可や追加ライセンスが必要なのか、事前によく確認しておきましょう。 空港の付近や群衆の頭上にドローンを飛ばすことは、たとえ違法ではないとしても、ほぼ間違いなく良からぬ考えでしょう。

src: 登録はビザ取得のための追加要件です。国によっては、現地当局に滞在先と住所を登録しなければならない場合もあります。 そのためには、現地警察での申請書の記入や、入国管理局への訪問が必要になる場合があります。 このような法律がある多くの国では、現地のホテルが登録を代行してくれます（ぜひ依頼してください）。 また、観光客向けの宿泊施設以外に滞在する場合にのみ登録が必要な場合もあります。ただし、法律上わかりにくい点が多いので事前に調べておきましょう。
mt: Registration is an additional requirement for obtaining a visa. In some countries, you may be required to register your address and place of stay with local authorities. This may require filling out forms at the police station or visiting the immigration office. Many countries with such laws have hotels that will register for you (please ask). However, registration may only be required if you are staying at a tourist accommodation. However, there are many unclear points in the law, so please check in advance.
ref: Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process. In some countries, you must register your presence and address where you are staying with the local authorities. This might require filling out a form with the local police or a visit to the immigration offices. In many countries with such a law, local hotels will handle the registration (make sure to ask). In other cases, only those staying outside of tourist accommodations need to register.  However, this makes the law much more obscure, so find out beforehand.

src: 旅行中にボランティア活動をするのは、いつもと違う体験ができる素晴らしい方法ですが、与えるだけの立場ではありません。 外国での生活やボランティア活動は、異文化を知り、新しい人々と出会い、自分について学び、視野を広げ、さらには新しい技術を身に付けられる優れた方法です。 また、ボランティアの仕事で部屋と食事が付き、多少の給料をもらえることも多いので、予算を増やしてどこかに長期滞在できるようにするのも良い方法です。
mt: Traveling while volunteering is a great way to have a different experience, but it's not just about giving. Living and volunteering abroad can help you learn about different cultures, meet new people, learn about yourself, broaden your horizons, and even pick up new skills. It's also a good way to increase your budget and stay somewhere for a longer period of time, as you can often get a room and food included, and sometimes even a small salary.
ref: Volunteering while travelling is a great way to make a difference but it's not just about giving. Living and volunteering in a foreign country is a great way to get to know a different culture, meet new people, learn about yourself, get a sense of perspective and even gain new skills. It can also be a good way to stretch a budget to allow a longer stay somewhere since many volunteer jobs provide room and board and a few pay a small salary.

src: 旅行中にボランティア活動をするのは、いつもと違う体験ができる素晴らしい方法ですが、与えるだけの立場ではありません。 外国での生活やボランティア活動は、異文化を知り、新しい人々と出会い、自分について学び、視野を広げ、さらには新しい技術を身に付けられる優れた方法です。 また、ボランティアの仕事で部屋と食事が付き、多少の給料をもらえることも多いので、予算を増やしてどこかに長期滞在できるようにするのも良い方法です。

src: ウォルト・ディズニー・ワールドへの旅行は、アメリカ人家族の多くにとって大巡礼のようなものでます。 「典型的」な観光は、オーランド国際空港に乗り入れ、ディズニーワールド内にあるホテルまでバスでに移動し、ディズニーワールドから出ることなく約1週間を過ごし、帰宅するというものです。 無限のバリエーションがありますが、ほとんどの人にとって「ディズニーワールドに行く」ことを話題にしていることに変わりはないのです。 eBayやCraigslistなどのオークションサイトで販売されオンラインで購入できる入場券の多くは使いかけの複数日分のパークホッパーチケットです。 これは非常に一般的な行為ですが、ディズニーでは禁止されており、チケットの譲渡はできません。
mt: A trip to Walt Disney World is a pilgrimage of sorts for many American families.  "Typical" tourism involves arriving at Orlando International Airport, taking a bus to a hotel within Disney World, and staying there for about a week without leaving Disney World and returning home.  There are infinite variations, but for most people, "going to Disney World" is a topic of conversation.  Many of the tickets sold on auction sites like eBay and Craigslist and purchased online are used multi-day Park Hopper tickets.  This is a very common practice, but Disney prohibits ticket transfers, and tickets cannot be transferred.
ref: "Traveling to Walt Disney World represents a major pilgrimage for many American families. The ""typical"" visit involves flying into Orlando International Airport, busing to an on-site Disney hotel, spending about a week without leaving Disney property, and returning home. There are infinite variations possible, but this remains what most people mean when they talk of ""going to Disney World"". Many tickets sold online through auction websites such as eBay or Craigslist are partially used multi-day park-hopper tickets. While this is a very common activity, it is prohibited by Disney: the tickets are non-transferable."

src: 紛争地域と見なされうる国への渡航を計画している人は全員が専門的な研修を受ける必要があります。 インターネットで「敵対的環境コース」について検索すると、おそらく現地企業の住所が出てくるでしょう。 コースは一般に、ここで説明しているあらゆる問題についてはるかに詳細事項まで扱い、通常は実践的な演習もあります。 コースは通常2～5日間で、ロールプレイや応急手当て、ときには武器の使い方を訓練することもあります。 荒野でのサバイバルを扱った本や雑誌は珍しくありませんが、紛争地域を扱った出版物はごくわずかです。
mt: Anyone planning to travel to a conflict zone must undergo specialized training.  Searching the Internet for "hostile environment courses" will likely yield the addresses of local companies.  Courses typically cover all the issues discussed here in much greater detail, and often include practical exercises.  They usually last two to five days and may include role-playing, first aid, and sometimes weapons training.  There are plenty of books and magazines on survival in the wilderness, but very few on survival in conflict zones.
ref: Anyone planning a visit to a country that could be considered a war zone should get professional training. A search of the Internet for 'Hostile environment course' will probably provide the address of a local company. A course will normally cover all the issues discussed here in far greater detail, usually with practical experience. A course will normally be from 2-5 days and will involve role play, a lot of first aid and sometimes weapons training. Books and magazines dealing with wilderness survival are common, but publications dealing with war zones are few.

src: 浄水処理には各種の方法があります、飲水の水質に脅威となる特定のリスクに対して効果のある高度な処理方法もあります。 1分間で沸騰する地域もあれば、沸騰するまでに何分もかかる地域もあります。 フィルターの効果には差がありますが、気になる場合は、信頼できる会社から密閉ボトル入りの水を購入することを検討してみてください。
mt: There are many ways to purify water, and there are advanced treatment methods that are effective against specific risks to the quality of drinking water. There are regions where water boils in one minute, and there are regions where it takes many minutes to boil. The effectiveness of filters varies, but if you are concerned, consider purchasing bottled water from a reputable company in sealed bottles.
ref: There are different ways of purifying water, some more effective against specific threats. In some areas boiling water for a minute is enough, in others several minutes are needed. Filters vary in effectiveness, and should you have a concern, then you should consider buying your water in a sealed bottle from a reputable company.

src: 離岸流とは、砕けて浜辺に戻ってくる引き波のことで、多くの場合、岩礁やそれに似た場所で発生します。 海底地形により、戻り波は少数の深い部分に集中しており、深海へ向かう速い流れがそこに形成される場ことがあります。 ほとんどの死因は、流れに逆らって泳ごうとする疲労によるものですが、流れに逆らって泳ぐことはおそらく不可能です。 流れから抜け出れば、泳いで戻るのはそれほど難しくありません。 二度と波に捕まらない場所を狙ってみるか、泳力に自信がないという自覚があれば、救助を待った方がいいかもしれません。
mt: Rip tides are the return of broken waves to the beach, and often occur at rocky or similar places. Due to the seabed, the return waves are concentrated in a few deep parts, and fast currents are formed there. Most causes of death are due to exhaustion from swimming against the current, but swimming against the current is probably impossible. If you can get out of the current, swimming back is not that hard. Try to find a place where you will not be caught by the waves again, or if you have no confidence in your swimming ability, wait for rescue.
ref: Rip currents are the returning flow from waves breaking off the beach, often at a reef or similar. Due to the underwater topology the return flow is concentrated at a few deeper sections, and a fast current to deep water may form there. Most deaths happen as result of fatigue trying to swim back against the current, which may be impossible. As soon as you get out of the current, swimming back is no more difficult than normally. Try aiming somewhere where you are not caught again or, depending on your skills and on whether you have been noticed, you might want to wait for rescue.

src: 離岸流とは、砕けて浜辺に戻ってくる引き波のことで、多くの場合、岩礁やそれに似た場所で発生します。 海底地形により、戻り波は少数の深い部分に集中しており、深海へ向かう速い流れがそこに形成される場ことがあります。 ほとんどの死因は、流れに逆らって泳ごうとする疲労によるものですが、流れに逆らって泳ぐことはおそらく不可能です。 流れから抜け出れば、泳いで戻るのはそれほど難しくありません。 二度と波に捕まらない場所を狙ってみるか、泳力に自信がないという自覚があれば、救助を待った方がいいかもしれません。

src: 内陸の水路に沿った散策は休日を過ごすうえで面白いテーマになるでしょう。 例えば、ロワール渓谷、ライン渓谷の城を訪れたり、趣ある街並みへ向かうドナウ川のクルーズ船に乗ったり、エリー運河でボートに乗るのもいいでしょう。 人気のあるハイキングやサイクリングのコースのルートも定めています。
mt: A walk along an inland waterway is a great way to spend a day. For example, you can visit the castles along the Rhine or the Loire valleys, take a cruise on the Danube to a picturesque town, or take a boat ride on the Erie Canal. There are also popular hiking and cycling routes.
ref: Inland waterways can be a good theme to base a holiday around. For example visiting castles in the Loire Valley, the Rhine valley or taking a cruise to interesting cites on the Danube or boating along the Erie Canal. They also define routes for popular hiking and cycling trails.

src: 北はサヘルと境界を接し、南と西は大西洋に囲まれた地域です。 女性：女性の旅行客は、実際の婚姻関係に関わらず、既婚者であると表明することをお勧めします。 指輪（あまり高そうでないもの）をしておくと効果的です。 女性は文化の違いはハラスメントと呼ばれる行為にながりうることを女性は認識しておくべきであり、尾行されたり、腕を掴まれたりするのは珍しくありません。 男性の誘いを断るときには、臆することなく毅然とした態度で自分の立場を貫きましょう（文化の違いがあろうがなかろうが、強引な誘いになびく必要はありません！）。
mt: North is bordered by the Sahara and to the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean. Women: Female travelers are advised to declare themselves married, regardless of actual marital status. Wearing a ring (not too flashy) is effective. Women should be aware that harassment can be called cultural differences, and being followed or having their arms grabbed is not uncommon. When rejecting a man's advances, be firm and unwavering in your stance (regardless of cultural differences, there is no need to be cowed by aggressive advances!).
ref: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean. Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status. It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive. Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc. Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).

ref: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean. src: 野生動物は写真家にとって最も難しいモチーフの1つであり、撮影には幸運、忍耐、経験、良い機材が揃わなければなりません。 野生動物の写真は当たり前のものと思われがちですが、一般的な写真と同じように、一枚の写真には語りつくせないほどの価値があります。 野生動物の撮影には長めの望遠レンズが必要になることが多いですが、鳥の群れや小さな生き物には別のレンズが必要になります。 珍しい動物は見つけにいものが多く、公園が商業目的での写真撮影を制限する規則を設けていることもあります。 野生動物には臆病なものも攻撃的なものもいます。環境は寒冷、高温または適応しにくいことがあります。
mt: Wild animals are one of the most difficult subjects to photograph, requiring luck, patience, experience, and good equipment. Wild animal photographs are often taken for granted, but like any other photograph, they have value beyond what can be told in a single image. Long telephoto lenses are often necessary for wild animals, but different lenses are needed for bird flocks and small animals. Rare animals are often sought after, and parks have rules limiting commercial photography. Wild animals can be shy or aggressive, and the environment can be cold, hot, or otherwise difficult to adapt to.
ref: Wildlife is among the most challenging motifs for a photographer, and needs a combination of good luck, patience, experience and good equipment. Wildlife photography is often taken for granted, but like photography in general, a picture is worth a thousand words. Wildlife photography often requires a long telephoto lens, though things like a flock of birds or a tiny creature need other lenses. Many exotic animals are hard to find, and parks sometimes have rules about taking photographs for commercial purposes. Wild animals might either be shy or aggressive. The environment might be cold, hot, or otherwise hostile.
