src: 緯度の高い場所や峠を運転する人は、雪や氷、氷点下の可能性を考慮する必要があります。 雪道や凍った道は摩擦が少なく、アスファルト道路を走るような運転はできません。 吹雪になると、ほんの短時間に足止めに十分な雪が降り積もります。 また、雪が降ったり吹きつけたり、車窓が結露や氷で覆われて視界が制限されることもあります。 一方、多くの国では氷雪の多い状況が普通ですが、交通は1年中ほぼ途切れることなく続いています。
mt: People who drive in high latitudes or over mountain passes need to consider snow and ice, and the possibility of sub-freezing temperatures. Snow-covered or icy roads have less traction than asphalt roads, and driving like you're on an asphalt road is not possible. In a snowstorm, snow can accumulate to the point of stopping in a short time. Also, snow can fall or blow, and the windows can become fogged or iced over, limiting visibility. On the other hand, in many countries, snowy conditions are normal, but traffic continues almost uninterrupted throughout the year.
ref: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures. On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt. During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time. Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows. On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.

src: 外交官でない限り、海外で働くのであれば、一般的には拠点となる国で所得税を申告しなければなりません。 所得税の仕組みは国によって異なり、税率や課税区分は国によって大きく異なります。 アメリカやカナダなど一部の連邦制の国では、所得税は連邦税と地方税の両方で課税されるため、地域によって税率や課税区分が異なることがあります。
mt: If you work abroad, you generally must file a tax return in the country where you are based. Tax systems vary by country, and tax rates and tax brackets can vary widely. In some countries, such as the United States and Canada, taxes are levied by both the federal government and the local government, so tax rates and tax brackets may vary by region.
ref: Unless you are a diplomat, working overseas generally means that you will have to file income tax in the country you are based in. Income tax is structured differently in different countries, and the tax rates and brackets vary widely from one country to another. In some federal countries, such as the United States and Canada, income tax is levied both at the federal level and at the local level, so the rates and brackets can vary from region to region.

src: 世界博覧会（通称は万国博覧会、または単に万博）は、芸術と科学を展示する大規模な国際的祭典です。 参加国は、世界の問題や自国の文化や歴史を紹介するために、国別のパビリオンで芸術的・教育的な展示を行っています。 国際園芸博覧会は、園芸に特化した催しであり、花の展示、植物園、その他植物栽培に関わるあらゆるもが展示されます。 理論的には（別の国で開催される限り）毎年開催できますが、実際にはそうではありません。 通常、これらのイベントは50ヘクタール以下の敷地で3～6か月間にわたって催されます。
mt: World's Fairs, also known as Expositions or Expos, are large-scale international exhibitions that showcase the latest in arts, architecture, industry, technology, and fashion. Participating nations display their cultures and histories, and introduce their countries' problems, through artistic and educational exhibits in national pavilions. International Garden Expositions are specialized fairs that focus on horticulture, with flower displays, botanical gardens, and other exhibits related to plant cultivation. In theory, these events can be held annually, but in practice, they are not. Typically, these events are held on a site of less than 50 hectares for three to six months.
ref: A World's Fair (commonly called World Exposition, or simply Expo) is large international festival of arts and sciences. Participating countries present artistic and educational displays in national pavilions to showcase world issues or their country's culture and history. International Horticultural Expositions are specialised events which showcase floral displays, botanical gardens and anything else to do with plants. Although in theory they can take place annually (so long as they are in different countries), in practice they are not. These events normally last anywhere between three and six months, and are held on sites no smaller than 50 hectares.

src: 公園内にいる動物の多くは人間を見慣れていますが、それでも野生動物はあくまで野生なので、餌を与えたり、驚かしたりしてはいけません。 公園当局によれば、熊や狼からは最低でも100ヤード（100メートル）、その他の野生動物からは25ヤード（25メートル）の距離を保たなければいけません！ 大人しそうに見えても、バイソン、ヘラジカ、アメリカヘラジカ、熊、そしてほぼすべての大型動物は襲ってくることがあります。 毎年、適切な距離を保たなかったために、何十人もの旅行客が負傷しています。こうした野生動物は大型で潜在的に危険であるため、縄張りに入らないようにしましょう。 また、匂いは熊などの野生動物を引き寄せるため、匂いのする食べ物の持ち運びや調理は避け、清潔なキャンプを心がけましょう。
mt: Most of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, but remember that wild animals are still wild. Park officials recommend keeping at least 100 yards (100 meters) from bears and wolves, and 25 yards (25 meters) from other wildlife! Even though they look harmless, bison, elk, American elk, bears, and almost all large animals can attack. Every year, dozens of tourists are injured because they didn't keep a safe distance. Because these wild animals are large and potentially dangerous, stay out of their territory. Also, avoid carrying or cooking food that smells, which can attract wild animals like bears, and keep your campsite clean.
ref: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed. According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals! No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack. Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space. In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
